reviews.review: one of the best science museums worldwide!. I believe it is one of the best science museums worldwide! Both kids and adults have fun with the interactive installations! I have visited the place with my family a few times and they just never get bored of it!

Amazing. Travelling with the children, we have visited many science museums, but this is special. The children and teenagers have plenty of experiments and video to try. It is not a simple museum, It is an open laboratory for future scientists 😊

The best. So much to see about so many subjects! You never stop learning.
Took us almost 3 hours but I stopped to read everything. Also the entrance is cheap. And the shop has sooo many cool gifts for little scientists

Fantastic day out for kids and adults. It was easy to catch a metro and swap to a train to get to museum, which terminated at the nearest station. It was a 10 minute uphill walk to the museum, well worth it for glorious views. We went as a family of 5 and were amazed that the 3 kids got free entry. The building itself is stunning and purpose built. The exhibits are interesting and there's plenty to do. The highlight is definitely the Amazon jungle, where you can walk through and see birds and fish in an enclosed area. The kids had a fantastic day. The only disappointment was lunch, the cafe is pretty poor given the great food you can get in Barcelona. I would thoroughly recommend a day here if the weather turns a bit cloudy and the beach isn't appealing!

A Fun Afternoon. The CosmoCaixa is an interesting an fun place to visit. There are plenty of interactive science displays to involve visitors in which are often quite large and visual and so should be appealing to a range of ages. There are also plenty of natural history exhibits and aquatic displays. The star of the show is the Submerged Amazon Forest however, this would be worth the trip on its own. We got here by taking a train to Av. Tibidabo station from Placa de Catalunya and taking a short walk from there (its uphill all the way though).
Learning has no limits. Very recommendable to learn about the history of the humanity of the corrent advances. Perfect activity to go with kids.

Interactive museum. Great for a rainy day, or if you have kids. Loads of exhibits, with focus on the rainforest, which was very interesting, specially going for a stroll in that environment, with the heat and all the sounds! It`s located on top of a steep road, so be prepared to walk a bit.

Interesting. It has a lot of nice experiments that you can play with and learn about physics and biology.There is also an interesting area - the "submerged woods" - where fish swim in the water, birds fly and I spotted also a Capybara.Must see if you're traveling with older kids.
Excellent. Excellent museum,cheap,with a variety of things to observe or to "play" with...a magic place for schools and children...
A must. must It is good good good . very well done . Good fun for big and small . A lot to learn and see. good gift shop
Great place to spend some time with kids. Great museum. Wonderful rain forest exhibit. I was disappointed that some areas were restricted just to groups or required extra fees.

Excellent for a rainy day . This is an excellent place if it is a rainy day. Our boys are 10 and 7 and they enjoyed their time immensely. There is plenty to see and touch which is essential for children of that age. The amazon forest recreation caught their imagination in particular. They also liked running up and down the five floor central spiral ramp... as did every other child there. The exhibits all have explanations in English but the wording is pitched at older children so a little help is required to simplify and keep their interest. Some of the interactive stuff as well is better for teenagers or those studying science. Finally with some other children they had a fantastic game of hide and seek - ok, that's not the point of the museum but its design is absolutely perfect for it! A final word on the restaurant. Very good food - an all you can eat buffet priced quite reasonably (13€ for adults and 8€ for children with one drink included). The food is far superior to the average fare at most museums / attractions around Europe. All in all, a great way to wile away an afternoon (plus evening if you wish as it is open till 8pm).

Fantastic surprise. After a trip up Tibidabo we thought we'd try this with our free entry from the Barcelona Cards. Was such a fun visit with loads of interactive displays for all ages (we're mid 20's!) There is a planetarium and for 4 Euros you can watch a 3d show about planets and the solar system. Such value for money and the show is really worth watching.

Epic!. Simply one of the best places to take your kids in BCN. Wonderful building that makes you want to explore it. Lovely outdoor spaces, reasonably priced cafe with good eats. Loads of interactive stuff that's really interesting for all ages. The rainforest is awesome!

Good spot to learn some science. This is a very good place to explore science and nature. The Amazon rainforest replica is amazing and it gives you a chance to view a real-life, flesh-and-blood, capybara (the largest rodent in the world). Various interactive science experiments make this a great place for kids of all ages.
Very good museum. Very good museum to spent a day with kids. They enjoyed a lot with various activities of the museum.

Great place. Really nice place especially for kids. We were adults only and were very impressed by the creative way they showed that science is interesting. There is a big replica of Amazona jungle with some real animals and plants. There is also a big aquarium with giant fishes. The tickets were cheap in my opinion, I think they were 4 euro per adult. Go and see it it's worth it. You can go there in a rainy day and you don't have to buy tickets online because there wasn't a queue like in other tourist attractions.

interesting for kids and adults. A great place to visit for families! A lot of space, with facinating and interesting things that you can interact with. We spendt hours there. You can stock up on energy on the cafe and restaurant. You have to buy special tickets for the limited activites, and they fill up some time in advance. Bying tickets online in advance, is recommended.

GREAT place for kids. This is one of the better kids' hands-on museums I've seen. Good explanations and descriptions for the exhibits, a nice combination of traditional exhibits and living exhibits (all of the fish/reptiles seemed quite happy and well cared-for), and the amazon jungle is stunning. The cafeteria's food is hardly inspired though - I would recommend your bringing in a picnic lunch.

Stunning Amazona jungle. The museum was impressive overall. The indoor replica of the Amazona rain forest with its biodiversity alone is a reason to visit. We visited as a couple and my girlfriend was afraid it was geared too much towards children. However, the displays were varied and offered extensive information, especially on fossils, geology and physics. Kids can definitely enjoy themselves with live experiments, but this is not a place that ONLY caters for kids with simple stuff.

A really cool place especially if it is raining. It was raining all day and we decided to go to cosmo caixa. It was the right choice cause it was very interesting for kids and adults. Interactive station where you can learn history,physics or nature. The best part was the big rainforest area with the humongous fishes. The entrance is quiet cheap, 4 Euros .
Worth visiting. Take your kids there and educate them and why not yourself about science and environment. LOvely space with nice gardens and plenty of activities.

A must see!!. This place made me speechless!! This how you come to love the Earth. Not going here you will really miss something. The entrance is only €4 so that can not be an excuse for not paying a visit. Just go there also if you do not have children. This museum is for everybody! Go and check it out!

Informative, creative, eye-catching. We were determined to find this place after having failed 5 years earlier, but, with the aid of internet etc, it was easy. That said the entrance into the building itself and getting tickets was somewhat bewildering. You start at the top on level 0 and work your way down to the bottom on level -5. There is lots to see, including a large patch of rainforest with sea life at the bottom. There are also lots of interactive displays and the descriptions on some of the physics are brilliant - I wish I had something like that when I was at school! There were a number of school parties there when we were. Definitely worth a visit.

Great museum. This is a great museum not just for young adults, but also for everyone who likes science and experiments. The interactive displays and experiments were very fun and educative. We were there on a weekday, so it was not crowded, and also no waiting time like the other attractions.

Superb. One of most positive suprises.At 5euro a head You would think it's propably nothing special but once You see what they have on offer You will change Your mind.Rain forest,animals,fishes better than the Aquarium for fraction of price.Plenty of things to do.We only had 2hrs as we were heading to Park Guell and could not spent more time as we wished.If You have kids make sure You take 4-5hrs or even a whole day as there are so many attractions for everyone.Superb place,one of the best in town:)

Amazing. One of the most amazing this to see. Their rain forest is superb and unbelievable, their 'experiments' are truly amazing. We stayed there for 4 hours and had the most amazing experience. For 4 € it is well worth it, you will see some amazing things!

Good entertainment for the kids. We have two kids under 10. So we decided to pick this museum as a place for us all to spend some time.This review is written from the perspective of someone visiting the museum on a Monday-Friday. There is a BIG difference if you go on the weekends, that is they open all the floors.Because we went on a weekday, they only open one of the four floors to the public (we didn't know this). That meant the exhibitions were open but the interactive stuff like the touch ponds, creative section, planetarium (about space) were closed.Even though that was the case, the kids still found ways to use three hours in the fifth floor.What is most amazing is the rainforest exhibit. The museum has recreated a greenhouse that has birds, fish and some animals in a replica format to a jungle. Truly amazing and was the highlight of the visit.Food in the cafeteria is very average, so don't expect much there.Getting there is easy, the suburban line to the brown line Ave Tibidabo station then a ten minute walk up the hill.I recommend it for families but try and go on the weekend.
Worth a visit, fantastic views. Really interesting museum, the rainforest exhibit is excellent. The views from the terrace is superb.
Great experience !. Excellent science experience. Fixed exposition with changing sección. Great for children, lot of touch and feel see experiments...

Great place to take the kids on a hot day. really enjoyable science museum and well laid out. Shame that some of the extracurricular activities cost to participate and are on at only certain hours of the day.

Hard to find, poor service, failed to impress overall. As it came free with the Barcelona Card, we decided to visit CosmoCaixa. We got started off on the wrong foot as this place is EXTREMELY difficult to find. We exited the L7 train, and down through the tunnels there were tons of signs and murals screaming to go visit CosmoCaixa. But when we got onto the street, no signage was to be seen. We walked around a bit and found a sign that pointed east for CosmoCaixa. We followed that for a block or two, only to find a sign that pointed west for CosmoCaixa. Perplexed, we backtracked and turned, only to find yet another sign, pointing south for CosmoCaixa (these were all relatively near a single roundabout by the exit of the train station). Having my Google map in hand, which indicated that CosmoCaixa was actually north of the station, we ignored that sign, and walked north. We soon found another sign insisting we were going in the wrong direction, and saying to head south. We ignored that one too. We then finally found CosmoCaixa when we crossed the street that, according to Google Maps, it was on. After about 25-30 minutes of searching. So, be warned – ignore the useless street signs, and use a map instead. This was difficult enough to find, even with a map. Our guess was that perhaps the signs were meant for drivers, not walkers, and maybe they were pointing to parking lots? Who knows?So we entered the museum, and got our tickets but were offered no map or other information. So we were wandering around blindly, clearly visiting rooms out of sequence. There were lots of rooms listed on the walls on various floors but most doors were closed. Were we supposed to go in? We didn’t if the doors were closed. Again, who knows?The planetarium shows were mostly done for the day but we saw they had one at 18h, so we wandered around exploring the geology/marine/science areas until then. They were okay, nothing out of the ordinary. Some signage was available in English, while much was only in Catalan and Spanish. We then went back up to registration to inquire as to whether tickets were needed for the 18h show, and they said there was no such show. We insisted that the signage by the planetarium advertises a show for 18h, and they said that was only in August (this was 2 Sept when we were there). So that was another disappointment. They need to update their displays so people don’t waste time hanging around for shows that aren’t happening.As can be expected with a place like this, there were tons of kids at CosmoCaixa. No problem with that – if they are respectful. When my wife or I were at an exhibit, often a kid would run up in front of us and push buttons, while we were engaged with the exhibit. Not once was there an apology from a parent. Often we didn’t see the parents around at all. The complexity of the descriptions of some of the items indicate that this is a place both for children and adults, so I really wish all parents could keep a watch on their kids and teach them to be respectful of others. This isn’t the museum’s fault of course, but it is a reality to be cognizant of when visiting CosmoCaixa.Relatively speaking we thought it was not crowded at all, so Friday evening would seem to be a good time to go. Definitely highly recommended for kids, as well as science-minded adults.

Amazing. An absolutely amazing science museum, combining biology, chemistry, physics, geology and even some zoology and marine biology. The artificial Amazon Rain-forest alone itself is worth a look. At 4 Euros per adult, you simply cannot go wrong.
Science. Interesting place for adults and children. Activities to discover nature and phenomena. Amazonian forest and that huge tree in the middle of the stairs!

A place to visit for children!. This is a very interested both for adults and children, very educational and interesting place. We also visited planetarium, watched a movie about for children about air-planes creation, myself and my daughter loved it a lot.
Interesting. A good place for 2-3 hours of science.A lot of experiments to be done, different education programs and activities for kids too.

Awsome !. One of the best things we did So much to learn and understand ideal for all ages. Need time so make sure you keep this a day activity.The place is isolated and getting taxis is hard from the venue but a few kms down the road you may get Taxi. They have great activities for kids however need to plan and book early. Unfortunately when we went the activities were fully booked but we still learn t a lot and thoroughly enjoyed. Would definitely visit the museum the next time I am in that part of the world !

ENTERTAINING. We visited this place at the last minute browsing on trip advisor . We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves THE 3D movie was very educational and also entertaining . we wondered around touched and played with many of the science gadgets. the wildlife section was ok,but in all it was a fun visit.Time does fly when your there.

Wow. Fascinating interactive museum exploring everything from prehistory to the evolution of humanity and natural laws, a huge number of experiments to try and things to have a go at, an amazing indoor flooded rainforest and a great family-friendly day!

Reference museum in Barcelona. Nice exhibitions and activities. totally recomended for those loving culture and arts. Not recomended for turists that want to see Spanish tradition or local culture. Its a must if you libe in Barcelona. Can be skiped by short time travels.

Amazing nature and science museum for young researchers.. I would recommend to visit this place to all the parents with children of 7-15 age. There are a lot of things which you can touch, try, spin, pull, press... all in all, do anything you want to understand the laws of physics, chemistry, and other nature phenomenon. We loved the 3D planetarium and the tropical forest. Note that the normal visit ticket does not include the planetarium tickets. If you want to see the movie in it, you should tell about this when you purchase the tickets for the entrance, There are a few sessions, and you will be offered the time to choose from.

Interesting Visit. The CosmoCaixa is a family day out when visiting Barcelona. There is a Planetarium (the show we saw was 2D although I believe there are 3D ones as well), there are lots of interesting interactive science displays and most impressive is the real life amazon rain forest complete fish, snakes, birds and trees. The restaurant and cafeteria are very good quality.All in all a good day out.

Hidden place. This place is a bit off road for the conventional tourist. Most people you'll encounter here are Spanish. But still most information is provided in English to so you should definitely go. The place is a combination of a science center and a zoo, with some great rainforest exhibits. The place is very well maintained, lots of information and great displays. It is certainly worth a visit when you are around to visit other things on the neighbouring hill.

Excellant. Great experience for all the family. A hands on science trip taking you through evolutionary history to modern day science. The Amazon rain forest is amazing with real fish which look almost prehistoric.At 4 euros entrance or free if you have a caixa bank card it is a must when visiting Barcelona.
fun for all ages. it doesnt matter if you are a kid, teen or adult, you'll learn and have fun with anything here, i`'ve visited many times since i was little and always enjoy it.

Science centre. Visited here while on holiday, well worth the 4 euro admission fee, only downside was we didn't allow enough time to really appreciate how good it was. We were unable to get to the planatarium because we had booked tickets to park gruell. Cafeteria in centre was very reasonably priced and offered a good variety of choices. Defo worth a visit.

Great experience for young and teenage kids. One rare place in Europe to visit with young and teenage kids if you want to show a general view of the history of the Earth and natural sciences. Free with the Barcelona Card. Similar to Csodák Palotája in Budapest, though not as up-to-date and comprehensive as the Palais de la découverte in Paris or Naturhistorisches Museum in Vienna. Nothing has changed since last June...
Little known but wonderful. A great museum with interesting scientific exhibits, many very hands-on fun experiments and an incredible indoor rainforest. Great!

Great treat !. What a nice surprise it was! From Passeig de Gracia, it is about a 7 euros taxi ride. A beautiful Modern Museum with lots to do for small and big children. A little rain forest stands tall in the middle of the venue with wild birds, fish and reptiles. If you want to get away from the craziness of Barcelonetta or Gotico, this trip will sure be of good entertainment and it is always pure happiness to see children unravel mysteries of a time long long ago. Make sure to spend the extra 4 euros per person to see the 3D show inside the Planetarium. The original entry fee to the Museum is 4 euros for adults and totally free for kids under 16. They also have a Cafeteria, but I would not recommend it.

Great fun for young and old but buy additional activity tickets upon arrival. We weren't expecting much for the €4 price tag but this place was brilliant. There are plenty of interactive exhibits and the rain forest was particularly interesting. Make sure when you initially arrive to review the additional activities and times, we missed out on a few exhibits which was disappointing.

Worth a visit. This science museum is great for adults and children. There are lots of hands on experiments. The rain forest is fantastic, you can see below the water and above it when you walk through.
Fun for kids. My daughter loved all the machines and i liked the educational aspect of it. Both me and my kid got wiser while simply playing with these ;-)

Has potential, a little disappointing. We were looking forward to this for weeks- we visit the science museum of every city we visit- but this one sadly fell a little short of expectations. It was mostly because they didn't explain at the entry that most of the cool exhibits (Toca Toca ("touch touch", the hands-on exhibit), and the creativity building one) need extra tickets and are only held in english once a day. By the time we found them (the museum is 5-6 floors!), we'd unfortunately missed the showing. The museum isn't at all expensive so it would have been worth paying extra for, but we just weren't told how it worked. For the first time ever, the kids complained that a science museum wasn't fun. But if you check ahead and get tickets for the fun stuff on time, I bet you'd have a great time. On the plus side- almost all the exhibits have been translated into english and I found them well-done. The best part is the gorgeous architecture of the building.

Great hands-on science museum. I wish I had more time to spend at the CosmoCaixa. It's a great science museum! It's full of hands-on experiments that really help kids (and adults too I guess!) learn about science in a fun way. Definitely recommend!

Excellent Museum. This was a great museum and a very cheap attraction for Barcelona.Entrance for two adults and two children was only €8 in total (children go free).The museum is large with plenty of outdoor areas to walk around or let the children play. It offers a wide variety of exhibitions focuses on science, nature and history. There is a good balance of hands-on activities to keep all ages entertained.Great aquarium area with rainforest effects.Both our boys loved it and would be keen to visit again. We'd definitely recommend to anyone.
Great afternoon with Kids. Took our 4 and 2 year old. They loved the animal area where they were able to touch and learn about the animals. Reasonably priced and nice treat after touring for 4 days.

This is a nice place to visit even though you are 3 y.o or 30 y.o. While I visited Cosmo Caixa, I wanted to come back to school time again. I do excited the experiments of physics and biology. I learnt a lot of things from there.Tip: If you have a Caixa bank card, you can access for free.
Very good experince for all ages / and for a smal entrance fee. A very genuine travel during evolution / some very good set/ups to show&explain different behaviour in nature
Great for kids. Fantastic place to spend the day with your children, they will be able to experiment, 'touch' science and see rainforest animals

Superb science museum that was fun for all. Having been to Barcelona many time without children, I never knew about how many child-friendly attractions the city has to offer. Cosmo Caixa was one of those places. A beautifully designed museum that combines modern design and architecture with a fun, interactive way to learn about science, this was one of the unexpected highlights of our trip. My kids loved the indoor rainforest and 3D film while I enjoyed the simple permanent exhibits. Would love to go back and have the kids participate in the numerous activities and workshops they host on a daily basis.
Nice neighbourhood. It´s a very nice corner to visit. I liked it even more than the Gotic Barri. They are next to each other so you can visit both the same day.

Makes learning super fun and exciting!. I am not a science girl whatsoever but I've been to this place a couple of times and I can't seem to get enough of it, I just love how fun it is and how much you can learn without even realizing. Definitely recommend this place!

Imaginative, innovative and exciting. My guidebook mentioned this modern museum as a sort of offbeat aside to all the mediaeval buildings, beaches and weird architecture more typically associated with Barcelona. Because wildlife and nature are my strongest interests I thought I'd see what it's like and I'm very glad I did.This ultra modern complex is found some way out in a salubrious suburb of the city. Upon arrival, I was not sure if it reminded me most of a university campus or an airport. My next surprise was the entry fee - just €4. When I consider that I had paid approaching 5 times as much to enter the mediocre zoo and aquarium and the dismal Poble Espanol this was frankly amazing and I briefly wondered if the content was going to be as minimal as the price.Not so.CosmoCaixa is jam packed with fascinating and imaginatively presented exhibits covering all aspects of science and nature on several floors of a vast, dynamic, open-plan space. You start. Y descending to the ground in a wide and seemingly endless spiral walkway with glass sides, which is fascinating in itself. Once in the museum proper, you'll find many of the exhibits use interactive techniques to engage the viewer which, from what I saw of the many children who were present and some of us adults, seemed to be going down a treat!The biggest exhibit and, of course, my favourite, was the massive indoor rainforests which spans all floors on one side of the complex. Brilliantly imagined, it can be viewed from many angles, from below the water, where plants, fish and turtles love in the tropical soup, to the twisted treetops and everything between.Very exciting and worth at least half a day. A world class museum.

Small but very good - especially for children. Walked down from Tibadabo. Most of the attractions are on one floor - standard science museums items with lots of buttons to press. Lots of children but not too busy. Bonus is tropical forest area with simulated rain. Good little café.

A brilliant bargain - Don't miss this if you have kids!. We've just been on our 2nd visit with our kids and I am already looking forward to my next visit. Simply the best museum / science / art experience you can have in Barcelona and at an absolute bargain price. It cost just 4 euro's for adults and is free for kids and you can comfortably spend 3 - 4 hours here and still not see everything. Don't be put off by the location! It's very easy to get here if you know how, although I couldn't find clear instructions the first time so this should help :-Go via metro on the L7 line right to the end (Av. del Tibidabo stop) - We went from Placa Catalunya and it is covered on a T10 ticket.When you come out of the metro station look across the road where the hill starts to go up. You need the 2nd bus stop up on the right. Walk past the Tram stop where there's normally a big queue, it's the next one up you need - the 196 bus, although it doesn't say that on the bus stop so don't panic)Again you can use your T10 ticket on the ticket reader on the bus and it counts as the same journey - you don't need to speak to the driver (With my terrible pronunciation he never has a clue where I say I'm going!)Stay on the bus all the way to the top where it turns round and comes back down in a loop that goes right past CosmoCaixa (It will be on your right as you go back down)If you press to stop the bus as soon as you see it there's a stop 2 mins walk past it - There's a big U-Boat in the middle of the road here too and then you're there.You can walk up the hill in about 15 mins but it's very hot and tiring for kids and you'll be doing lots of walking when you get into CosmoCaixa, so avoid if possible. If you do walk, go up the hill on the left hand side of the road and take the first left which will take you straight there.As for the place itself it is simply massive, air conditioned and never crowded - absolute bliss to escape the city crowds and loads of room for your kids to run about. I won't go through everything that's there (Check the website) but some of the highlights are a complete amazon rainforest with snakes, tropical fish and birds, loads of interactive hands on science stuff, a planetarium, art, fossils and prehistoric man, geology - something to interest everyone. It's great if you get a rare rainy day, but also great to cool down on a hot day too.There's a decent cafe there but it can get busy - we take our own picnic and there are loads of places to eat both indoor and outdoor. Be prepared for a lot of walking as there is so much to see, but having paid loads for 'family' tickets at most other museums and attractions this is superb value and thoroughly entertaining. Would recommend this place to all ages but if you have kids they'll absolutely love it while learning loads too.

Well worth a visit!. Beware - plenty of walking in order to see the whole thing.. can take anything from 1-2 hours to a full afternoon depending on whether you're with kids (who rush through just to see the 'cool stuff') or if you're adults meandering slowly through...

Wonderful museum; especially for kids. I have been to many science museums and I have to say that this has to be one of the best. I have been here several times with my son since he was about 2 with the last visit being last week (July 2016). It has something for all ages and is very interactive with lots of buttons to press. In fact my son loves it so much it is sometimes hard to keep up with him as he rushes from one display to the next. If you have time to stop and read the text next to each display you will find them also in English. Probably the most impressive part is the flooded forest, which although small does a good job of recreating a little bit of rain forest with accompanying fauna (look out for the leaf-cutter ants fascinating!). Apart from the permanent exhibition area there are usually at least 2 other temporary exhibits. At the moment one is about scientific research and the other about the evolution of hominids. You will also find a large open area (I think it is on level -2) where you can sit outside and eat a picnic or if you prefer you can go to the restaurant or cafe nearby. There are activities for children which have to be booked and paid for in advance, one is called Click and is basically an interactive playroom, and the other is called " Toca Toca", which gives you the opportunity to touch some animals and learn something about them. There is also a planetarium which I haven't visited yet.As fas as negatives are concerned: It can get really overcrowded on busy days which would inevitable spoil your experience, so it's best to go during the week in the afternoon with kids or during term time if you are visiting without children. The gift shop has some really nice things but unfortunately is incredibly overpriced even by normal gift shop standards. Also, the layout of the building takes a bit of getting used to as the entrance is at the top and you go down to visit the exhibitions. I would recommend using the lift and consulting the plan of the building which is next to it. Finally, the location is a bit out of the way and quite far from the centre of Barcelona. After trying various options I think the best way of getting there is to get the green metro line to Vall d'hebron, and then get the bus H4 which leaves you within a 5 minute walk of the museum.

Great exhibits, stunning rainforest . Excellent science exhibits and a beautiful Amazonian rainforest habitat. Great for kids and adults alike - also really good value (€4 each when I visited)! Book the tickets online before visiting if you can, as the queues can be long.
Fantastic!. Brilliant day out, a must see in Barcelona! Really enjoyed the Amazonian rainforest exhibit, the aquarium and animals were a great addition.
Love it!. It is a big place, a bit far from the city center but it is nice to go there. And then from there you can visit Tibidabo . The hill on top of Barcelona. 100% Recomended

Unexpectedly beautiful. I must say that I was completely caught by surprise concerning this attraction. I thought it was a boring building only worth to look outside but this was an enormous complex with many things to be seen.If one likes museums of biology history, it has many sites to see. But as for me, I prefer living things. The bottom of the building has live animals both in water and in land. It simulates a tropical humid climate. Just amazing.The bottom also has many scientific experiments to try.

Interesting and educational. Been at this place with my family. Children and adults alike will surely enjoy this visit. the entrance ticket is also inexpensive and appropriate. You need at least four to five hours to cover the whole museum.

Great for teenagers/adults interested in science. We were originally doing Barcelona in 1 day, and although we came across this museum, and it was in our top 10, the location made it problematic to include. However, we had a spare couple of hours travelling from Girona to an evening flight in El Prat, and this fitted in nicely. Every display is in English also, but try get a map if you can.I will try not to repeat some of the points raised by others.Children up to age 16 are free and it is only €4 for adults. Customers of the bank La Caixa seem to get free entry also. There is a surcharge for activities but many have to be booked in advance so look up details on the website. There are 5 floors, but -5 is the main floor - huge, with fascinating science experiments what were suitable for all ages. The amazon rain forest was the highlight for us all - check out my photos. My daughter loved seeing the real animals and amazing fish.The restaurant closes around 4pm; it has an all you can eat buffet that looked good for €13.50 for adults and €8.50 for children. There is a small cafe that stays open later. On the day we were there, main museum was open till 8pm.We did not research parking, but it seemed difficult to get free on street, so we went to the designated underground which lets you access the museum directly. Was about EUR2.50 per hour to park.Overall,one of the best science museums I have been too. Allow 2-3 hours minimum, and be prepared for lots of walking.

Great place to visit with family on a rainy or very hot day. this is an interactive museum that is great for kids and families. there are a lot of additional events as well that you need to register, so come early and register for them as they are great fun, such as touching animals or insects, a movie experience, etc

Absolutely entertaining and worth the time!. It's amazing how for 4 EUR you could get in here. We planned only a quick visit but ended up being there for three hours (and we are two adults). The museum is in five floors but most of the things to see are in the bottom floor. The rain forest was fun and I couldn't believe the birds could just walk around there. And all the science stuff: rocks, laws of physics, etc. - it was very interesting and set up in a fun way. If you're interested in science, I think this is a must - just go straight to the bottom floor!

AMAZING. From walking in the main door the whole place was interactive and very fun. Even for 19 year olds it was still fascinating and learning. The rainforest was great and all exhibits were with English captions as well and it's such amazing value for money. Easy to get to using the metro but does require walking up a fairly big hill but so so worth it. Only €4 can't believe it!
ok. it was good but we did not know which tickets to buy, for which workshop, more for locals. in that time was some robot competition and was closed one floor.

Brilliant day out in Barca. Loved this place. Only 4 euros entry and at least 3 hours of fun. My bf is a scientist but I know little about science and we both loved it. The living rainforest is incredible and most of the exhibits are interactive (and the signs are all in English too). Great for adults and kids alike. Cafe was cheap and nice.

Fantastic Value and great experience. We went here because the zoo and the aquarium were very expensive for a large family. Children are free in the museum and it is only €4 for adults. The is a surcharge for activities (such as holding animals tour) but many have to be booked in advance so look up details on the website. The ground floor was filled with fascinating science experiments what were suitable for all ages. The amazon rain forest was the highlight for my children as they loved seeing the real animals and amazing fish.The restaurant was a big hit; it has an all you can eat buffet that is very tasty and excellent value. €13.50 for adults and €8.50 for children. This includes salads, a wide selection of main courses a drink and a dessert. Many gluten free options are available too.Our best day out in Barcelona!

Great activity - a must see when in Barcelona. The museum is a great experience for anyone with or without kids. Activities vary and can be enjoyed by people of all ages. I went there to spend a day and learn something new.I would recommend that you enquire about the extra activities such as the planetarium at the ticket sales office, as they are not available the whole day, but at certain times. The entry fee is very reasonable and the museum range of expositions could occupy you for the whole day. There is as well a restaurant and a beautiful outside area where you can take a break and relax.

Quick visit to this amazing museum!. A bit of a trek from our AirBnB on Carrer de Girona. Nearest Metro stop was L3 line, still 20 minute walk to museum. (We took taxi back, catching from taxi stand at Pl. John F.). Entrance for under 16 free. Teachers free too! (Including doctors who teach at medical school!) Otherwise only €4. Amazing museum. Huge. Kids loved it (15, 13, 12, 11). Eclectic place. We saw only a small fraction of the museum in our two hours there. Hands on options everywhere. Rainforest exhibit truly spectacular. Did not have time to see 3D feature. We'll go back if we have time!

Science Museum with a twist. This place is strange, it's difficult to describe but it is worth a visit. It's a science museum with a large variety of exhibitions that involve nature, science, and space. In one display there is stone age tools alongside modern kitchen utensils, in the next display there is fossils of trilobites and the next an active mini tornado! A lot of the displays are interactive in some way, which makes it much more engaging for all. It has a planetarium and short 3D films about space and the history of flight.It's very cheap to enter, just 4 euros per person but extra for the 3D films.There's an area of indoor tropical rainforest with live animals living in it. You can view them from outside through the glass and you can even walk through a section of it on a pathway.It's such a mix of old and new, science and nature, hi tech and ancient, that there is something for everyone.

Best museum ever seen. Fantastic Science Museum fun for kids and great entertainment for adults. The admission is free (unbelievable) and they offre stretched opening hours. Highly interactive, it will take longer that a full day so it's better to visit it more than once. Extremely accurate, very good captions and explanations. I was really impressed. There's even a REAL rainforest inside! Do not miss a visit to the museum shop.
A wonderful place. Even though you will walk like a camel it's worth there is a lot to view up there, just find the right bus to take you there

visit with two 11 year old boys was fun!. the interactive floor was a lot of fun with my 2 11 year old boys. Laid out well. All hands on. A lot of fun to pick things up, see them float, hit the button, etc. the rainforest was not particularly great, but it was still fun. they had a few fun animals and fish but the walk through was a bit disappointing. It's not an expensive outing so that was nice for an afternoon (as opposed to the zoo or the aquarium which seemed rather pricey to me but very well done). It's worth an afternoon. Great for a rainy afternoon if you get one!

Definately worth seeing!. Although it is a bit far from the city centre and you need to put some effort to get there, if you don't have a car... it's worth it! Starting with The garden (which wasn't blooming, since Ivisited it in January), then interesting expositions, animals (kapibara!) in the flooded forest, a lot of interesting experiments, not onlhy for the kids. Also, the object is on the hill - meaning nice view :)

Hands on practical science. The ticket was 3.8e and it's definitely worth the price.The museum is full activities/experiments that you can try in order to understand different concept/laws.The aquarium and the amazonian forest are impressive. You can easily spend 3 hours in there.Also the restaurant is cheap and it has good food. It was an all you can eat bufet with one drink included and desert for 13.75e.

Fascinating science museum at the outskirts of Barcelona. CosmoCaixa is located far from the city center and thus far from most of the other major attractions (with the exception of Tibidabo), but if you are interested in science you should take your time and visit there nonetheless. Take metro line L7 from Placa Espanya to Avinguda Tibidabo (end of line). From there is only a short walk uphill to CosmoCaixa. Most of the museum is underground. The visit starts on the lower 5th floor! There you can do a lot of hands-on experiments pertaining to various fields of physics, take a look at the massive Mur Geològic (Geological Wall) or walk through the Bosc Inundat (Inundated Forest), a re-creation of a flooded Amazonian forest. There you can see various plant and animal species such as caimans, poisonous snakes or the huge arapaimas. From time to time, you can even experience a tropical rainshower pouring down (but its area is limited so you won't get wet).

Great Gallery . Great range and presentation of exhibitions. Wonderful gallery space which I clean organised and with multi lingual informed staff. Worth booking tickets to specialist exhibitions online in advance. Facilities available in site are good and suitable for all ages.

Imaginative, varied museum. CosmoCaixa is best reached by metro if you're using public transport. It's a huge building which is impossible to miss. At the entrance there are toilets and lockers and a ticket desk. Entrance fee was 4 euros which is amazingly cheap considering.All the exhibits have been thought about and feel original. There is a mechanical device which lifts up sycamore seeds then drops them, next to some information about pollen distribution. There is a stroboscope on a water stream, next to information about surface tension. There is a tube which visibly loops around the entire building. You talk into one end then a second later hear yourself out the other. And on and on. Lots of simple scientific concepts being demonstrated in fun and entertaining ways.The floors above -5 are either function rooms or only open certain times or for special events. This wasn't made at all clear to us and so we ended up wandering for a bit, finding out for ourselves that everything was shut.This was annoying and disappointing. Surely you could have a map or quick explanation at the ticket desk? If you go be sure to ask this before going in!The shop had a lot of interesting things, though mostly it was just standard science shop stuff, "laboratories for kids" that kinda stuff. Well priced though.Overall I'd definitely recommend going. Adults and kids will find this fun and interesting. Try and go when there are going to be less kids running around, and remember to ask where's open at the ticket desk.

Excellent day out. Great value for money. Would definitely recommend a trip out there. We were on a day out minus the kids and thoroughly enjoyed but the kids would have been occupied for hours. Even though you could see large groups going in once you were inside it felt really spacious.A great variety of things to see from a mini aquarium to electronic devices.What this does show is a way for a day out at affordable prices and puts the likes of blue planet aquarium in the UK to shame.

Great place for kids and adults. The experience here is like in no other museum. Tests, curiousities, lights, fun, tropical forest, mountain forest, animals...will male you want to spend here a day and come back on your next trip to Barcelona. This place shouldn't be miss and should be advertised more.

Great Visit.... We had two hours to visit but we could have easily stayed longer. We rushed through a lot and missed quite a bit. The set up was so beautiful. So much attention to detail. All I kept thinking was that I wished my nephews were there too to see what I was seeing. My favorite exhibit was the Flooded Rainforest and the sea life that resided in there.

Great with kids!. CosmoCaixa is a great budget option to go to with your kids. The nature-science museum is very interactive and even has an indoor Amazon jungle which is very fun. I visited with my two young nephews and they loved it.

Very educative . This is a very good place to take your kids. Many info, experiments and thinks to see. Is a mix between a museum of sciences and a workshop. The perfect way to spend two hours with family and not only. A lot to see a lot to learn. The price is very small and the value is high. For a rainy day it is perfect. Some of the programs are timed, i suggest to check online to be sure you don't miss a projection or a guided tour.

Interesting for all ages. This museum is aro7nd 5 to 6 floors. They have a programme for kids indoors as well as outdoors. They have many interesting science facts to read and see and even experience. The cafe outdoors got a nice yet limited menu.Worth the Visit.

So much fun!. We spent one afternoon in this great place and it was not enough !. My 16 and 11 year old children had a fantastic time. So many ways to learn about science and having so much fun. And for adults too (age or education level don't matter in this place, sure there will be something for you to learn or experience ). If you get hungry there is caffe shop on lovely terrace . And it is mostly indoors , so if it is a rainy day in Barcelona this is a great place to visit. Science is a real fun in this place! Highly recommend.

Called in on the way down from Tibidabo. I'm not overly interested in science but had heard that this place was good fun so on a trip back from Tibidabo my friends and I called in. It was around 4 euros to enter and we spent a good couple of hours there playing on the interactive displays. I particularly enjoyed sitting by the 'Flooded Forest' watching the birds, fish and capybara. There's lots to do here to keep adults and children entertained, so would recommend a visit whether it be on your way to or from Tibidabo.

Super awesome experience!. Great museum. Very well made and really interesting. We were told that 3 hours should be enough, but its not! Specially if you get hungry and go grab a bite, which was also very good. Tasty food.

Great experience, would highly recommend.. We took our 6 year old here and he just loved the place. He was so fascinated by so many things here, even though he is too young to understand most of them yet, but the fact that he could touch and feel things was really fun for him. Most of the theories were interactive and that was the best part about it for him. The day we went, there was huge group of school children there, it made the place really busy and cramped. We would have enjoyed more if it was a little less busy, but nevertheless, it was a great experience. It was really reasonable to enter. €4 for adult and free for children upto16 years old. We also booked a planetarium show about the history of aviation; my son loves planes so we had to see this. It was €4 per person, including children. We were given 3D glass and headphones for translation to English. The screen was dome shaped. The show stared and we had major trouble making our headphones work. Mine did not work the whole time. The show was so fascinating and interesting. It was really amazing to watch. Great experience, would highly recommend.

Perfect for a rainy day. Even though the museum targets mostly kids me and my boyfriend both had lots of fun here. Think we spent about three hours here, of which 1.5 must have been spent on the bottom floor. The rainforest installation is rather impressive. We tried all of the experiments, learned some things and generally had a good time here. Best of all is the price! It must be the cheapest museum in the whole of Barcelona and if you have a bank account at LaCaixa you get in for free.

Excellent science museum. Excellent science museum for children and adults.You can stay in all the day long.There is a picnic areaChildren friendlyLots of activities to chooseBuy tickets in advance online to get space and better prices
Must visit. Must visit place at Barcelona. Closed at Mondays. You can go there with Hop on Hop Off busses. It's a bit far from city center.

Interesting Science Mueseum, my 2 kids truly enjoyed it. Many hands-on experiences, which delighted my 12 yrs old son, his elder sister enjoyed the Amazonian eco-system while I spent about 3 hours in a learning atmosphere. Best way to get there is by metro, about 7 min by foor from Av. Tibidabo station

a fantastic science museum!. we sort of went to this museum as almost an afterthought and were extremely surprised at how impressive this museum is and also that it cost VERY little for admission... for travelers that have been to several other science museums this one ranks right with all others I've been to, including the Boston Museum of Science for example. This is a great family, rainy day attraction to see, as it is very inexpensive and geared to all ages. Don't sleep on this attraction, it was well worth going and I was impressed by this museum.

Interesting experience. This is a museum full of surprises and adventures, dedicated to the world of science and nature, as the flooded forest shows.A place where children learn and older enjoy watching him. Where you can enjoy exhibitions of all kinds, and also where you can eat very well.highly recommended museum.

An amazing interactive science museum. If you like science (and even if you don't) this place is well worth the trip out from the centre of the city. All the exhibits are eye catching and informative from the amazing entrance way which is a huge spiral ramp down into the museum to the replica amazon rain forest with birds and fish all at eye level.

Piranhas, planets and pendulums. Great Museum, especially with kids, but interesting for the adults as well. The building is great after it's renovation with a large spiral ramp down the center of the 5 stories. Starting at the bottom, there is an enormous 2/3 story open area with exhibits, many of them taking advantage of the tall ceilings (like the pendulum slowly shifting and knocking down bars showing time).Interestingly, they also have an exhibition called toca toca, where children (and adults) can see and touch animals. It was not expected in a science museum, but well done and fit with the living tropical forrest on display.Our half day was not enough so we will be back as soon as possible.

Amazing value - world class science museum - don't miss the restaurant!. The best value for money in Barcelona - E3 per person and the museum is top top class with so many interactive exhibits for the kids.And don't miss the restaurant - first class fresh buffet - a world apart from most other museum food!
Tourist. Clean and excellent... highly recomendable for all ages... interesting...fun and learning. Had a wide space and cafeterias are clean. You all can learn a lot.

Strongly recommended modern museum for everyone. We visited this museum with our 12 and 6 years old sons and I should say that museum was very interesting for all of us, both adults and children.It contains so many directions of sciences, starting with physics and planetarium and finishing with micro world and modern science tendencies. There is also huge and impressive section of tropical forest, which you can investigate from all levels. I personally liked additional exhibitions devoted to the modern society and planet problems. These exhibitions were made in so clear, interesting and also interactive way that we all spent there a lot of time. The museum has also huge surrounding territory where different activities can take place. I think we could sped there several days. We have visited before scientific museums in different countries, but this in my opinion was the most impressive!
Must see. If you visit Barcelona, you must not miss CosmoCaixa. It's kind of a science museum, with lots of interesting things to see and interact with. It's great especially for children.
Museum. Huge museum, what you have to see, if you go Barcelona. I loved this place. And its not crowed......

GREAT GREAT for children , curious adults. I looooved this place, I would have spent one day there. Physics, biology, chemistry, all this nicely explained...experiments, interactive demonstrations...children everywhere... really really cool experience, I leaned a lot

This museum is amazing!. This museum is quite big and very interesting; we usually go there for a whole day and enjoy different activities with kids. In the middle of the museum there is a big garden/aquarium/zoo , all-in-one, with huge amazon-river fishes, tropical rain and tropical plants.

So awesome. This place was super cool!! Cheap admission, lots to do and very interesting. The only disappointing part was that some places were closed off to the public and were reserved for school groups only, but either way it was a great place to see.

Could have been better. We are Caixa clients, and upon arriving there was nobody at the door to explain how it all works properly, we had to stand in a queue for a longtime.in the end we wanted to do the events and workshops for the kids but couldn't because nobody explained that it had to be reserved before time... we wasted alot of time for nothing......if they put a dedicated person at the entrance explaining how it all works it would have been a better experience for the kids
Family time. Fun museum for families to visit, and a blast if you're with friends. The place just wants you to goof around (but politely). So, be nice and enjoy as you stroll through.

Fun!. Enjoyed this interactive Science Museum. Not huge but will definitely keep you busy for several hours if you enjoy all it has to offer. Some rooms and interactive activities are limited to group that pre-booked only. If coming during the week, be ready to navigate among lots of school kids of all ages who are there on field trips.

Not a lot to do. When we went to the museum we were expecting there to be a lot more to do, but there really wasn't. 4 euros is a good price for the amount you can do there, but it is so far out of the way that it isn't really worth it. Also, it is important to note that this is not one of those "fun for all ages" kind of museums. It is definitely for a young audience. Under 10 probably. If you have a short stay in Barcelona, don't waste your time travelling all the way out there.

My whole family loved it. I went here with my wife, 5-year old daughter, and parents. We all had a blast with the different activities and displays. My only complaint is that there are a number of shows and activity rooms that require different tickets (which you need to pay for). We were unaware of this and spent 20 minutes waiting outside one of the rooms my daughter really wanted to enter only to be rejected. Otherwise, a great way to spend at least half a day.

Pleasantly surprised. We hadn't originally planned to come here, thinking that perhaps our 2 teenagers may be too old to enjoy it. How wrong were we!Children 16 and under are free and adults only 4 euros each, the exhibitions was varied and interesting with hands on experience. The aquatic/rain forest area was interesting and we were thrilled to see 'King of the Pond' (those of you with Wii Sport fishing game will know what I mean). Not an easy place to get to, but well worth the trek. Highly recommended.

Interactive fun for all the family.. We loved it here, the building itself is beautiful and has been well restored and expanded. The spiral around the tree trunk was wow! it tok us a little while to get used to the layout, most of the exhibits are on the -5 floor. The rainforest was wonderful and I was worried the rest would not live up to it. We ended up spending 4 - 5 hours here exploring the exhibits. My children 13 and 6 loved it, there is plenty here to engage them, good information in English too. Our favourite Science Museum was the consensus. The price is brilliant 4 euros for grown ups, kids for free.Really worth a visit.

Great place but beware queue jumpers. This is a great place for children and adults who like hands-on science experiments and demonstrations. A good way to spend the occasional rainy day. The submerged forest is the main attraction here apart from the planetarium (tickets extra). I would certainly visit this place again and spend more time here. Just a few things to be aware of if you are not a local. The ticket lines can be quite long and very slow moving (as we found queueing for about an hour with only 10 people ahead). Also beware of queue jumpers (yes we had a few of these who went straight to the front and got the person buying tickets to buy for their large group as well). We asked for tickets to the planetarium to be told that the show was at 3:30PM, and then we got our tickets, only to find out at the planetarium that the tickets we had did not cover these, much to the disappointment of our 8 year old.

Brilliant!. An ideal visit for families, not couples. Very much a museum for children and had many schools there. The exhibitions were very interesting and often interactive. The flooded rainforest was amazing, yet we couldn't find the entrance at first. Very cheap, children were free. The metro prices cost a considerable amount but wasn't so bad comparing to the prices of the museum. Overall, a perfect rainy day outing.

Worth the trip out. It was a wet day, so gave up Parc Guell for this science museum. No regrets - it was amazing, especially the Amazon rainforest area ( which is a big chunk of it) and the building itself

Huge science museum for kids as well as adults at bargain price. Went to the CosmoCaixa with our 10 and 11 y/o kids. We could hardly believe only having to pay 8 Euros as a family of four. The museum is very well done and HUGE. Explanations are written in spanish, catalan and english. While I really think this is an awesome place for kids of all ages and adults, I felt a bit overwhelmed by its size. My piece of advise would be to get a bit informed before you go and then choose a topic you'd really like to explore a bit deeper. I think it is impossible to really look at everything in just one day. Experiments are very well done and mostly easy to understand. The place was LOADED with school groups of all ages so be prepared for some moody teens and very happy toddlers ;-) Don't miss the outdoor area. Beautiful view of Barcelona, great garden and picnic area for a much deserved break from interior noise level.

Great day out - not just for kids!. We've been to many science and natural history museums over the years, and this is right up there with the best. I liked the mix of anthropology, natural history and science, seamlessly woven together around the central 'rainforest' feature. Don't be put off by the rather empty entrance spiral, the bottom floor is full of well designed, interesting and informative exhibits. Surprisingly cheap (4Euros per person, 16 and under are free), so if you are looking for a rainy (or sunny) day out away from the architecture and the crowds then give it a go (whether you have kids or not!).

Great for kids who are tired of looking at Barcelona's art and architecture. It's quite a hands-on, interactive science museum. We spent a couple of hours there with my 10 year old son, but we definitely could have spent longer. There are a number of "workshop" activities that kids can sign up for, which we didn't do because of time, but they sounded neat. Prices are fairly reasonable.

Cloudy day in Barcelona . An absolutely amazing place to visit. For adults, children, toddlers. Our 20 month old had a fantastic time running around the exhibits. She particularly loved the flooded rainforest fish tanks. Mesmerised by all the fish. You could easily spend 3-4 hours in here. Lots to see and learn about. Easily one of the biggest and well thought out science museums I've been to

Fun museum, but difficult for non-spanish speakers. Loved the exhibits here. They were very interactive and great for kids of most ages. The signage was all in Spanish, which makes it more challenging for non-Spanish speakers (like me), but still worth the trip. Our 7yo had a great time checking out each interactive exhibit.

Best value deal in town. I do not know why this museum isn't ranked higher. This is an example of how modern museums should be ! Kids can do lots of experiments themselves. The place has a tropical forest with lots of life animals too. My grumpy 14 year old had a great time and so had the more cheerful 10 year old ... I think it is an all ages thing. Perfect to bridge the rainy morning or hide from the sun in summer ... You probably need more than half a day if you want to properly explore everything. Last but not least ... Kids under 16 go for free ... Adults 4 euro ( four !). One of the few occasions you do not feel robbed when entering.
For families with kids. Perfect place to spend half a day there. Many things to do with kids, 10 minutes walk from train station

Educational. From start to finish, this museum is creative and intriguing. It's full of interactive experiments and displays that are fun to take part in and always teach you something!A ticket isn't really expensive (€4) but there's a whole heap of extra activities which cost some extra. This is not very clear at the entrance. But even without extra tickets you can spend a great deal of time inside, because there is just so incredibly much to do.And of course, the indoor rainforest. My favorite part of the entire place. It's hot, it has plants, birds and a lake-like aquarium, and from time to time it simulates rain... I loved it there and it made me want to go visit a rainforest.

This was a surprise to our group ,. This used to be the city market and while restoring it and digging on the foundations they discovered a whole ancient city below the building. So they immediately stopped all excavations and now they are excavating the ancient city. As one of your other visitors mentioned its a cross between a museum of the old barcelona and the science museum ! there are many really nice tapas bars around this area and from there you can walk through the Gothic town and end up on La Ramblas. The night life is also good jazz bars etc

Must go Museum. This was a great surprise, I never heard of it and only found out while looking for things to do in Barcelona.This is a mix of a Natural History Museum and a Science museum and it'a very good at both, with a nice rainforest area with a big aquarium and also a lot of interesting Science games educating you on the most important principles.It even has a real Triceratops skull by the entrance!
Interesting museum. This is a very intersting place to visit. I thought it would be bigger, but overall it is big enough. Lovely capibara in the flooded forest!

Perfect for kids!. Your kids will enjoy it, but especially your inner science kid. Huge place and looks pretty new! We visited the submerged forest and we got a zoo-feel with bits of Indiana Jones there. Then the geological stone cut for explaining how millon-year dates are calculated and finally the experiments to refresh what you remember and what you not from the school days. Not the size of the Natural History Museum here in London but far enough for covering all aspects of life with fascination.
A place to learn and have fun. a museum designed especially for children, dedicated to everything related to science, and its main goal is the spread of knowledge in a very simple, easy to learn way.

Perfect place to learn or spend a rainy day. I loved CosmoCaixa! I envy kids from Barcelona the possibility to learn about physics, human history, nature, space etc. in this great, playful way. I wish I had the same chance when I was a kid.In CosmoCaixa you can try lots of thing yourself and I do encourage you to do so. For example, you can get an answer to "what falls first? a feather or iron bullet" by example (in vacuum or air).There are some attractions to be pre-paid (like Toca-toca = Touch-touch) where you can touch various animals. Unfortunately we were not aware that we should pay those at the entrance so make sure to ask for those when buying tickets (btw, it's very cheap and free for kids!)Not far from CosmoCaixa, there is the track of Barcelona's only historical tram which you can take and continue further to a theme park called Tibidabo, thus finishing a day full with a lot of fun.

The kids love this place. We have been there a couple of times now. As a client of Caixabank entrance is free for us. There is a lot to learn on science and they do have some theme activities and expositions that change evry few months. It can be a bit crowdy on a rainy day.

BRILLIANT!!. I went here to fill a few hours in the afternoon, not really expecting much. But it was full to the brim with amazing hands-on experiment and explanations of physical events. There's a walk-through rainforest too, and extra temporary exhibits. For only €4!!!Unfortunately I didn't get to see the Toca! Toca! area, as it was reserved for a school trip, best the rest of the museum was enough. I allocated a bout 2 and a half hours but could have spent MUCH longer! The main attraction for me was the planetarium, but unfortunately I arrived just after one session had started, and the other session was too late for me to stay for, which was a shame. So please be wary of this. The only bad thing I could say is that, as I went on a weekday, there was an abundance of screaming children who were not interested in the science, and this distracted me a bit. But overall 10/10!

Cute date spot!. I took my boyfriend on a surprise date here for his birthday and we had a great time, neither of us had been before so didn't know what to expect. It's huge! The exhibits are well laid out and I especially loved sitting and watching the creatures in the amazon display, walking through it was very cool too! Put aside a whole afternoon, and definitely make time for the cafe terrace, good value with a fab view.
Good for the Kids. Hands on science activities for the kids. Very cheap for the facility. Be prepared for a lot of walking. This is a good rainy day activity.

Take a break from Gaudi . A very well put together science museum that entertained my children aged 10 and 8 for hours. The exhibits are in Spanish and English and were very interactive. The mangrove area was also very cool. If you have children I recommend you make time to come here.

Good for 8 to 14 year olds. We visited and were one of the only senior citizen couples. The signage was in small light print for English speakers. We were there for about 1.5 hours. I think it would be suited best for families with 8 to 14 year olds.

One of the best science museums i have been to!. I have lost the count of how many times I have been there and I always feel fascinated to visit it! I have been to many science museums in Europe and this is definitely one of my favorites! From the small toca-toca exposition, some of the most memorable temporary expos (like the mind control one) and the interior tropical jungle. Its a wonderful museum and totally worth losing an afternoon over. Recommended!

Hidden jewel. This museum is not as famous as it deservs to be, and since it's a litle off the beaten track, people often miss the chance to visit it. The admission is cheap, and the museum is well worth the time! It is very interactive and very educational, with a lot of explanatory experiments that explain natural processes in a very visual way! And yes, did I mention the 6 story high piece of Amazonian rainforest with showers every 15 minutes where you can actually walk among the high trees? Don't be discouraged by how far it is from the center, pay this museum a visit, you will not be dissapointed! Also, pay atention to time, it's easy to loose quite a few hours here.

The laws of nature to explore and nice explained . The museum offers some unique experience to explore the history of mankind, physics and science. It can be quite loud with a lot school classes in, but I would recommend a certain knowledge before visiting this museum (some basics in physics). Under these conditions the museum is probably one of the best of its kind. Unfortunately, some areas are only for school classes or groups (planetarium).

Science for everyone!. From very simple things to amazing experiments, going through a very cool 3D cinema I think it is a very interesting place to learn about science having fun.It is not only for children since there are a lot of stuff from physics but also biology, geology, etc. It is very difficult to go there and leave without having learnt something.Other good point is the prize, it is not very expensive but if you are from lacaixa or some of your friends are, you can go for free.For sure it is a nice place to go if you don't have nothing to do an evening or a morning. Maybe, if you are just visiting the city there will be more places to visit before it.The worst point is its location. If you want to go by public transport you will have to spend many time travelling and after that walking high sloped ways.

Excellent Family Attraction. Really really good attraction for whole family - about 3 hours walk round.
lots of hands on exhibits plus amazing Amazon rain forest feature.
After enjoyable visit the on site café/restaurant is very reasonably pricee

AMAZING!. This place is AMAZING. I love to visit this museum every once I can because you can never get tired of it. You can learn a lot of things, see 'weird' underwater creatures -some of them are giants-
I just can't tell how many things has this place.
Super. Very interesting exhibition with a lot of things to try for our kids (aged 7 and 9). Highly recommended for families with children (and playfull adults)

A great fun for all family. We spent almost 5 hours in this magnificent place with two kids of 6 and 12. It was a big fun for all. I've visited several "popular science" museums. However this one outperforms all of them

Wow. Went here with 15 yr old son ,,, and 12 yr old daughter wow fab time, rainforest wonderful lots of hand on things to do and food in cafe so fresh and reasonable too. But to top it all it happened to be free on the day we went , couldn't work out why but didn't complain, easy to get to on metro too !!

Nice science museum, great rainforest experience!. We visited Cosmocaixa with my husband and 15 years old daughter as part of our visit to Barcelona. The museum offers nice science and human evolution sections, but the real star is the rainforest which you can see from multiple levels including many animals, in much better conditions than Barcelona zoo. Well worth the visit - and tickets are great value for such a place!

Excellent museum!. This is one of the best science museums I've ever been to. It offers a huge range of exhibitions and experiments both kids and adults can try out. The inundated Amazon rain forest is great, too. It's a bit out of the way, but definitely worth a visit. Ticket prices are very low. Kids are free.

Great place to visit with kids. This is a really fun science museum. Lots of interactive exhibits and most everything is translated into English. The best exhibit by far is the "Sunken Rainforest." There is literally a real rainforest in the museum with giant fish from the Amazon, live reptiles and birds. And the price cannot be beat, free for kids under 16 years and adult are only 4€.
Amazing, but too many children around. The place is quite nice and the natural area is amazing. But there was too much children running around and messing with the exhibitions.

World-class science museum. One of the best science museums in the world (on par or better than ones in London, New York, San Franciso, or Boston) this site is a must-visit if you are looking for a couple of hours respite from touring. Incredible hands-on displays, a wonderful Amazonian rain-forest exhibit, and great interactive exhibitions - this museum has it all. It has had a great cafeteria and a lovely outdoor terrace for picnics. While it is a bit out of the way, it really is worth the visit.

A hands-on museum for all kinds of kids. The spectacular science museum in Barcelona is an exceptional place where you can not only passively look at the exhibits, but be an explorer of technical, geological, physical and every other scientific aspect. The former asylum for the blind, built in the early 20th century is now greatly enlarged and beautifully renovated to host this amazing place where kids of every age (from 5 to 95) can enjoy exploring the world around them.
Spectacular. Exeleant place for kids and adults. Many exhibits was interactive, but best of all was jungle (amazon) display, because it was spectacular!

Brilliant for any age group. An incredibly well curated science museum. You have to keep couple of hours aside for this adventure. It is a drive away from the centre so keep that in mind. And a slight walk from the metro. And no, it is not only for the science geeks!

Good if you like your science!. takes a long time to go through it all, found no flow to the next area maybe a little bit of guidance as to what was next to look at. My partner loved it and the experiments were fun to do!Price is very reasonable think it was about €4 or €5 each.Can take up a lot of your day if you get sucked in to it all. I would recommend it if you have an interest in that sort of thing, think the planetarium is extra so ask at the desk when purchasing tickets, didn't matter to us as we had spent too much time there and needed to leave we were walking back.
Very realistic . Everything is very realistic, even has a big. aquarium that from above looks like a tropical florets.

Wonderful, hands-on Science Museum. Our family of five (kids ages 7-11) loved the three or four hours that we spent at CosmoCaixa. We were blown away that kids are free and adults were only 4 euro each! The displays were all explained in perfect (not translated) English. Our only disappointment was that we didn't book any of the extra experiences (touch, bubble and other) when we bought our tickets. We normally avoid gift shops like the plague, but they had a wonderful gift shop, staffed by very friendly, helpful ladies. Overall, one of our favorite stops in Barcelona!

Educational museum for kids and adults. We chose to visit this museum for our kids, but we enjoyed it too. The entrance for children up to 16 years old is free, but to enter the Planitarium everyone pays 4 € / p.p. We saw the film " A Dream to Fly" it was magical. Check at the official museum website for the exact time and the theme of the show,also the language of the audio. At the museum we saw the human evolution, various natural phenomenon, aquariums with unique fish, the Amazon forest with anaconda, birds, various physics experiments, iceberg etc.
Favorite museum in Barcelona. This is my favorite museum in town. Has a real rain forest inside with huge fish. Very cheap and lovely location though a little difficult to get too.

A good half day visit. A really good interactive place to visit with children. The rainforest section is really good to look above and below the water. Cafe ok for a simple lunch. It's a easy walk up from the metro station.nice stroll down at end of trip!

Fantastic place to take the kids in Barcelona, some tips.... Highlights are the atractions and the waythey are presented to the kids, very interactive, so kids love it. The facilities are new and confortable. Wifi works well. Restaurant is simple, but very good, felt like home made food, it is indeed a buffet. The museum is a bit far from downtown and we had a bit difficulty to find a cab back to town. Book the extra activities on line or upon arrival, once they run out of room even in not so busy days. Enjoy it.

Excellent museum. Visit the museum's spectacular. Affordable prices. Very interesting all the explanations and proposed experiments. Temporary exhibitions always worth it. We, as a family, we try to go there once a year.

Great visit for the third time. Visited for the 3rd time. Very interesting exhibits, loved the fish and the cafe was great. Fab shop too. Great day out for all and very educational. Reasonably priced.

Love this place!. Love this Science museum every time we go to Barcelona!!! There are always new things to see, expositions, workshops for kids,...
Is so big, that one day is not enough to visit it all, so we get some tickets every time we are in Barcelona (is quite cheap for the time you spent there).
Great education. interesting permanent and temporary exhibitions for young and old, is represented in a playfull matter that invites to active participation
Awesome. Modern, with all interesting stuff, for anyone, age 5-100. History, arts, geography, inventions, old and new in one place. Time well spent

Excelent for kids. Low admission price.. It's the kind of museum where you can easily spend a day, great for kids. Small admission price(4 euro currently), great value. it bassicaly tells the story of how the Universe and life came into being, there's also all kinds of visual experiments you can do, and 1000 square meters Amazonian rainforest!Open late until 8 p.m. especially in weekends.Take L7 from Catalunya metro stop to Av Tiibidabo and the walk or take bus 182 to reach the building.You can combine this with a visit to Torre Bellesguard and Tibidabo Church, Torre Colserolla and Tibidabo Amusement Park.

Fantastic Science Center. A truly wonderful science center. Kids are free and adults are only four euros. A wonderful place to spend a few hours with the kids. Have been to many science centers in the states and this one beats them all.

Good for kids. Interesting museum with lots of hands on exhibits for kids. My kids (7 years old and 4 years old) enjoyed the rainforest and amphibian section the most.
