The museum itself is 4 Euros for adults and under 16 years of age are free but you have to pay for activities (ie, IMAX movies, etc.) Also, we walked there from the closest Metro stop and it was still about a 20 minute walk. FYI... If you decide to do this and Tibidabo on the same day (as we did) since they are in the same general vicinity, you'll have to get a taxi to take you to your next destination. Not a big deal just something to be aware of.
Hours of fun for 5-year old. Great place to spend a day with my 5-year old daughter. Amazing museum, and one of the best I`ve ever been to. Lots of hands on activities for the children.

Worth a visit. We always try and visit science museums in city we go to and this was well worth it. It was delightful to see so many young children engrossed in the exhibits. Loved the rainforest part. Lots to see and interactive displays for all ages. Good food at the cafeteria
lovely museum. lovely place to know, specially focused for the youngs but an adult wont get bored also. nice building, nice views and interesting stuff in there.

Nice place to visit with your child. We're definitely keen on science museums with our children. So we couldn't help visiting this one when we came to Barcelona. The price is just nothing (free for a child, 2 EUR for an adult).In the reality exposition takes only one floor while the rest 5 are used for lectures, planetarium and other purposes. Scientific exhibition is definitely interesting. We were amazed by the wave and light related demonstration. Tropical forest with a bunch of fish in mangra was slightly unexpected but still very beautiful. One disappointment for my child was the fact that areas for child madness were either closed or available to school groups only on the weekdays. Also the Medditerenian garden was closed. Still the place is worth visitng and is a great fun for both kids and adults

Great day out!. It is a very good science museum to go to regardless of how old you are! There is so many things to do and see! Kids would love it as it is very hands on, trying different things and exploring! Would recommend!

An extremely cheap but very interesting day well worth the visit!. We took our 10year old and we all enjoyed it. We only had the intention of staying 3 hours but there was so much to do and view that we spent most of the day there. I would recommend it to those with families and adults alike. The exhibits had English and Spanish descriptions so we could understand everything as tourists! It is a hands on day with lots to get involved in which varies the day and therefore holds broad appeal.
A good science museum. This is a good enjoyable interactive science museum located a bit out of town, but worth going to see with a minimal entrance fee and some unusal collections,

Great museum for children. We had some difficulty getting to the museum by Metro; we arrived at Vallarca then after a lengthy walk up hill we eventually located it. There is lots of interactive science based activities and our children really liked it. The highlight was the Amazon rainforest with some huge fish and excellent viewing opportunities. Grady value attraction for families at €4 adults and children free. Highly recommended.
perfect for a rainy day. do not know what to do? pop in to cosmo caixa is perfect for lazy day or to cover some hours in between two visits. It is interesting and also is kids friendly!

A gem. this wonderful science museum is certainly worth a visit. Beautifully set up, very interesting, lots to discover, a part of the Amazon recreated...you could spend hours here. When I visited there were only groups of very young schoolchildren, to whom most of this must have been perplexing. Anyway, when in Barcelona, go there!
Great Museum. It´s amazing all that you can discover on this place. It´s recommended for adults and children. You can spend a long time watching the expos. Take your time and enjoy...
amazing. the best Cosmo in the world. Amazing expresions best cool for the childrens Museum in the city of Barcelone i like very much

Engaging and interesting museum!. Great museum for a rainy day, hands on learning which made it all the more fun and the most interesting part was that it had a flooded rainforest, complete with real animals!
Definetly worth a visit if you have time especially if the weather isn't great!!

Great scientific visit for children. The best science museum in Barcelona and most probably in Spain. Excellent for kids from 6 till 16 years old, play and learn experience, Forrest Flood temporary attraction, with alive animals. Many activities for kids to see, play and learn. Great Planetarium. Better buy the tickes on line.

Just Amazing and New. For some reason if you visit museums in barcelona you will find a lot of great old museums, art work, sculptures, architecture, good stuff. however this museum is something completely different, brand new buildings, amazing... really amazing exhibits and some things out of this world, this place is just amazing, bring the kids, have fun and learn a lot of new stuff. this place is something. easily one of the best museum I've been

Superb value for money family day out!. We found the museum very easily from the Avinguda del Tibidabo Metro stop at the end of Line 7 and a 15 minute walk up the hill and left onto Carrer dels quatre Camins...unfortunately for us in the pelting rain! What a wonderful museum, best described as an aquarium, science museum and natural history, technology museum all rolled into one. We visited with our preschooler and she was enthralled with the place, so many things to see and try. The hands on exhibits were all working which makes a nice change!! We loved the flooded amazon rain forest with all the different animals, fish, habitat etc.The facilities were all clean, we made very good use of the hand dryers to try and dry off!!!Unfortunately, due to the weather we were unable to make use of the big outdoor space, which would have been nice to have our picnic, instead we were content on a bench inside. Although there looked to be very good cafe/restaurant available.Had we visited Barcelona as a couple we would never have thought to visit this attraction but us adults enjoyed the visit just as much as our little one. We have to say that this is one of the best if not THE best museum we have been to. Well worth the walk up the hill and brilliant price at 4 Euros each and free for our little one.We highly recommend this place.

An amazing, educational experience. Out of the central area of Barcelona, and a largely unsung museum, the Cosmo Caixa is a science museum with outstanding exhibits, many of which are interactive. Ideal for children of around 8-10, who are into dinosaurs, wildlife, and experimenting by pressing buttons, right the way up to college students and beyond, even those older ones (like me) who can always learn something new!Follow the trail of our existence from the Big Bang to present... with hints at what the future may bring.Obtain clues to the problems and solutions of an ever-crowded world.See above and below the waterline of an Amazonian rainforest.Observe the cosmos in 3D in their planetarium.Brilliant way to entertain children (and adults), especially on a rainy day!

Well thought out presentation of the sciences. The entrance and descent to the first (or last) level are exceptional. In fact, the exhibits leading up to the flooded Amazonian forest deliver an intelligent and erudite introduction to evolution and the logic behind the sciences and nature itself. Unfortunately, the other floors have minimal displays are intended for lecture halls and the planetarium, which was closed. So floor -5 was basically it...The museum shop is interesting as well, with a wide selection of products.

Amazing museum for €4. Although it's in a far corner of Barcelona, this is a great museum. And since it's a bit far, it's not crowded. It's got most things in Catalán, English, and Spanish. The most amazing this was the Bosc Inundat, the flooded forest. There's a whole ecosystem within this museum. It's like an aquarium and a zoo all in one.
Great for families with kids. Great for kids and family. Dont miss planetarium and amazon forrest. A bit far from city center with less public transportation
One of most beautiful museum. this is a nici science museum, were you can see applied sciende , were you and your child can experience.there is a nice reproduction of Amazon fores.beautiful.

Amazing interactive science museum for all ages!. After paying 28 Euros for the Aquarium (which was good, but not amazing), we didn't know what to expect from CosmoCaixa (only 4 Euros). We were AMAZED! It is an amazing science museum with very interactive displays. I wish I could have visited CosmoCaixa as a child/student.Our 22 months old son had a blast - of course he is too young to understand what some of the displays are, but this didn't impede him from enjoying and being surprised by them.Do go to CosmoCaixa and spend hours there!

Great place for children, great place for adults!. Definitely my favourite sciense mueseum in Barcelona. It´s a bit far from the city center, but it is totally worth visiting. The entrance is just 2 euro and you get to see and explore lots of things about nature and science. It is fun for children and it´s just as fun for the adults. There are also animals there and an aquarium with sharks! :)

Sounds interesting but .... We went there because all those nice reviews but we were really disappointed. Everything between -1 and -4 we wanted to see was closed or locked. There was no one to ask for some informations so all u can do is just go down. The amazonian forest is amazing and a few other experiments are interesting but that is all.

learning by playing. I do not understand why CosmoCaixa is so underestimate and not put on the "Top 10 things to do or places to visit in Barcelona". It is great! Is a place where learning is done by playing. I loved the eon spiral, the chemistry, physics and mechanics experiments and the amazonian forest. The ticket was only 3 EUR for an adult.

Great museum. It's a very nice and interactive museum. It explain a lot of physical phenomena in a nice and interactive way.The only problem was that the guidence to get to the floor where the museum is were confusing. The museum is on the last floor (-5) and it took us some time to figure this out as we thought that on the other floors may be other things to see. So, go straight on the -5 floor.Another anoying thing was that there were sooo many unsupervised, noise children that were playing arround, disturbing the rest of the people. I know it's a very good place for children to learn, but the parents should be more careful with their children

BEST PLACES IN BARCELONA. It is one of the best museums in Barcelona is very interactive , the whole story. VERY GOOD. THE BEST WAY TO ENJOY and spend an afternoon with your family or friends is a perfect environment AROUND

Very nice science museum. This is a really good science museum with interesting temporal expositions. The museum shows physics, chemistry, and biology in an interactive way where you can touch and try things. Furthermore there is a tropical garden with different animals.

Great fun for whole family. . We really enjoyed our visit. We started with the buffet lunch in the restaurant which catered very well for children and adults and was very well priced. It was a little tricky to figure out where to go. So, let me help... Floor -5. Just head there. All the interactive activities and the amazing rainforest are on this floor. So enjoyable and great to have the live Fauna and flora as well as the science experiments. We also bought tickets for the 3D movie. This was average and probably wouldn't bother again, however, kids loved it, so money well spent I guess. All in all a fantastic day. :-)

For all to have interest in science. A place especially for kids to learn and see the science. But if you are not speaking english and spanish well, you can not understand "how this can be and the rules of physic"

Great experience. We intended to visit it no more than two hours but we staid for nearly five. Interactive and interesting, the Amazonian forest is a must see. From Placa de Catalunya metro station we took the L7 train to Av. Tibidabo (end of the line, but only 10-15 minutes ride). When you exit the train station, in the front and to the right, you will see the Tramvia Blau station and a little further up the 196 bus station. Take the 196 bus and get off at the stop Ronda de Dalt-Cister. You will see the name of the station on the electronic panel on the bus. This station is right in front of the museum.

Simply Amazing. An amazing and awesome place to be. Kids loved it more than the aquarium as they got to experiment things that occur in our daily lives, such as, sand storms, shadows, ripples, sounds....Also they got to see the history of mankind through homo-sapiensThis museum is all about science & experiments To top things up, there is an amazing tropical forest mockup with a cool fish tank !!!!A must see attractionWorth noting 2 things: 1-The entrance fee is only Eur 4/ adult, kids and teens enter for free 2- Mind that when u leave u have to walk for about 10min to catch a taxi of a bus stopOther than that, the place is amaaaaazingggg

Interesting if you have the spare time. This natural history and sciences museum has many wonders hidden. It has several sections dedicated to different sciences and history periods. Small dinosaur skeletons are displayed throughout the museum.Its greatest attractions however is the Flooded forest and the hanging tree. The latter is a seven storie high tree which is suspended in mid air and a walkway around it is accessible.The flooded forest is a huge space that simulates a real amazon forest with its rivers and inhabitants.

Very interesting visit!. We visited CosmoCaixa with 3 children 8,9 and 11. They all loved the flodded rainforest. Some of the explanations where a bit difficult for the younger kids, but they loved it anyway :)
Great museum for kids and adults. It has fun interactive activities for children, you can touch screens and look at wildlife. It has variation of things to do even for adults.

Magnificent and Beautiful and Educational!. My husband & I took our 3.5 year old son. We LOVED it! A marvel! - It was a science museum, touch museum, architectural wonder, art museum, and even a mini aquarium/zoo combined into one.Magnificent views of the coast. The architecture and set up of the entire museum simply relaxing, elegant, well thought out and beautiful. We spent about 3 hours which was enough time to enjoy most of it, but we and our son could have spent the entire day there! Definitely one of the highlights of our Barcelona trip.Pros:Architecturally and artistically beautifulThe rain forest was breathtakingWe tried the Cost - so reasonable Admission only 4 euros pp and our son was free :)The touch touch (toca toca) show was perfect for my 3 year old (cost 5 euros/adult). He touched creatures he normally wouldn't have! Chevy our instructor/guide was a gifted teacher and facilitator...thanks Chevy!Cons: None!Highly highly recommended!!

Interactive. Very interesting for kids, even teenagers. One important thing missing is the need for guidance from experienced teachers so that kids take the most out of the experiments & the phenomena they see.

Ace place. What an amazing place, so much to see and do, the experience started well with the entrance fee, under 16s free and 4€ for adults. Loads of interactive things to see and try, amazing that it has a rain forest and the way you can see the roots and the fish is brilliant. With 2 adults, 2 teenagers and a younger child there was plenty to keep us occupied for a few hours, can't recommend this place enough. Never see anything like this in the UK, absolutely excellent value for money.

Fun museum, worth a visit. Fun and interactive museum with some very different intriguing permanent exhibitions. Recommended for families with kids, but also for those of us who enjoy nature and science. The tropical forest and the ant farm are my favourites.Price are very economic. On the downside, some exhibitions and activities are not open during weekdays.
if you travel with kids. it is perfect place to make a short break in Barcelona. Whole day trip to the place where you can know all you did not understand up to now of sience
Great museum!. This place was so much fun! It's really big, the hours just pass you by without noticing it. There's even a nice picknick area. Definitely worth visiting!

great place for kids and also for adults!. This is a great place for kids and also for adults. There is a beautiful ecosystem. Many scientific experiments. Great place to spend an afternoon with your kids or just to relax and learn about nature and the universe.
Great place for the whole family.. Great place for the whole family. We went with our young family and got lost in all the interactive science and activities.

We love this place!. Went on a Saturday night... Should have arrived earlier. So much to see and read and learn. Will be back very soon! A must visit in Barcelona.
It takes a bit to get to the location, but easily accessible by train or bus from anywhere in the metro area of Barcelona.

Interactivity at its best. The Cosmocaixa was a very welcomed surprise. It is a little far away from all the other attractions but it is a must in my opinion.The museum has 4 floors, we got there by 6pm and the planetarium and toca toca experiences were already closed so we basically only had the bottom floor to visit.I was a little bummed but when we got down it really was great. The reproduction of an amazzonian forest is great and very well done. The science experiments are very clever and allow kids and grownups to understand the physics and science in a practical way. I was completely absorbed for more than 2 hours only on the bottom floor.Really nice and absolutely a must for families with kids. To top it all the cost of the entrance is one of the most cheap activities of Barcelona (8€) so go with it.

Great Experience. This place is like a Planetarium but the shows are of excellent quality. I have never seen a 3D show. On the same day they had organized a live open air concert followed by a movie.It was a nice and memorable experience.

Evolution!. Spent a fab 3 1/2hrs here with my 16yr old, could have spent longer! The Amazon rainforest with its wide variety of fish and other wildlife was were worth a visit in themselves.There is not enough explanation in English to fully utilise the museum, we went round the wrong way! This did not detract from the visit but would have liked to have done it right., many of the individual displays do come with English text.

We'll go back!. Simply great science museum, with plenty of hands-on 'experiments' for kids (and grown-ups). The flooded forest is cool and beautiful. We could not see & do everything in one afternoon.
Very good for children. Interesting place that offers plenty of activities for children and the exhibition is also interesting for adults. We recommend the rain forest aquarium, amazing!

Fascinating if you have a geeky side. I found this place absolutely amazing. My girlfriend also enjoyed it, but got bored much sooner than I did. I think it would be a great place to bring children, and the Cosmo Caixa also seems to focus on entertaining children.

Learning can be very amazing. CosmoCaixa offers you a great experience while introducing you to the basics of spices evolution, physics, botany, etc. It is an excellent place to go with children. The younger will enjoy specially the rainforest setting with exotical plants and animals.One of the most amazing activities is the Planetarium where different shows let you learn a lot about stars, galaxies and univers. You have to buy an extra ticket for it and, since there is a limited number of seats, it is better to buy them in advance or as soon as you get into the CosmoCaixa facilities.

Very Nice Museum.. Amazing location and extraordinary architecture of the museum building. Nice examples of variety of physics rules and natures. Yet, content wise, not much different than similar museums around the globe.

We regret going there. I cannot recommend this museum to anyone, especially if you are traveling without children: it is really boring and artificial. It is also not so easy to reach by metro. I would not even recommend it for the families with children unless you are a scientist or an actor and are able to explain everything to them in a funny and interesting way.

Unable to find meeting point so missed the trip. Prior to the trip more than 24 hrs I emailed you guys wanting the exact meeting point I did not receive a reply until 48 hrs therefore I missed the trip. A phone number of the facilitator would have been an extremely better option for those of us who have never been to the country. This completely stuffed up my long weekend. Plus there was another tour that I'd paid for and after many emails you people thought it fair enough to refund me 1/4 of what I'd paid. So I have no hesitation in telling people to avoid your services. Thanks for a great time in Spain.

A nice science museum (more for children, but also science-loving adults will enjoy enough) ). Located up hill (which created an enjoyable long walk from Plaza Catalunya for me).The Amazon rain forest exhibition is indeed something you do not see elsewhere. Overall, around 40% of the exhibition was more fact telling about geology and history of mankind (not exactly evolution), but I enjoyed the rest (more physical phenomena) enough to fill my day.Except from the rain forest I cannot recall an exhibit that is not common to most science museums so if you already saw several of those, then probably come only if you are deeply into science museums.

Should have done this instead of Park Guell!. Lovely space, great hands on things to do and amazing rainforest! It was cool and peaceful, we went at 2 pm and there was no queue. I went to pay with my Barclays debit card and because there's some link between the two banks we got free entry (usually €4 for adults) and half price entry to the exhibitions (usually €4 for everyone). Park Guell was beautiful but the children (8-15) preferred CosmoCaixa much more.

Engaging, fun, science museum and planetarium. Great family destination.. Great fun science museum. It was much quieter than expected (as its a bit out of town). Easy to get to; take the L7 to Tibidabo and walk up the hill following the tram tracks, then turn left where the walking sign points to CosmoCaixa (brown or blue signs?- can't recall). Only 5-7 min walk. [Afterwards we walked up to the Funicular, another similar walk up the hill.] We arrived at 1005 and thought it was closed it was so quiet. We took 3 hours but missed a couple of sections. The planetarium was a real favourite with the kids (10,13) so don't forget to get a ticket on entry. Great value overall. There is a small café/ restaurant but not much else nearby.

Good place to go. The museum is located in a beautiful district of Barcelona. It is just €4/ adults and kids under 16 go in free. It is very informative with alot of hands on experiments. The rain forest is amazing.

Time to Spend Left? That's always a nice Place!. More than 3 times I have been at CosmoCaixa Barcelona. It's a science museum, but offers also nature, science, and space. CosmoCaixa also has a planetarium and always exhibitions.

Long queue!!! To get in !!!?? So slow!. If you visit then be prepared for a long wait in a long slow queue!! I guess today they only expected a very small number of visitors. Innovation in a fast payment and entry would be a good investment. It just takes the edge off the start of your visit if you have to wait in line with children for a long time.

On par with the best science museums. Aside from the cultural sights, this is THE place to take kids to while in Barcelona. Even with an admission of only 4 euros for adults, free for kids, the quality of the exhibits is on par with the world's best science museums. This place may not be as large as other famous science museums, but the ability of the exhibits to educate, amuse, and elicit wonder - even for adults - makes this museum first rate.

Top notch science fest. A short walk up the hill from the end of the L7 line the cosmo is easy to reach. Barcelonis seem as fond of queuing as the British and seem to do their best to generate a queue for tickets wherever possible. Take a paperback.The walk down into the main exhibition round and down round a petrified tree is wonderful. The automated exhibit at the base with seeds scattered is just the start of many lovely well conceived and delivered ideas. The most amazing of which is the rainforest reproduction.We did the one English language activity the Toca Toca. The guide was great knowledgeable and friendly. Our kids loved the whole thing as did we. Great value for just exhibition. Worth ponying up for the Toca Toca if you've a budding biologist.

Fantastic museum for all ages. What a great space! A real tropical rainforest with spectacular fish and rain! Superb natural, earth, physical and planetary science displays with interesting descriptions. Highly interactive displays that kept the adults and children amused for over 4 hours! We could have spent longer but the children had had enough by that stage. At €8 entry for the entire family it was fantastic value and entertainment! We ate in the buffet which had a reasonable variety of food at very reasonable prices. Only complaint I have is that the special performances and displays were not in English so the children weren't allowed to take part but to be honest there was so much to see and do in the rest of the museum that it did not matter!! Taxi there from town centre cost €10.
Overwhelming rainforest. Walking through a genuine piece of rainforest and being confronted with the overwhelming fauna and flora is truly an intriguing experience. For both kids and their parents.

Something different to do with the kids. We spent 3 hours here with 3 kids and only managed to get through one floor! It's definitely good for a full day's outing. Extremely interesting for the kids (6, 10, 17), everything is also translated to English. A lot of interactive stations and aquariums to keep them curious and asking questions. Also it's a nice break from the August heat.

Great for all ages!. I went to this science museum as an au pair with two Spanish children. We all loved it. They had previously been a few times and still found things interesting! It was for both adults and children unlike many science museums. We went to the planetarium which was very good and I was able to listen in English using a translating audio device. I also recommend going to the part on floor -5 with the trees and fish. The fish and trees were huge and as a nature lover, this was a very nice part of the museum!

you should try it. it is located outside of city, to go there is a bit complicated but it is good to see and try. In case you do not speak spanish or english it might be a problem, but you can learn a lot about our world.

Am. A. Zing. Brilliant place! So much to see on 5 floors in a beautiful and unusual building. The spiral walkway which takes you down all 5 floors was worth the €4 entry fee alone! Our kids aged between 2-7 had a great day. So much to see and all beautifully presented. It's like Texhniquest crossed with the Natural History Museum. Very cool.
Sunday Afternoon at the Science Museum. Great place, you can touch everything and discover science principles, looking at the movements and reactions of all the objects.

Well worth finding if you have children. Not well signposted but worth the effort. Took train to Av. Tibidabo and across the road caught the 196 bus to the science museum. You can do both trips using just one journey on the T10 card. We found it difficult to spot. if using the bus get off when you see a large submarine in the middle of the road. The entrance is just opposite this. It is a huge red brick traditional building. It's a great science museum with so much to see, lots of interactive experiments and demonstrations of physical phenomena and an amazing tropical rain forest right in the middle of the museum. It is really cheap too (4 Euros for persons over . There are loads of lockers by the information desk. It was something completely different for the children and most of it out of the sun.It's a mix of natural history and science. The entrance leads to a spiral slope. At the bottom of the slope is a little exhibit with helicopter seeds. You are now at level -5 and ready to start a journey through pre-history and evolution. Considering the low entry fee and amount of things to do, not to mention the great cafe we were shocked at how little the place was used.

Awesome. We spontaneously decided to take a visit to CosmoCaixa.The entrance fee was only three euros! And it is absolutely worth it.There were a lot of groups with children, which made some places very crowed and very loud! But that didn't affect our visit.Very interesting and so many things to see, learn and try out yourself.Highly recommended!
Worth viewing. Honestly was not so happy going but i ended up really enjoying my visit. The jungle greenhouse is amazing i could have spent a whole day!!! Glad i visited this place!!!
Worth your Time. Very interesting, well worth your time to tour. Covers a period of time from 200 BC to Renaissance. And near central Barcelona so you can have a great meal or walk the Rambla.

Best museum ever!. A really great trip out - we rated it as the best museum we have ever visited. Our 14 year old son - who is really in to Science - was entertained for 5 hours with not a complaint!Its a bit far out to walk, but a taxi is around 10 euros and the museum info desk telephoned one for our return trip. Just an amazingly helpful place. Lunch here was great and far from expensive

Well worth the trip away from the tourist area. 4) CosmoCaixa is similar to American Museum of Natural History. The range of exhibits is huge. I thought a lot of the fossils, dinosaur bones and ancient scriptures appears to be real and not replicas. I wasn't able to confirm if this is true. They had one scripture that spanned two floors. My kids, 15 and 16 loved it. I took a cab from the Girona area going there costing a little over $13 Euro. It’s unlikely you will be able to get a cab going back since it’s not in the tourist area, but a leisure walk to the Metro took about 15 minutes.
An amazing day. An amazing place in which you could spend a whole day in. Plenty to do for adults and families. The Toca Toca and the planetarium worth a visit.

Spent the whole day here. Find out what a wasp and Barcelona taxi have in common, how electric fish evade and defend from predators, how aeroplanes fly (the physics of flight) and read about the story of the sly octupus. Also see the wonderful re-creation of an Amazon rainforest and learn about volcanoes and earthquakes on the Geological Wall. Arrived at around half 11 and didn't leave until closing time. Admittedly was obsessively reading the descriptions in Spanish as well in my attempts to improve my language skills (since I was in Barcelona for a month), but even so, you could easily spend the whole day here without even noticing the passing of time, since there are also a few exhibitions/ shows which you can pay extra for. You would have to enquire about these since the counter staff do not spontaneously mention them without prompted. This science museum has that rare blend of being deeply educational, interactive, fun and memorable. It is spread out 'underground' over 5 floors and the last (i.e. the bottom floor) is by far the best: a unique blend of physics, biology, chemistry and a smattering of psychology in the form of optical (and other) illusions......think a huge kids' playground yet x 100 more educational. ......not that this museum is the preserve of school-age children. I'm 22 and while reading the complementary explanations brought back memories of knowledge taxingly gleaned from college lessons, I still enjoyed operating the floating ball using the vacuum and marvelling at the massive block of ice that doesn't melt whilst trying to get it to with my hands. On one of the floors below, there is a seemingly all-day cafe and a buffet-style restaurant that opens at 1pm, priced at around 13 euros including a drink. There is a limited selection of around 6 main dishes, a salad bar and an area for desserts, which seemed almost hidden at the back. Might as well take advantage of the buffet given that dinner time might not be for a while! On the same floor, there is a very nice garden with benches in shaded parts where you can take a rest and enjoy the tranquillity. The museum is very peaceful, being away from hustle and bustle of the city centre and away from the tourist masses. Only had to queue for around 5 minutes on a Saturday morning. To get there, you can take the metro L7 from Plaza Catalunya (also stops at Gracia) until its final stop, Av. del Tibidabo. From there, it's a 10 minute uphill trek and a left turn at the top. There's also a blue tourist tram that you can take from Av. Tibidabo but it seems a bit of a rip-off at around 5.50 euros just for one-way ticket; you might as well get the taxi if you don't fancy the uphill walk.Would get there for when it opens next time but for €4, it represents the best value for money amongst all the tourist attractions and without the crowds they usually attract. I would say CosmoCaixa is a must if you have kids!

Brill. So cheap, so much to see and do. We were there for two hours and could have stayed much longer. The range of animal species on show was pretty impressive as was the hands on exhibits. A really impressive place.

Fun for the whole family. We really loved this museum. It is a bit out of the city, but it is definitely worth to check it out. The fee is pretty low, I am not a fan of banks, but what a great cause they support here.Lot of interactive "experiments", toys, fun way to observe the power of nature. The most amazing part for me was the rain forest with a huge glass in front of it, so you can see the life both under water and above ground.Amazing!We ate at the snackbar what was pretty crowded and not so great, but who cares after all what we saw.

Simply superb - a must for kids. Three generations of our family were captivated by CosmoCaxia. You'll need half a day to really get the full value of what is on offer. The entrance fee is very cheap. Don't forget to book the planetarium show when you arrive. Our cashier forgot to mention it and we missed out - my son was disappointed but we'll return on our next trip.

A must see! Amazing rain forest perspective!!. The museum has many hands on experiments and children as well as Us Adults went crazy from one experiment on to another. Many artifacts from several eras of the human evolution but the most amazing was a true corner of rain forest where one can see a side impact of such a forest behind a huge glass with fish and tree roots that go all the way down underwater. A bit disappointed with the planetarium. Entrance fee was minimal and must say we should have allowed more time....it is worth it!!

Triggers, swiches, shifts and rainforest.. Not a must but very nice to catch a breath during your stay in Barcelona. You' d better go there with children in my opinion. I can recommend real piece of rainforest under the roof of Cosmo:) really impressive!

Highly recommended. Spent an afternoon there with our 2 kids (4&6). It s a very nice building with lots of space even on a Saturday. €4 the entrance, free for kids under 16yrs old. The amazon area is very well done. We took the attraction (€4), it exists in english and french. 1h during which kids/you will learn some cool stuff on various animals and touch some of them. Then you can continue in the rest of the discovery area.
Variety. Beautiful building with a variety of art displays. Check out and pick when to go. Great area for children.

Interesting Science. I liked the variety of applied experiments you could do. When you get in It looks big but you at the end you visit it in 2/3h.I would recommend it but do not plan to spend the day there.

great place to study about technology&science. I had a great time in CosmoCaixa, even though I came in late, but I still enjoyed my visit there. I learned a lot of stuffs with the little time. I hope to go there again soon :)

A Little Disappointed. I think this is a case of good reviews raising your expectations to the point they can't be met... The exhibits all seemed to be in working order, but it didn't really hold my interest although my kids enjoyed it (2 boys, aged 8 and 10). I think we've been to so many science museums with my kids that they all seem to be the same!It was surprisingly easy and fast to get here. We took the L7 from Plaça de Catalunya to Av. Tibidabo. I'm not sure how long the ride was but I don't think it was more than 15 minutes. It looks far on the map, but it really isn't, especially since there aren't many stops. We walked about 10 minutes from the metro stop to the museum. It is uphill, but it really isn't bad, even though it was very hot out when we were there. The walk was actually enjoyable as the neighborhood was very pretty. From certain places, you could see the Mediterranean, which was pretty cool.

A museum of Science with Noteworthy Rainforest. Perhaps not your typical tourist attraction in Barcelona, but definitely worth the metro ride to experience this museum of science. It parallels other large, metropolitan museums and has wonderful exhibits of gems, physics demonstrations and a phenomenal rainforest section. Many hands on activities. Very kid friendly, spacious with an excellent cafeteria/dining room.
Amusing and intelligent. if you are fond of science it's certainly your place. You also must take your children to make scince more attractive for them.

Best time for the kids. I took my three children here for the day as the reviews seemed god and we were oh so not dissapointed! The kids (8, 11, 13) were totally in awe with all the activities and thibgs to look at, feel and experience. With a little ( very big) pjece de resistance: the rainforest. Now the practicals: It was 4 floors deep with only really the lowest one used fully but it was more then enough to last 2,5 hours of entertainment. The other three floor were very nice, but mainly for the fantastic architecture of the building.Price cant be beat: kids to the age of 16 free and 17+ are Eur 4 but if you want some extra 3d movieshow or some interactive show it costs Eur 4 pp extra ( also for kids)We took the metro and bus to get there

Barcelona's best kept secret. This museum is well worth a visit, especially if you have kids. Entrance is just 4 euros per adult with kids up to 12 free. And there is so much to see and do inside. Most things are hands on, so kids get to experience physics first hand. There is also a pretty cool Amazon forest exhibit with lots of animals. My fav Barcelona experience!

different experience. Fancied something a bit different to do as have seen most of typical tourist sites. Easy to get to by train from Placa de Catalunya, although not recommended for the infirm as up a steep hill.Good afternoon of activities inside for entertaining young and old alike. If you're looking for something different and to get out of heat then I recommend. Entry is free if you have a Barca travel card.

Great place to spend half a day with kids. Lots of good science exhibits which encourage children to explore things by themselves. Downside is that it may be too crowded especially if there are large groups - they don't manage that too proactively

Great science museum. Great science museum in a fantastic building, blend of old and new. The science museum is fun and very interactive, perfect for kids and adults alike. It also features a "slice" of real Brazilian rainforest completely transplanted in a conditioned environment, with its birds, snakes, ants etc. Fascinating.

Is this the best kids attraction in Barcelona. This is the best kids attraction in Barcelona yet it gets very little publicity. Great way to spend a few hours with interactive exhibits for science and a brilliant Amazon rain forest you can walk through with the animals. Incredibly good value.

Best museum I've ever visited. Definitely the best museum I have ever visited. I attended with my boyfriend (both age 21) and was amazed by the amount of things there were to do. We could have easily stayed there for over 3 hours but didn't have much time. If you go we recommend you stay for awhile and don't rush it as there's not only lots of experiments to do but also insects, fish and other small animals to look at. As well as all the wildlife in the amazing indoor rainforest. Definitely make the journey there and if you're able don't bother getting the tram up the hill, it's really not that far from the metro at all!

Very impressed. Took the family to this place on a Thur in July. Admissions for adults is 4 Euros and children up to 16 y.o. get in for free. What a great idea to encourage children to come. There were some very large groups of kids with one or two adults who had come to visit, I am sure the free admissions to kids had a lot to do with this. Bring your children here rather than let them sit in front of the boob tube or video game console for the day. The exhibits were very well designed and almost all working. Everything was explained in English. They had a 3D movie in English as well (extra cost). My 14 and 11 year old kids happily spent 4 to 5 hours at this museum without complaining. There is a cafeteria with sandwiches and snacks and coffee. There is also a restaurant with a buffet which cost 13.50 for adults and 8.50 for kids. Highly recommend this museum in Barcelona.

To learn the basics. It's an average science museum. The wet forest is outsanding, also there are lots of stuff to play with to learn the basics (ie. gravity, acceleration, waves, colors, etc.). Recommended for children!

Science for all. It is a bit far away from the regular tourist path, but especially if you are with children, be sure to visit this place. It is a modern building giving answers to many questions about the science , but also nature, ecology and life developing on earth. Do not be afraid, it's so fun with all the interactive experiments that children can try, in fact, play and learn. We most enjoyed the walks in the rain forest , aquariums.. Very good gift shop also.

Amazing science museum in Barcelona. Cosmocaixa is the new version of the old museum of science in Barcelona.You can do lots of different physics experiments, that will help you in understanding the basics physics laws.You will find a tropical forest in it, with simulation of the tropical weather.do not forget to book for the planetarium.Nice place to go with kids.
Extraordinary Science Museum. An extraordinary interactive museum for all ages. New activities every season, and one full day will be barely enough to complete your tour.
Interesting. I loved the Forest underwater. The experiments are good, but many need to be renewed. For the price you pay, you get a good experience!
Very interesting museum. I visited Cosmo Caixa Museum in July 2014. Is a very good museum. You can learn Physics and Biology.
Brilliant. Maybe it is an unknown place for the tourists, but I recommend you going there. It is 2 minutes away from MNAC, and almost all the expositions are free or only cost 4€.¡

This is the best new science museum in the world I think!. You might think this science museum is too far out off the beaten path in Barcelona but seriously, please go! It's fabulous and so fun for all ages. We took our 12 and 15 year old sons and hours melted by. We didn't even get off the bottom level before it closed at 8 pm. It's a taxi ride and remember to book the taxi for a return trip down the mountain but definitely do it! So many really interesting and first rate exhibits, hand-on science with many live animals as well in cool little habitats, even a capybara in the rainforest. Brand new and vastly engaging. And super cheap! I think we paid like 6 Euros for all 4 of us as kids get in for free.

Nice. The museum is amazing! Has alot to offer and see and lots of new things to learn. But， before you go there you should take a quick spanish class.The museum was really nof thrist friendly， there was no english map to the museum so getting around was difficult. Half the staff didn't speak english so asking them for guidance was no good.But all in all the visit was fun and was worth our time.

Great science museum. My 13 year old son loved it! He is particularly interested in physics and there are a lot of hands on exhibits. We also really liked the rain forrest exhibit. It's a bit of an uphill hike from the Tibidabo metro stop and the signs are a bit confusing.

Fun and interactive for the whole family. We visited this museum during a trip to Barcelona in May 2015. This is a great museum with lots of interactive exhibits for kids and adults that teach physics in a hands on way. I really appreciated that the exhibits had both Spanish and English placards to explain them. My son really enjoyed the jungle exhibit with the large reptiles and fish. If you're going by Metro, be advised that the walk from the station to the museum is up a pretty steep hill so if you have young children be prepared. My 5 year old made the walk, but he was pretty tired afterward. A car or taxi would be best.

Excellent. Kids will love it!. On the 4th day of our stay in Barcelona, we were torn between visiting some popular tourist destination and visiting CosmoCaixa. I am glad that we decided to visit the latter.It is a nice building with ample parking(A bit expensive at 8.5 Euros). The entrance fee is quite low.The exhibits are nice and are hands-on. We have been to Technorama in Switzerland, which has more science exhibits. But this one makes up for it with the Rain Forest and fossil exhibits.Don't miss this. The kids will love it.

must do if you have kids. We visited the museum with our 13 year old and had to drag him out after 3 hours as we had other things to see. Starting with having wax idols of Einstein and Newton at the ticket counters, moving on to the amazing Amazon rainforest recreation replete with its sounds, the various experiments and pendulum replicating and showing application of various physics laws, the exhibition about visualising the future in 2100 and the key issues therein, geological and biological phenomenon and a seven minute movie about the Antartic base with the first female director of Antartic (spanish) this is a must do if u love science and have kids. U can easy spend 3-6 hours in this one. Adults 4euros kids free.
AWESOME !!!. This is the museum to do solo, family or friends !!Very playful.The Amazon forest is just amazing at the end that give real pleasure everyone.

Simply awesome. What a great museum: it has won a price a few years ago for best museum of Europe and they definately deserve that. It's interesting, beautiful and understandable for everyone. definately a must-go! Make sure you'll go on time (the museum closes at 20:00) because there's a lot to explore. (you'll need at least 3,5/4 hours to see all with calm) and take a look at the passing buslines, since the metro stop is pretty far away. (a 20min walk)entrance is only 4 euro.Did I already say it's awesome? :D
Not a typical spot to visit. I always go to see traveling exhibits here . Never disappointed . Near the paradox and encounter to ago ha train station. Kind of tucked off the main. Worth a visit.

Kids Heaven. It was worth travelling from London to Barcelona just to see the excitement and awe on my children's faces as they went round this amazing place. Jump in a taxi and visit if you have kids

Great for kids. Loud, busy, and a long walk from metro station. It's a great venue for kids but not something that adults will particularly enjoy. Although there are some wonderful exhibits that adults could find interesting they were set up for kids and were poorly described in places. Food in the restaurant was appalling and the tables were left dirty after school trips had left.Only go if you have kids and take a packed lunch.

Would be so much better if they translated everything into English!. I was in the right area as had been visiting Torre Bellesguard and with entry to that attraction I got free entry to this one so I thought why not.However there was not an English map and I found it hard to find my way around, and much of the exhibits were not translated into English, so I didn't get much from it.I had lunch in the cafeteria (3 course buffet and drink for 10 euros) but to be honest I didn't like the food.The best bits were the models of our prehistoric ancestors, a reconstructed Amazon rainforest that you can walk through and the piranhas in the water!Would be so much better if they translated everything into English!

The best science museum in the world. This was my second visit to CosmoCaixa and again I was surprised by all the cool things in there.As a heartless engineer, I never come up with any other attractions than museums of science, technology, etc. Because of that, I have visited quite many of them. I have seen them for example in Australia, Finland, Thailand and Germany, and I must say the one in Barcelona is the best.There are really many interactive things to try and play with and the exhibition hall is huge. It is so big, that there is actually tiny rain forest with animals.And as a nice bonus, the entry tickets are really cheap: Only four euros.
Fantastic for all ages. This is better than our science museum very reasonable but plan your route. It's isn't the obvious of places to get to. Very reasonable

Well worth the extra journey. Though it seems a bit out of town nothing in Barcelona really is that far. This science museum is at the base of Tibidabo so if you time the journey right it is possible to get to Av. de Tibidabo on the L7 (from Pl Catalanya) then a bus and the funicular up to look around and then back to the science museum on one T10 journey.The museum itself is a great expo of life on earth. A mix of natural history and science with a small smattering of zoo thrown in. In fact we were planning to go to the zoo but were advised that the cages are rather small and upsetting so opted for this suggestion instead. And we were very satisfied with the choice.The entrance leads to a spiral slope following the first few thousands of millions of years of Earth with only bacteria eventually turning up. At the bottom of the slope is a fun little exhibit with helicopter seeds (sorry can't remember the trees proper name). The emblematic tree you see in many of the pictures of Cosmo Caixa is also here.You are now at level -5 and ready to start a journey through pre-history and evolution or modern science. We also had the pleasure of 2 exhibitions on life in 2100 and Soyez 2. The latter was interesting though I had never heard of it so the Russian cover up obviously worked on me. The former was great for me as a sci-fi buff.Throughout the building there are exhibits with text in Catalan, Spanish and English. There are also a LOT of interactive things. We spent half a day there and could easily have gone back again. For only 4 Euros per adult you get a lot for your money and then there is the extra of the rain forest habitat with fish and animals plus rain. There are some extras including a planetarium which is a 3D cinema but as the screen covers the whole roof images of space etc are full on.The other floors above -5 are a bit sparse unless you are using the seminar rooms or other special areas (Clik, Toca Toca and Flash). There are a couple of outside spaces with a few things to do in them, I'd recommend the Archimedes one for the big toys (only 2 mind you).Considering the entry fee (almost lack of) and amount of things to do, not to mention the great restaurant we were shocked at how little the place was patronised. Maybe it gets busy in the Spanish holidays. So if you are fed up of the Barcelona history and "culture" then make the small effort to get to Cosmo Caixa.

If You are interested with physics and natural being... It is a fantastic museum for fan of phsics and human and animal being.If you are interested you spend all day here. Many things to read and test to see. Amazon section is wonderful. Do I recommend you to go?Yes!
THIS IS FANTASTIC!. CosmoCaixa it is the typical family museum,there are a lot of inventions for the childrens and the decorate of dinosaurs is very real.I would love to go again!!!

Hands-on museum, full of activities!. Fantastic science museum, great for those under 10. There are so many activities, children quickly switch one to another; there is never a long wait, despite the high traffic. Remember to buy tickets to the planetarium from the ticket booth when you enter! It’s a great show, audio-guides in different languages are included in the price, but a long trek back to the ticket booth if you forget. There is a good cafeteria, and the prices are not outrageous. However, there is a big outdoor area with benches if you bring your own snacks/lunch.
Worth visiting. Only €4 which was a good deal. Everything in Spanish, Catalan, and English. Some cool hands-on displays. Not amazing but very good.

love experiments. It was full of children from different schools with their projects. i wish this to be in my country so children can understand more easily. Amezed by technologie and what it was a surprise....the flooded jungle with enormously big and scary fish. You can acctualy travel inside the jungle were you can also find some strange birds that follow you and trys to eat your shoe lace :)) And a fury animal that i don't know even today what kind of animal it was. great experence!

loads for kids to do. great value for money, if a bit of a mission to get to. the entire ground floor kept my toddler entertained for almost 2 hours - loads of buttons to press, animals to see and topics to discuss.

Very cool. Really interesting exhibits.. the jungle is absolutely amazing.. I am an engineer and I was really impressed with all of the scientific exhibits.. If you learned physics this the place for you..
The best museum I've been to!. Absolutely must see! All the theories are interactively presented, if only schools were like that. The Amazonia jungle is incredible!

Touristy but a must if a first timer to the city. This is the original old Roman part of the city - Barcino in those times. As such, it has lovely narrow streets full of charm and character which are lovely to meander around. Lots of shops and cafes and tapas bars. Here you also find the Cathedral, the sailors church of Santa Maria del Mar (beautiful in its simplicity and soaring interior) and the Museo Picasso amongst other places to see. Expect to pay tourist prices though.

Really great science museum. Have been in many technical and science museum, but this one is great, very interactive, combining physics, biology, geology and zoology. Specially loved physics experiments. If you come with kids to Bcn it is a must. And as Bcn is quite expensive in tickets to attractions this 4 eur seemd like bargain to me. Very well spend.Also if you considering visit Aquarium, in this museum you can see Amazone rainforest with aquarium....maybe you can skip other one if short on budget.

Loved it, lot's to see and explore for all ages. I came with 2 young kids, ages 4 and 6 to this museum, and we were really excited about the rain forest and the fish aquarium, if you want more activities like toka toka, book ahead, it's only on weekends
Fun and interesting Museum. This is very interesting Museum and magical building inside,nice to see all the thing inside of the museum

Family experience. Lots of topics covered and lots of angles allowing your kids to be initiated to different matters. If you can visit it during school holidays you will avoid all these school visits where teenagers and kids running around and shouting. The building is great with lots of experiments to be shared allowing the kids to taste science.
the best science museum I've ever visited in my life. I won't say much about this place. It is magical. Every piece of it is filled with science. A place to go back and back and back.

Fantastic visit for youngers. My sons (8 and 10) enjoyed a lot this museum full of experience they could perform by themselves. Impressive watered amazon forest. A bit diffcult to reach (15 minutes by walk from nearest metro station) but definitely Worth it.
Fun and interesting. Enterance fee is only 4€ and you get A LOT for it! It is very fun but educational. It wasn't crowded at around 1 pm on Tuesday and we got to try all the experiments :)

Good fun and interesting.. Loved the Amazonian Aquarium and all the science games. I was not too fond of the confusing layout of the building or the lack of information personnel. We wanted to go to the Toca-Toca area but discovered it was only open on weekends.
Amazing value. Great value at 4 Euros entry. Went without kids and spent 4 hours, the time flew by. Very interactive.

Not to be missed when in BCN with kids. This is a welcoming, architecturally interesting but mostly, an interactive science museum that tries to simplify scientific knowledge in an interactive way .. so that kids can pick it up effectively. Definitely add it to your itenerary when in Barcelona with kids over 7yo.

Great exhibits, and cheap too!. What a surprise finding somewhere that does not cost a small fortune to visit - adult tickets are €4, children under 16 are free.Plenty of buttons for the kids to press and the adults too.The best part of the museum has to be the rainforest, my wife loved the capybara 9looks like a big lazy dog)All the exhibits are at the lowest level of the museum, there only seems to be lecture rooms on the higher floors!

Great for adults too!. My husband and I loved this! One of our favorite things on our trip to Europe. Loved the rainforest exhibit and the various others. Something you have to really see to experience.its a little outside the city center, but if you're in Barcelona GO!

A wonderful science museum – take your kids there. This is a great science museum. It has so much to see, from experiments and demonstrations of physical phenomena to an amazing tropical rain forest right in the middle of the museum. True, it’s located a bit off the center but it’s really easy to get there with line 7 (brown). Just get off at Tibidabo Av. (last stop) and walk up hill. The fee is ridiculous (4 Euros for persons over 16). I recommend getting there early and having the place not as crowded. There is also a nice gift shop, a little on the expensive side. Put your bags in the lockers by the information desk. It was a good change of pace for the kids (12, 11 and 6 but really all ages will enjoy it) and the adults loved it as well.

Great but a little disappointed. Took train to Av. Tibidabo and across the road caught the 196 bus to the science museum. Very impressive building, great wax work of Einstein at the ticket desk. Went down to the 5th floor, where the main body of exhibits are. We are not Spanish speaking but everything was written in English for the main part so no problems understanding instructions. The most impressive part and worth the trek here was for the Amazon experience. You walked through the doors and were hit with a blast of heat, which keeps the plants and creatures at the best temperature closest to their natural habitat. The sounds and smells were amazing and although it is a small exhibit it was great. The rest of the 5th floor was very hands on and my lads enjoyed the chance to play with the various exhibits. We looked at the other floors but they were for temporary exhibits, planetarium etc. My boys are 8, 11 and 13 and all would say they enjoyed it, and with it being free for children it is a big draw however they felt there wasn't half enough to play with there compared to our favourite so far,The W5 in Belfast, Northern Ireland.

Fun day out. A fun family day out - something for all of us here (our 10 and 11 year olds included!) children go free, €4 each for adults. Easy to find, we walked up the hill from Av Tibidabo metro station. Plenty of outdoor space for a picnic and lockers to leave your rucksack in. If only we had discovered them on the way in...
Brilliant. Such a fun place for adults and kids alike. We loved all of the scientific experiments, could have stayed there all day!

You'll feel young again.. A ton of physics experiments that help you better understand the world we live in. I you travel with a child I think this is a must go. For me was the first science museum visited and now I'm searching for the next.
big Story. "All" - so you can describe this place. It collected a number of unique exhibits lacked a day to see everything zhellatelno take a guide

The best science museum for teenagers. who is interested in science here will find lots of interesting things. The best science museum for teenagers, and adults have a lot to learn. need a whole afternoon to visit.
Average. Plenty to see here but to me it seemed like everything was all mixed up, would be better to have been in sections.

Fantastic museum, Bargain entry price!. One of the best museums I have been to, so many exhibits, many of which were very interesting. The museum itself was very clean very spacious and the staff were friendly. We couldn't believe how cheap the entry was as well. It was a well spend few hours visiting :)
Awesome attraction. really interesting, loads of hands on exhibits. Great variety of plants, animals, exhibitions. One of the Highlights of our holiday!
Great museum. Museum is worth visit, the fee is really affordable, however it is quite far, we had to take two or three buses from central location, so minus for that!

Great Museum. Went there on a rainy day with 2 kids of 2 and 5. Even if a lot if activities are for teenagers, both really had a great time looking and experiencing. Price is very modest and quality of the exhibitions is good!

Well worth the money. A great way to spend a rainy day in Barcelona. The admission fee was only 8 Euros for all three of us (16 year old students get free entry). We all agreed this was excellent value for money. CosmoCaixa was captivating and I’m convinced that it would make science interesting for the most switched off student. Many of the exhibits are interactive as well as impressive in size (a must see is Foucault’s pendulum). There are also live exhibits including an artificial rainforest which was stunning. We spent four hours in there and still didn’t manage to get round it all. The building is well designed, on several floors and connected by lots of escalators that make it easy to get around. CosmoCaixa also has a café and restaurant on site. Well worth a visit.

Nice place for children and adults. Only a symbolic price of 4 euros per person ! because it is supported by the Central Bank in Catalonia. Friendly designed for visitors. A detailed explanation for every exhibit and a charming atmosphere. Excellent museum for children because you can touch the exhibits and it's pretty fun even for adults among us.Come to the museum through line 7 from Catalonia square - no need to pay for a taxi.
Great!. Very inexpensive, only 4 Euros. It was really big, and there were a lot of interesting exhibits. My husband and I spend a little over two hours here, but we could have easily stayed longer.

Excellent attraction, not for small children. You might not consider visiting somewhere like this when on holiday but it's a great deal of fun. There are lots of interactive things for children to play with but I think young children might get a little bored. Right from the start and the huge tree it is of great interest and they change their special display regularly enough for a repeat visit (if you live there). A lot of fun.

What a fantastic attraction.. Cosmo Caixa was billed as the 'largest science museum in Europe'. Not sure if I'd agree. Although having said that it was a fantastic day out, with plenty to look at, learn and experience. The 'Flooded Forest' was stunning. When I first saw it I wanted to get inside...imagine how thrilled I was when I found out you can actually walk through it and experience the exhibit close-up. There were several school parties there the day we went but at no time did we feel bothered by them and there is a lot of outdoor space for kids to let off steam if they get fractious.
Not interesting. Came with a child of 6 years. Neither me, no she did not like it. The pool with piranhas is impressive though.

Love it!. At first we wasn't really sure about visiting a science museum on our short trip, seems like a waste of time, but we did and it was a blast. we had so much fun inside, so many interesting things to see. Our favourite is definitely the raining flooded forest, with the giant fishes and the birds and the trees. It's really awesome. We didn't get the chance to go to the Toca-Toca section, because it was reserved for the school kids. Nevertheless the 4 euros entry was totally worth it.

Inventive science museum, artificial rain forest a must. This science museum is one of my favourite museums in Barcelona. Located on the foot of the Tibidabo hills, it has I think up to 5 floors, some for temporary exhibits, with the bottom floor being my favourite. It holds a Foucault pendulum, exemplifying the rotation of the Earth, various physical-mechanical exhibits allowing you to experience the laws of physics yourself, nature exhibits explaining fractals, cyanobacteria and many more. Mainly geared towards children but interesting for adults, too. The best part is the artificial rainforest set up in a portion of the floor, with live crocodiles, turtles and massive fish in the water, birds running around you, rainshowers and a real live capibara. Good for a fascinating afternoon. Entrance 4 eur, free for the clients of La Caixa bank.
Great place for kids on a rainy day. Good science museum. Rotative exhibitions. We saw one with dinosaurs. Great! There is also an indoor rainforest, worth seeing.

top to bottom. 5 stories with 3 floors almost empty of exhibits. Signage is not that good. You start at the top and all the good stuff is on the bottom floor, stick with it though as there are loads of interactive experiments to play with and the enormous rain forest exhibit is amazing. Well worth the visit.

The best museum I have ever been to. I really loved the CosmoCaixa. It is interactive, so it's really interesting to hang out there - it's not just as a normal museum, where usually you just read stuff and watch some videos. Here you can interact with almost all of the sights and the most amazing thing is the rainforest with all the animals in the middle of the museum. It is a perfect place for nature and science enthusiasts. Unfortunately we came way too late, we had just 2 hours to see it :/ I recommend arriving early, so you have enough time (I would say 4-5 hours) since its really big - it has 4 or 5 floors. It's perfect for kids, who will have lots of fun trying out the interactive tools (and additionally learn something) and watching animals. And the price is really cheap - 4€, for people from Barcelona even for free.

Interactive science museum. A very large building with lots of interesting activities also with English instructions. It was a shame that we hadn't kids with us, but we enjoyed the museum very much. There was even a large aquarium/rainforest inside the museum.

A nice place for children and adults. This is a very interesting place to go with children, although adults like it very much. As a science museum It has many different attractions, some are interactive. The rainforest is amazing, even for a Brazilian used to see this kind of landscape. Outside the museum there are a lot of attractions, like a weather station. There is a pleasant restaurant with a choice of food.

A must to see for science lovers. CosmoCaixa is located on BLUE line of BUS Touristic and as such is one of the best, if not THE best "museum" that we have visited. Whole -5th floor is interactive and visitors can learn by trying and observing various laws of (mainly) physics and other natural sciences. CosmoCaixa is also home of beautiful rain forest in which there are bursts of artificial rain falling that further enhance experience of walk through rain forest. This is a must to visit for all science lovers and families with school children. TIP: Entry fee is ridiculously cheap, eur 4 (3 with coupon from BUS touristic booklet).

Excellent day trip for all the family. This is a great attraction, at a great price. Only E4 per adult, and under 16s are free. This is a very interactive, child friendly science museum and an entertaining way to spend the day. All the exhibitions were engrossing and the amazon rainforest was incredible. The kids were amazed. This appears to be a very popular school day trip - as when we visited, there were plenty of school kids of all ages. And even at that the place did not feel full, and there was plenty of space. The restaurant (buffet) was good value at E14 per adult and E8 per child for all you can eat - usual food type, nothing fancy. Very enjoyable, the kids were entertained, educational without them even realising and great value. I would highly recommend a visit for any family.
Excellent for families with kids. Very interesting, well organised, beautiful science museum. My kids and i enjoyed every moment especially seeing the trees roots and the fish around them.

Exciting and informative . It is a exciting and informative museum. All exhibitions were professionally done and working. We liked the rainforest and the Antarctica exhibition outside.BUT it was difficult to navigate. We would recommend a overview map. Go there and have a very nice time!

Learning and having fun!. I use to visit this museum once a year and I am never bored of it. It makes me come back to childhood. Almost everything that surrounds you can be touched and tried. It makes science much funnier and simple. It is a perfect place for going with family or partner. I strongly recommend it!

Amazing!!!. The Amazon exzibit is the best thing I've seen so far! A complete educational centre that should be included in the tourist guide books! Found it by accident when coming down by foot from Tibidabo...speechless!
Entusiastic . Very Well done . Its aN interesting place to visit with very Nice things to learn about science , human body , animals and plants . The trees on the water are amazing!

A pool of scientific amusement and interaction!. This place is so cool! A giant amazon forest with capibara, piraima and other species... a matter room full of games which summarize all the boring concepts explained at school in a very pleasant way... Archimedes and meteorological explanations very easy to understand. It's just a pitty that the temporary exposition "Mediterraneum" isn't available anymore. P.S.1. go to the 3d planetariun, it's really worth the extra 4 euros;P.S.2. go where with some food in a bag or you will feel sorry for being hungry and not having seen anything you want

Always a fantastic museum!. Great great great in a nice uptown area, you can take the train crossing the hole city up to Av. Tibidabu and walk to the museum on the old street between ancient houses and then meet modern science in a cool museum. I have been there several times and it is really something special.

A great museum for kids and family!!. We enjoyed our visit to Cosmo Caixa Museum. It is not only a nice change of the busy touristic Barcelona, but also a great way to get to know a different area of Barcelona that is also very interesting. The building is very new and nice, the museum is very well done and entertaining. You can spend a hole day there. It also has a great OUTDOOR area for kids to run and play and eat, and the view is beautiful. The cafeteria is great and inexpensive too. WE LOVED IT!
Amazing but... Far from la rambla the center of Barcelona, with no metro station near it. Other than that its nice, scientific, and worth visiting..

Definitely worth spending a whole day. A great and cheap attraction for kids and grown-ups alike. I really liked the jungle green-house. The temporary expo on the Mediterranean was super. There's a quite decent cafeteria there, but if the weather's nice, there's a very nice green area outside the museum, great for picnicking.

Fantastic for old and young people. I was surprised how wonderful is this science museum! Excellent place for kids that can interact with wonderful experiences. This is those place that would made my physics class in school much much more interesting and easier.....Shows how is a tropical forest with huge trees, humid climate and some small animals.... Fantastic job!!!!! It is located far from the Barcelona tourist zone but it is worth!!!!

Superfun science stuff!. I liked the variety of exhibitions and it's possible for non-spanish speakers (and non catalan :) ) to enjoy everything there! One of the best places to visit in Bcn. I lived there for 6 months and visited twice, wasn't disappointed.

One of the best experience I ever had! . I won't lie, I've been planning to visit this place since I decided to visit Barcelona. And boy, my guts were right! This museum is wonderful. It's one of those things I would have loved to visit as a kid but I never had the chance to. That's what happened for 5 hours, after I entered this place: I became a little kid and was amazed by every single thing I saw.The fact that many of the things exposed were interactive surely helped! I was so excited, wandering through history and observing animals that I missed the planetarium show. I'd love to visit it again in the future, to catch all the tiny things that I missed, and I definetely will on my next trip to this colorful city!

Great place to take kids. This is a terrific science museum/exhibit and kids love it. I guess younger kids will like it the best, ours is 5 and he adored it. It has a great sunken rainforest with huge/medium/small fish, huge anacondas, birds and so on. Plus some dinosaur exhibits and loads more.. We didn't have time to go around all of it. It also has a half decent canteen and a restaurant (which we didn't try). As people say I would buy tickets online first as there can be a queue at peak time. Also take a map/check your route first as it isn't in the middle of town. There are some good barrio restaurants back down in Bonanova like Cherpi and Raco D'Angel, but I would give the restaurant there a go if I had the time, looked okay.

Great Place for Families. It is a great place to go with children. They have all facilities for babies and children from microvawes to heat up the meals, changing room just for babies (next to the raining forest) and many activities!

Brilliant fun for kids and adults. So much to do and see here, with a big highlight being the indoor rainforest which was simply stunning. My nephews (2 and 5) loved every minute as it was almost like a huge play centre for them!
Extremely well-done science museum.

Hidden Gem!. The CosmoCaixa was out of the way - took a taxi there and a long walk to the metro for the trip back in to central Barcelona - but well worth the trip. Our children (6,6,3 years old) were so engaged! We expected to spend maybe 2 hours there and it turned into a whole day, including chasing the pigeons around the outdoor area. If you have more than a day or two in the city with children, it's definitely worth checking out. And, it's really inexpensive too!

Excellent museum. very interactive and interesting. You must go early to get a place for Toca Toca and also visit the 3D planetarium. Entry is only 4 euro, and then 4 euro for each of the specials. Well worth it

Great exhibition of physics and biology. We surprised ourselves by spending over three hours in the various physics and biology experiments and demonstrations. Seems like the kids (8, 12 and 15) learned a lot new things about mechanics, optics, marine biology and evolution. Everything was suitable for each child and provided entertainment for adults as well.

Very fun for science lovers. Great museum to spend a day in, there is something for everyone. We are a group of students, only one of us is studying natural science, yet everyone loved the museum. Great for kids and all language speakers too.
Science in Barcelona. Excellent visit for science buffs, it was recommended by the gal at the hotel front desk, we completely enjoyed

Great place to visit, if you have time. It's a bit of everything. There is information about the Mediterranean, then biology, then technology and also a bit of archaeology and history! Lots to do. Also lots of kids running around. I left after 2 hours, as it wasn't quite as exciting seeing it all alone. Easy to get to as well by metro! And very cheap at 4 euro :)

excellent day out in barcelona. Spent nearly the whole day here with the family. There is lots to see and lots to do. The price of entry was only 4 euros and free for children. We did pay extra to go to the 3D planatrea which was also very good. It was easy to walk to from the metro station ave tibidabo.

Amazing exploration. The visit of Cosmo Caixa is excellent choice how to spent few hours in Barcelona. If you are interested how the law of physics work and how the life expanded in universe... definitely worth to visit,

Plan to spend the entire day. While I was working, my husband and 8 year old daughter were exploring the Cosmo Caixa, which according to them is an amazing science museum. They took tons of great pictures of everything from an actual rain forest to a cute octopus to some monkey game that my daughter played a dozen times. They spent the entire day there and for my attention-challenged daughter, that's saying a lot. This is a must see attraction for families while in Barcelona.

The most interactive Museum in Barcelona. Although a bit distant from city center, when I got there I realised that the location well served Cosmo Caixa purpose. I have to admit that I loved the views, which made the experience relaxing and helpful allowing me to can disconnect once in a while. The Museum itself is spacious, well distributed, coherent, interactive, and with good explanations about scientific phenomena, facts and laws. I highly recommend it for those interested in the subject or even for those that are absolutely bored of just wall hanging text on the museums. The cafeteria could improve though, in terms of offer, quality and pricing.
Great place. Spacious with lots to learn. It has an amazing rainforest where visitors are not rushed about. Don't miss it.

GREAT LOCATION. We had such a great time here! The price was only 4 Euro for adults and free for my 9 year old. We spent half the day running around, trying to different exhibits and reading all about Science. We also viewed the Flooded River and got to experience the "Rain Forest". This is a must for a visit to Barcelona.
Pleasently surprised. Cheap entry, lots of things to see and do inside...We spent atleast 4 hours there looking around and playing with all the gadgets... Would have been perfect for a school trip

Well represented.
