The museum was good, but we went there during a field trip of maybe all of Barcelona's schools that day, so it was very noisy, so try to avoid this by going in the afternoon.It was very big and you can easily get lost in there, i think a tour guide will be best especially when you can not see all the exhibits in a day, so a tour guide will at least guide you through the important stuff.

A bit dissapointed. Compared to similar activities in Paris and Mechelen, this one is inferior. Don't go with your kid over week days, cos lots of parts are closed due to organized school groups. My impression is that the official website is not informative. Great experience is flooded forest (so, 3 points). Otherwise, not much to se... My kid and myself, we can't forget Technopolis in Mechelen (Belgium).

Great museum to visit. If you like science museum this one you must visit. Also there is very nice Rainforest section with live animals, and on top floor some nice fossils.I would recommend to visit if you are in Barcelona for more than few days.
Great museum!. Great price/quality ratio. For 4 euros you have access to big, entertaining museum. If you spend more than week in Barcelona, this is a must-see.
Wonderful experience for the whole family.. The amazon rainforest was really nice. And amazing that the entrance was only 4 euro's for adults and children were free!

Unique experience. When in Barcelona, you should absolutely pay a visit to this amazing museum! Here science is taught a very understandable way and you can stay for hours there, exploring all the wonders of our world from marine life to evolution of human species through numerous experiments and interactive displays. The exhibiton is suitable for adults and children and everything is nicely translated into English.
Interactive family fun. Large varierty of exhibitions and experiements which you can get involved in - amazing aquarium at the end was a nice surprise. Lots to see, do and learn.

Very interesting for children. If you want to do/visit something to make your kids/teens happy, this a really good stop. A lot of interesting facts and experiments presented In one place. A very impressive building. You can stay a whole day in this place
Nice piece of Art to visit. For those interested in Art, this is a place where local people go. Worth a visit. Check first what they have on display.

A Perfect stay on a rainy day. All together a great place to study, learn and experience.We went to CosmoCaixa with kind of no expectations and came home totally fulfilled!My to kids 6-7 years old had lost of fun trying to figure out how everything works.And me and my wife had a very interesting day learning so much about so different stuff.We will return next time we are in Barcelona.
Fantastic building with lots to do. A huge interactive experience with lots to do for children and adults. All displays are in Spanish, Catalan and English. Excellent cafe, restaurant and gift shop.

so much fun. great for us on a rainy day, and we are two 29 year olds. Spent more than 4 hours there. The cafe serves snacks and beer and coffee. The imax show was more for kids, everything else was really fun.

Incredible collection . We are there together our family,our each manner really enjoy Museum teach us since history climate change effect environment awareness;which is worth of money to visit we spend there almost 2hours near the beach too. We enjoy it a lots.

Our kids wouldn't leave. Went for the morning and ended up spending the whole day at CosmoCaixa. Relative to other science museums we've been to in the UK and Europe this is by far the newest and best. Was a EUR15 taxi ride from where we were staying close to the beach. Was filled with school children doing tours but never felt as though we were queuing for any exhibits. Would consider this the best attraction in Barcelona if you have children like we do. Also the cost of EUR4 per adult to get in is ridiculously good value for money.
Great science museum. Great museum for visiting with kids. Kids can learn a lot by doing all kinds of experiments. Hours of fun!

Great museum for kids and adults. The museum building looks old from the outside but is super modern on the inside. The exhibitions are hands on and our daughter had a blast here. We could have spent hours. If you have children, definitely worth the visit. It is a little bit out of the way but the bus stops right in front.

Excellent value and long opening hours. We visited this in the evening, a great time to head to this brilliant science museum. Loads of hands-on stuff to keep the children amused and fascinated. Lovely building too. Great value , especially with our money off voucher from our city tour booklet. Normally €4 per adult and free for children. We saved €1 each! We only had about two hours and could've easily spent much longer exploring. A great and value for money family trip.

Perfect for visiting with kids. We went there without too much excitement and my 10y/o and 8y/o were delighted...! We pay for the planetarium and it was really worthy and lovely experience...! We were glad to have visited this museum. One of the best for kids we ever been...

Stunning experience!. This Science Museum is brand new - and is just stunning. From the moment you enter - and see very life-like wax models of Einstein and Darwin sitting at the pay desk- you know this is going to be good.! Highlights for us were the flooded tropical forest which demonstrates trees growing very tall - and big fish swimming very symbiotically in the waters beneath- wonderful to look at. There are great and very life-like figures of early Stone Age men ( and women) .... And lots of interactive, hands-on installations to help explain science in fun, visual ways. Quite awe-inspiring.We saw some Spanish school-children loving every minute of the exhibitions and interacting very enthusiastically. Great place to take children- and a great place to get in touch with you own inner child!

Very interesting science museum. This museum is a bit out of the main tourist way at the foot of Tibidabo hill. We went there with our five-year old (I guess a bit young for the sciency exhibitions), and had a great half-day there. The exhibits are well made, communicating basic principles of geology, biology, physics and mathematics in an entertaining way, geared towards children and young adults. Going on a weekday in the off-season, we had the museum almost to ourselves, apart from one or two school classes that were visiting. The admission is 4€, which is good value for the money.
Very interesting and dynamic museum. It is a really interesting and interactive museum, perfect for spending the day with the family. Also highly recomendable to go with kids.

The science museum visit. Excellent educational experience even for the grown ups - be ready to spend a full day time. Walk down from pl. del funicular to av.tividabo to feel the sights and sounds of the neighborhood.

Experience science. It is an very interesting, interactive and large museum, I loved all the exhibitions - the seas and their global issues, the physics instalations, the history area, the Amazon Forest.

Sci-fi!!!!. It is an very interesting place to go for knowledge. There is also a very little piece of Amazon Forest inside and it seens that we are there because of the climate that is very hot. The plants under the water seems to be very real. Try it!!!
if you're interested in science. it is really interesting, you can try all the exhibits. As for me, the best part was Flooded Forest. There are birds, fishes and trees!

Cheap, Cool & Educating Place. So much to see and do, could easily spend all day there. Something for all ages and not all just about science, the rainforest is amazing and so well set out as you go under the water.Great value for money and off the beaten tourist traps which I think makes it better as it's a real hidden gem of a place. Has to be the most interesting museum I have ever been to, cannot recommend enough

The best spent 8 euros ever. The best spent 8 euros ever :). Maybe it’s more for teenagers, but.. after one or two “science research” exercises you feel like him. Tropical forest was an amazing experience. You have to see 3d movie planetarium.

Cool place to learn basic things. Very exciting games and tools. You can play with physic games lot of time. Permanent part is good enough for €4/person but you should arrive at time to have chance to visit the temporal rooms.

Excellent science museum especially for near teen or teen kids. If you like science museums this one is worth the trip especially if you are traveling with near teen or teen kids . Mid sized science museum with a lot of cool stuff. It is a little hike up the hill,from the train stop but even as an adult I found it of interest. It is free with the Barcelona card which I have mixed feelings if worth it, but I think I did get my monies worth of the card.

Excellent value for money. Lots to see. The amazon rain forest is amazing and so cleverly built so that you can see both above and below the water. Also loads of fascinating scientific displays with many hands-on. At €4 this is real value for money. The cafeteria has a good choice at reasonable prices and seating inside or outside in the sunshine.
loads of interactive things. Very big and interesting museum with loads of interactive things.however very far from metro station (easy to get lost) value for money (only 4 euros )

excelent!. Very nice museum with active artyicles for children as well. Thery have also new exhibitions as well and changing them from time to time.We enjoyed very much.Be aware to walking distance from metro station - a bit hard with younger children.
Excellent. Its new science museum, it was educating and very attractive to our 3 kids and we spent several joyful hours there in relatively low cost, we warmly recommend.

A lot of interesting/ interactive exhibits. Lots of buttons to press and things to interact with! This was a really well done museum and the perfect place to spend a cloudy morning. For 4 euros, I thought it was really good value for money.
Cool!. Both the temperature and area.Lovely old squares and buildings look hard enough and you will find good bars and less touristy restaurants

This everyone will enjoy. This is really the place to spend your time and learn something new about history, problems in our time, science, or the wonders of nature. There are a lot of interactive experiments which illustrate how phisics really works as you have learned. There are also a lot of aquariums with many kinds of interesting crearures living in the water and explained why evolution taken this path for them to evolve. There is a small, but beautiful rain forest with some birds and mammals, it was wonderful as well.

A Very Interesting Place. My wife and I went to the CosmoCaixa for the first time and enjoyed it. I think that children enjoy it more than adults because they can have hands on experiences here, touching the scientific exhibits. For us the most interesting place was the Flooded Forest. You could see the fish from inside the museum and then you could go outside and see the simulated rain. We also saw the capybara.

best value attraction in barcelona. had a couple of hrs spare before going park guell so came here and could of spent longer only 4 euro very interesting exhibits lots to see walking around and the rain forest had the biggest aguarium of tropical fish ive ever seen great half day out

Good value for money. It is not close so bear in mind you'll travel at least 45 min. But it is totally worth it. Everything is high tech. You have aquarium, zoo and planetarium. We loved the flooded forest. Nothing I've seen before. The price was 4 EUR i believe. The rain forest was great and the 3D movie was unique experience, less than an hour or interesting facts.

As good as it gets. A high tech general science museum, and a high tech natural sciences museeum, and a high tech zoo with aquarium, and a high tech planetarium. Essentially a high tech playground, so be ready to spend at least 4 hours unless you want your kids to hate you for the rest of your holiday. We were particularly impressed with the Amazon rain forest exhibit, a mini forest with live animals, birds and fish, and dwarf kaymans, with artificial rainfall and typical atmospheric environment, it would be the pride of any zoo in the world. All that for the unbeatable price of 4 euros pp, which makes any other attraction severly overpriced. I would recommend spending 4 more euros for the planetarium show, a 40 mins 3D documentary about space, screened over your head on a concave screen, truly unique. 10/10 for sure.

Best Valued Attraction on Our Trip. The CosmoCaixa Barcelona was by far the most fun we had for the least amount of money (which is saying a lot in a tourist destination like Barca). For merely 8 Euro, I got a ticket to the best science museum I've ever seen. I mean, there's a mini-frickin-Amazon Rain Forest inside.There are so many interactive exhibits, people of all ages will have a day filled with educational activities.Run, don't walk to CosmoCaixa Barcelona!

We loved this place!. Even though it is rather far from the city center ( from Barceloneta I had to change transportation 3 times), you will not regret it. This museum is interactive and extremely interesting. You have the possibility to try several experiments. The flooded forest is breathtaking. The price of the ticket is very low:4 euro comparing with other Barcelona touristic sites. Reserve for this place at least half a day and bring warm clothes because inside it is very cold.

We loved it!. This wasn't on my list to begin with. But reading other people's reviews I decided to go. And I'm not sorry. We all had a lot of fun, because it's not only educational but also very interactive.

well worth trekking up there. Our three, of varying ages were engaged and quite riveted at each individual experiment. the pendulum, was revisited multiple times as was the rain forest. we were there four hours and could have used another 2 to adequately study everything.

Hidden cultural jewel. My preferred technical museum since Philips Evoluon closed is the London Sience Museum, but Cosmo Caixa is up to standards, as to the prectical, touchable, sienceexperiments and explanations it adds a full biological area including a glass enclosed rain forest of large proportions.
Brilliant would highly recommend. very interesting and inter active, great if you are into science and planets. Very good for children lots of hands on science

Worth a visit. I went with my husband and 15 year old daughter and we all very much enjoyed it. It was a little difficult to find and also a little difficult to get around once we were inside. Good value for money and lots to see inside.

great for children of all ages. Buy a Hola BCN ticket which gives you unlimited public transport and free admission to this great attraction. Spacy architecture and really thought -through interactive 'exhibitions'. Able to put over complex scientific ideas in very accessible ways.

Thumbs up. Spent a fun afternoon with our 8 and 5 year old. Good value for money, kids were engaged for the 2 hours we were here. Great museum with plenty of interactive tools that are stimulating yet uncomplicated for children. We all enjoyed the artificial rain forest too. Great way to spend a couple of hours and a bonus that there were no queues. The museum is also spacious, a refreshing change to museums we are used to visiting.

Not to be Missed.. There are impressive diplays throughout the building. There is a very detailed study of the Mediterranean waters. There are several excellent audiovisual frames to study.The science of Geology is highlighted by a full wall of each type of rock.The Amazon water and land life will impress you with the glass walled displays showing fish - vines - ferns etc. The museum is a ten minute walk from the Metro Station -- Av. Tibidabo.

Nice. This is a great museum for kids and for adults that want to spend an afternoon related to science but chill out. Despite the fact that it doesn't go deep on science it is interesting and over all lots of fun.

Ok - Seems outdated. This musem is fun for kids - there's plenty of things to see and touch.. but it's not great for adults. The planetarium was nice and the exhibit on the Mediterranean is great as well... but after seeing everything on the ground floor there isn't much else.
Great for even adults. I would never have gone her but my 20's nieces wanted to go and I thought it was amazing. It was so much fun and took several hours.

Lost interest quickly. . I went there with my girlfriend as a last minute decision after visiting Parc Guell and had heard great things about it. It was definitely entertaining for a while however after exploring the bottom level we quickly grew bored. The upstairs levels hold nothing except large theaters and the planetarium which run shows throughout the day. Because we were there later in the day we missed all of the planetarium shows so make sure you check the timetable before visiting. Maybe if we made it in time our experience would have been better. The layout is rather confusing and we spent a lot of time exploring the other floors and not finding anything. There were no staff members around to ask either which was frustrating. The rainforest was interesting however i don't feel it was quite large enough for the land animals that are housed there.

Excellent way to spend an afternoon avoiding the intense heat!. This attraction was a bit out of the way and a good 10 min walk from the Metro, but then that also meant it was quiet and no queue to get in. It was very cheap to get in (8 euros for adults and children free) and kept us amused for 3-4 hours. If we'd have been organised and timed our visit to catch some of the shows we would have been there even longer so excellent value for money. It has the largest amount of interactive displays I've ever seen - great fun, particularly the giant block of ice. Very informative section about the Meditarranean, plus lots of geological info etc. Great for my son who is an aspiring geologist-come-oceanographer - he was mesmerised!Definitely recommended.

Unbelievable. I liked the concepts they are adopting.their annual preprations and organizing for the annual Course for Museology, Towards a total Museology! I already attended it in 2010the director Prof. George is amazing person, helpful & experienced one as wellwish to go there again :)you need at least a full day to experience all its activities ;)

Best part of visiting Barcelona!. I was quite excited to go when researching about it too. It is located close by Tibidabo mountain/amusement park. On the way there, you will see gorgeous streets and buildings (I sure did take a lot of pictures of those)This was definitely my favourite part of visiting Barcelona! I found myself enjoying and learning at the same time. The interior of the museum is lovely and also the walk through flooded rainforest was great! I would come here again and visit the planetarium, sadly the tickets were sold out for the day so you should book online if you want to see that. There is an aquarium area too (along with the flooded rainforest in which you can see fish/turtles swimming around). It has a very cheap entry fee- we got in for free with the barcelona card but I would pay even if I didn't have it. The whole family loved it!
Amazing museum. Great for kids and adults - and only 4 Euro for the three of us. Truly wonderful and great as a safe haven from the peak of the sun.

FANTASTIC. Highlight of a great trip to Barcelona!. This is what ALL science museums must aspire to. It is huge and full of interactive wonder. We got in free with the Barcelona card, otherwise it is just 4 euros for adults to get in (and worth every penny). I actively sought to visit this place thanks to many excellent reviews and I was, despite my high expectations, still blown away by the sheer scale and diversity of what could be experienced. I cannot describe it, it is like an architectural wonder, a museum, an art gallery, an aquarium, a playcenter, and a botanical garden all rolled into one. The ladies and gentleman at CosmoCaixa have created wonderful interactive installations that will help you refract light at the touch of a button, create waves, replicate sand dunes, operate a hot air balloon and much more. Definitely worth an extended visit.

Best science museum ever. You must find this place, it truly is a treasure of barcelona and by far the best science museum i have ever visited. they have various experiments you can interact with and dinosaur fossils which educate and entertain. the highlight must be therecreated amazon rainforest within the complex complete with a viewable undewater aquariam. The collection of exotic animals although few was a welcome additions. The giant Icecube, life like neanderthals were all a treat. If you are in Barcelona do NOT miss this place out!! Free entry with a barcelona card and make sure to set aside at least 4 hours to see this place :)
Very interesting for children and adults. And not expensive (4€ adult, free till 16 y old), what's not frequent in Barcelona.Don't miss the jungle. A lot of funny experiences for chldren.

Brilliant. We headed to Cosmo Caixa on one of our last days of a week in Barcelona. It was primarily to find something for my five year old who had been very patient for most of the trip with his parents dragging him through Gaudi related sights. My only regret is that we did not allow more time for this fabulous spot. It amazes me that we had to queue for hours for some cbd based gaudi spots when this was almost empty. It is a 5-6 storey building which is architecturally beautiful, being designed in a helix shape where a central ramp runs down through all five stories. There is an internal rainforest (a real one as my son kept on exclaiming) and the design, layout and information are just incredible on every level. We loved it and sincerely wished that we could spend more time there. My son is still talking about it ... it set a whole new benchmark for museums/science and technology centers anywhere. Thoroughly recommend.

Great interactive place to visit. This is one of the places we chose to visit while in Barcelona because it is very unique. They have a planetarium, an interactive touching exhibit ( great for kids of all ages ), and just all kinds of displays, and working models about our earth. They also have a working rainforest you can walk through and see animals, birds and fish. This could easily be a full day especially with kids. We spent about 4 hours there and enjoyed it very much. They also have a place to get food and a gift shop. All is reachable from the public transportation which we took, but they have parking as well.

Excellent Museum....take a lot of time to see it!. It was great, but you need a lot more than a couple hours to see it. It had a lot of science with history and aquarium thrown in. Very fun for my 8 year old after seeing many art museums. She said, "Finally I get to do what I want!" If your kids need a break from all the architecture and art add this museum to your itinerary.

Awesome value, worth it if you have kids. On one of the rainy days in Barcelona, we chose to trek to Cosmocaixa which is located near the Av. de Tibidabo subway station that can be reached via L7. From the station it's a short walk to reach the place.I had seen the good reviews beforehand, but I couldn't believe what a bargain this place is. For adults it costs 4 euros for entrance, kids under 16 are free. The movies and some other things would've required separate tickets, but we arrived in the afternoon so didn't think there would be time to enjoy the extra activities.The place is bigger than expected, with different scientific contraptions to tinker with. Each section had information and guidance in Catalan, Spanish and English so I had no problem explaining each part to my kids. Suffice to say, we learned a great deal that afternoon and had a blast. Best part in my opinion was the rainforest-section, with lots of animals including fish, tortoise, snake, spider and other critters of the Amazon. After seeing this I did not feel so bad about not visiting the city zoo.If you arrive early, you might combine Cosmocaixa with a trip up the Tibidabo. But I guarantee that you will not want to just run through the place, take your time and enjoy everything it has to offer.

Great afternoon out for kids and adults. Living in Barcelona this science museum is a place our kids never tire of, after at least a dozen visits. It has a replica of a rainforest, complete with micro-climate (including rain) and animals. Another section has all the major physics laws explained via simple machines, letting the children see first hand how the laws apply to the real world. They never want to leave that place!

Kids loved it - what more can a parent want?. Had a really enjoyable afternoon at CosmoCaixa during a recent stay in Barcelona. Highlights were the flooded rainforest and planetarium, although there are a huge number of interactive exhibits that kids (and adults) will love. We had visited the Aquarium in the marina prior to the museum and felt on leaving that is was overpriced and bad value for money. To some extent, we felt the museum was under-priced. A must-see place if traveling with a family.

Amazing, one of best museums in Barcelona.. Fantastic find! €4 entry and free to my 16 yr old brother. Could have spent ous in this fascinating interactive museum, suitable for literally all ages. And the man made rainforest that you can walk through was amazing! Would definitely recommend, excellent architecture and ground to sit and have a coffee in the coffee shop outside after too!

Terrific science museum. Wonderful place to spend an interesting and entertaining couple of hours. Plenty of interactive exhibits, covering a broad range of science - from Foucault's pendulum to a flooded rainforest. There are additional hands-on areas (and films) aimed at younger children, but we missed the time slots, so best to check times in advance if you are interested in the 'toca toca' or 'click and flash' exhibits.

Best science museum we've visited. Went on our last day in Barcelona to kill some time before our flight home. Awesome place. Free lockers where we stored all our luggage for the day. Cool and clean. Fabulously interactive and our children (aged 14 and 11) thought it was awesome ("better than London")Good, fair priced cafe with decent coffee, sandwiches and pastries and an bonus that it only cost 8€ for us all!! A 'must see'!

Very educational and interactive! Great value! . We loved CosmoCaixa! It's well with the €4 per adult (children under 16 years are free). There are several exhibitions, interactive games about science and research, aquatic life, a rainforest, and activities you pay an extra €2-4 for. You can spend all day at CosmoCaixa. For lunch, the food available at the cafeteria ia reasonably priced but for a big group it may be a better idea to bring a lunch. All in all a great experience for the kids and us!

Imaginative & interactive displays- great value. Decided to give this a try on a hot sweaty afternoon- if only because it would be cool & have air-con. We were not disappointed & it was cool in more ways than one;)Entrance just €4 for adults & kids up to 16 free. Paid extra €4 each for planetarium show- enjoyable 40 min show about space technology. 3-D glasses & audio headsets in English (or French?) provided. Entrance to main exhibits down long spiral walkway representing age of earth with fairly sparse exhibits en route. Finally reach main floor & any misgivings dispersed. 1st section on Mediterranean was interesting- text in Catalan, Spanish & English. Short videos also played in English. Various sections devoted to different aspects of science & technology & lots of interactive stuff most of which actually worked. Particularly good section on motion & Newton's Laws. But highlight & contrast to "hard" technology was the rainforest. Viewing panels allowed you to see the fish under water whilst walking underneath & around the trees and there were capybara & birds above. Rock lovers would appreciate the massive geological specimens- but we were tiring by this point.Spent about 3 hours there altogether & skipped over some sections. There were also separate temporary exhibitions- currently one on drugs- plus activities for younger children on at weekends. I don't know if they'd be accessible in English.I'd recommend to all groups although limited appeal for toddlers. My nearly 17 yr old really enjoyed it & engaged with all of it. Good for adults too.

Great way to spend a few hours with the kids. Really enjoyed our visit here. Easy to get to, and plenty of stuff to see and do. Many of the exhibits are elegant, hands on experiments to keep the kids interested. The indoor flooded rain forest is nice and I'd particularly recommend having lunch at the restaurant.

A great place to get lost. If you like to experience what science is about, this is a great place to explore. You can try many things which help you understand physics. I would not do the Planetarium again though as it was not that much about planets.

Excellent science museum !. It's place is a real gem, a bit far from the touristic routes and harder to get there but it's really worth visiting - especially with kids !It's a science museum but practically everything can be touched or played with and 90% of the descriptions are also in english.Definitely the best part is the "amazon jungle", complete with animals, fish and even a rain :)The entrance is cheap for adults (4 EUR per person) and for kids below 14 years the entrance is free.
Interesting and fun. Must see! Amusing, fun, children ( and adults) enjoy it! And cheapest in Barcelona, free entry for kids. Spent more than 3 hours there.

Must see family stop in BCN. Took our grandchildren (live in BCN) several times and they always find something new to see and learn. One of the biggest natural science museums in Europe but not on the sightseeing list for most families visiting BCN. You should take your kids. You will enjoy it and it is cool, quiet and a great break from the heat and crowds. Also should try the restaurant (not the cafeteria) as the menu is served cafeteria style (Americans Will know what I mean) and you can go back as often as you want for more. Very unusual in Spain. Service staff very friendly and attentive.

Very informative!. Couldn't believe how great the value for money is - only cost us 3-4 euros each and we spent about 3 hours there! The exhibits are very informative and there are plenty of interactive displays for the kids to play with. Also check out their indoor rainforest!

Wonderful place. This is an amazing science museum. A very big place. It has a lot of exhibits and a lot of them you can operate and use to get to know with the different laws of physics.Get ready for hours of fun and learning. You can spend a half of a day there.Very recommended for children above 7 years old. I traveled here at 14/07/2014 and it cost me 4 EURO
Kids loved it!. Thought it was difficult to entertain my kids until we brought them here! 3 hours and we didn't see it all!!

Great place to be with family. Interesting for all the family, small or older kids or just by yourself. We spent almost a whole day there, as they have a good buffet-restaurant, so you don't need to leave for lunch. The amazonian flooded forest is amazing, I never have seen such a good simulation.
Great Pleace for Science. Not better than the one in London but is a great science museum.Place is also easy to find.Entrance fee is also cheap, worth to spend 3-4 hours there...
Great for the kids. Planetarium, aquarium and hands-on science museum, and only 2 euro to enter. It's quite a ways so take a cab. Great for rainy day or if you have kids.

A bit off the beaten path but well worth it. The CosmoCaixa is not on the touristy path, but once you find your way, the neighborhood and the museum itself have much to offer. My kids (11 and 7) really enjoyed the flooded forest and many of the hands-on exhibits. Our family ended up spending quite some time learning about quantum cryptography. We took the FGC line L7 to Av. del Tibidabo, then walked across the street to catch the 196 bus to the museum. It's only a couple of stops on the bus and it's a really scenic ride in and of itself. We did not get a chance to explore Tibidabo more (the church and the amusement park etc.) so will just have to add it on our to-do list next time.

Fantastic!! . I loved it! Super recommend if you love science and nature as me and my family. We watched a planetarium session, and we felt inside the movie. The 3D system is awesome. Everything in museum is fascinating, there's so many things to see that we'll need back another day. You can eat delicious foods in a restaurant or a "cafeteria", they have an unforgettable pizza.
Large bouffe for adults and kids. large variety of dishes. price includes beverages. good solution for a family lunch during the visit at the museum.

Science for everybody. Ideal museum to discover science with kids. Big, interactive and with a huge inside "jungle". You can play with some of the objects exposed so it's easy to understand how the world works.
There's an outdoor space were you can eat and drink.
I loved it!!

I love the chance to mess and see the practical side of science. A visit here is to be given the chance to be a messing child again without any telling you 'don't touch'. All the things you know to be true about science but get to see in practice. A great place for adults and kids alike - so rekindle your inquisitive nature and go visit.

Truly brilliant - you must go!. This place is amazing! I wouldn't normally spend too much time in museums, but I spent 3 hours here, and still wish I'd had more time. Level -5 had a wonderful range of exhibits across physics, chemistry and biology, all at a good level of science while remaining accessible to all. The Mediterranean exhibition was extremely interesting, and the Flooded Forest was superb - a must see!Downsides were an awful croque monsieur and a disappointing and expensive gift shop. Despite these, entry to this museum was probably the best €4 I spent in Barcelona - I highly recommend it!Tip: there isn't a huge amount on floors -4 to -2, so don't feel any need to rush level -5.

Good, not great.. My husband is an engineer so I had no choice but to tag along. Honestly, there are some fun things to do, but I have been too much better science centers. Good for kids- not so much for adults.

Real Big Fish. I was here for a conference and never would have thought of visiting otherwise. All the Gaudí takes the plaudits. Mostly a local, small crowd in this excellent museum/aquarium/science place. The cross-section looking into the tank is especially impressive.

Fun for kids and adults. Even grown-ups are never too old to learn :) Informative, child friendly, but serious enough to keep adults amazed as well. Facts are presented in a format that is easily understood. Fun to “play” around with the different projects. Good value for money. If you have the time, your kids will enjoy this outing, but you can surely go there and learn a few things yourself if you are young at heart.
So cheep!. 4€/adult? There's nothing so cheep in Barcelona! great place to visit both for children and adults. Rainforest was great, the science museum had so much to see.
Interesting museum. Loved the rain forest, cheap fees and science exhibitions. My kids 3 and 4 loved it. Especially anything with a button.

Very instructive for persons of any age. This museum has interesting stuff to occupy three hours of your time. Check the viewing times of the planetarium and plan accordingly. Really enjoyed the Amazonian Rainforest enclosure and underwater gallery. Very recommended but could be a bit noisy especially if crowded by school-children.
Good for children. If you are travelling with children, this is one of the best places you can take them. They can live so many experiences that they won't even want to leave.

Really great science center even for an adult. I really enjoyed this science center. I went first thing in the morning and it was dead quiet. I loved the olive oil display. I would skip the planetarium. it was so not worth it.

Brilliant!. Top tip - go after 5pm. You still have 3 hours to look around and its peaceful. Unless of course you like hubbub. The museum has everything - the famous Amazon rainforest (a huge water tank with enormous doleful fish), physics experiments, fossils and skeletons, a selection of books in different alphabets, a wall of famous scientific equations....Also the food in the cafe is excellent

great low cost option for rainy day. Our kids of 6 and 10 had a great time here although they reckoned it wasn't quite as good as the science and natural history museums in London. Building very modern and spacious with no queues despite large number of school groups. We particularly liked the very life-like waxworks of Einstein and Darwin at the reception desk ! Lots of hands on experiments - buttons to press, things to taste and feel etc which keep kids entertained for hours even if they aren't aware of which scientific principle is being demonstrated! Cafe reasonably priced too and just remember to get your car park ticket validated inside if you want 2 Hours free parking.
very long walk. you have to pass from the the alleys and the traditional stores , taste the icecream , the coffee was terrible :pbut you have to ware shoes for walk !!!!!very nice place

Great experience.. If the weather is not great for the beach this is a must to visit. The sunken forest is beautiful and impressive. The many many practical experiments, explanations of biological, geological, natural and physical phenomenons is brilliant. Really hands on museum. Loved it, children will love it even more. Great place to spend a few hours on your way to Tibidabo or when it's raining.

Great place for kids!. If you have kids, then take them here. Lots on hands on things and they usually have English explanations. The amazon rain forest is great, has lots of native fish species that are huge...some as big as an adult. Can get noisy when school groups are there.

Loved it. I loved this museum :) If my legs weren't hurting so much, I could have spent a lot more time here. I didn't like the exhibition on the Mediterranean though, it was made up of a lot of text screens, some movies, and a few interactive things that in my opinion was a bit boring. But to each his own, I'm sure some would have loved it. When we first came past this, the rest of the museum was amazing. I loved how interactive it was throughout, they illustrated the science in a fun and easy-to-understand way. The flooded forest was also a highlight, we could see both over and under water through the glass. The ducks were showing off in the water, and were especially fun to watch :) The museum had English text throughout the exhibitions, which is a huge plus. I found the entrance to the flooded forest a bit hard to find though. The entry price is good, there's lots of seating areas. It is a bit hard to find by bus/metro. We popped by after visiting Tibidabo. The bus going from the funicular and down, goes right past this museum (there is a bus stop right outside).I would want to return if given the opportunity, it's a great museum :)
What a place to study. This must be the best place to go with childs! It has a lot of experiments where you can see all that you study at school and, best of all, has it's own atlantic forest!
Very interesting non-tourists museum. Wonderful museum for children and adult. Exhibition with forest exiting! You can touch everything inside of museum and take a lot experience. Recommend!))

good, however very quiet and difficult to navigate. We visited her on Sunday 18th May, the museum was very quiet and we founhd navigation around all the exhibits on the various floors a little confusing. We also booked onlione for tickets £4 each, this was cheap, however when we arrived we were told that we didn't have to pay. There system should not have taken our money.The rainforest section is the best, with huge fish with great viewing galleries.

5 hours not enough! But take bus 196 from metro a tibidado. We came using our BCN card so our entrance was free, paid e4 each for planetarium. Take the train to ave tibidado, then cross the street and take bus 196 up to cosmo caixa. There are no signs so this is an important tip, otherwise its at least three blocks walk uphill.Great views on top of hill, bus 196 passes funicular area before dropping off at cosmo caixaso its a free sightseeing tour along the way.Beautiful modern building, interesting exhibits, comfy clear planetarium show with english / other languages headset translation.We arrived at 12, and left at 5pm, but still we were only able to complete 2 levels. Its an interesting science museum even for adults and well travelled teens.Good day out, refreshing alternative to all the antiquities and religious art that we have seen in a 15 day trip through italy and barcelona. Science topics are timely as well.

Very good museum but book in advance!!. We ended up queuing for 2 and half hours for this museum which meant that our time inside was limited as we had tickets for another attraction in the afternoon. If you were planning on visiting on a weekend, public holiday or during school holiday i would DEFINITELY book online first. Great interactivity inside. You could spend the whole day here if you wanted to check out every display so enough to keep children amused. My boyfriend and I (aged 24) don't have any kids but we still had a great time in there!Easy to get to on the metro. Its about a 10-15 min walk uphill from the metro station so anyone who has difficultly walking may want to take the tram up the steep hill instead. Overall, great museum. Just a shame about the entrance queues.

Amazing Cheap Museum. This is an amazing museum, it is huge and only €4 entrance! We visited in a Saturday during the day, it was quiet with no queue. The interactive displays are incredibly fun and educational and the children there seemed to be having a good time. The rainforest is great and includes an underwater walkway. A must do if visiting Barcelona
One of the best science museum ever visited!. We were lucky to get a free entry as they had some special offers on that day. It was a great learning experience. Quite informative and fun filled trip.

Great day out for young children. This museum is one of the cheapest ways to spend a day in Barcelona (€4 per adult, children under 16 free) and it's absolutely brilliant. There are lots of interactive exhibits with signs in English (as well as Spanish / Catalan), a fantastic swamp with a glass wall so you can see the fish swimming under the water, a good cafe, and it doesn't ever seem to get that busy. It makes the science museum in London look even more dated! The extra activities are only for children aged 3+ and they're all in Catalan NB.

Very interesting, teaching and demonstrative. Wonderful place to come both for the kids and adults; the entrance is very affordable; there are plenty options for the activities and for kids to ask the parents what they do actually remember from the school lessons. Do not miss the planetarium

A great place to see. Was not expecting to have such a great time! Suitable for children and adults alike. Many interesting (and a few less interesting) experiments for everyone to try out - great fun and also educational. Worth more than the ticket price, a must for anyone who loves exploring the world around them.

An all round great day out and a low price too!. i have been to science museums in many places, London, Glasgow, Paris, Munich and so on. This is definitely the best all round, accessible and fun one yet. The place is very modern and welcoming and has Spanish, Catalan and English signs on everything. There's lots of interactivity, a great layout and an amazing Amazon rainforest aquarium that'll put many aquariums to shame. A decent cafe, a great outdoor space and friendly staff make this a Barcelona must see. Also, not half as busy as I was expecting or as it should be!

One of my favourite museums. We came here after visiting Tibidabo. I recommend combining these 2 attractions as they are quite close to each other. And I would suggest doing them in this order, so any walking done is downhill... It is truly amazing value for money for such a small entrance fee and the amount of fun to be had. There is so much to see and everything is well laid out. The rainforest area with the giant fish and tank is spectacular. There is a well stocked souvenir shop with interesting items at reasonable prices. We ate at the cafe, and the food was also reasonable.From Tibidabo, take the tram down. At the tram station, follow the tram line downhill until you reach an underpass. Cross over and you will see a submarine to your right, walk towards it. The CosmoCaixa will be on your left. Should take 10-15 minutes.Once you're done, take the small steps going down near the entrance, the L7 train station is about 10 minutes walk away.
Amazing Cheap!. Great place for the kids. Heaps to learn! Loved the tropical rain forrest. It was a highlight for the kids. Thought I would never get to see piranha's until I went here.
Science Museum. It is a perfect museum for those who love the science. It is a great museum where you find a copy of a tropical forest, the geological wall , the planetarium and many others

Great presentation on evolution and earth history. First of all - easy to get to on Line 7 of the underground system - you are in Zone 1 the whole way, so just need a zone 1 ticket (the ticket machines are slightly confusing if you are used to just popping on the other metro lines) - and then a fairly short (although uphill) walk. The museum itself uses tubing to demonstrate passage of time between earth's creation out of a supernova cloud, the beginning of life, and various evolutionary milestones. Fossils are nicely added as supportive evidence. Good display on the history of the Mediterranean Sea as well as current risks from climate change and invasive species. Nice section on basic physics (one of us has a strong science background, the other is an artist - and the artist found things easy to follow and "learned a ton") - the amazon rainforest was interesting and impressive, but I didn't think it was really the strong suit of this museum, even though it is a selling point. The only downside was incredibly unruly adolescents who were literally running and chasing each other through the museum. I'd highly recommend this to adults, families...you could spend 2 hours there, or 5 hours there...We didn't do the planetarium, but that would add more time as well. FEE IS VERY REASONABLE!!!!
Good visit with boys aged 8 and 12. Place to go if travel with family. :-) we spend easily four hours -5th floor exploring things. Lots of fishes to see under the rainforrest.

Very interactive and interesting.. When we first went in, I was concerned, since it's location is out of the city a bit, and it seems a little too quiet when you enter. There also seems to be very little there on the entrance floor, however, you follow a timeline all the way down to the bottom floor (which is several floors down) down a large spiral slope, displaying information about the dates and what the world was like at this time. Once at the bottom, there's a bast room of interactive and fun exhibits explaining physics, biology and chemistry in a way that is accessible to anyone, even young kids. There was a temporary exhibition on the mediteranian sea when we visited, which taught me a lot of interesting tid bits. Once you get through the exhibits and one end, there's a tropical aqauriam full of amazing fish, one of which was absolutely huge. It rains in the aquariam, despite being indoors, to keep the climate authentic. In the tropical section there are also a view tropical birds flying around.I'm really glad we decided to go there, since I felt a bit let down by the rest of Barcelona. Best thing we did there.

An interesting visit. I love being able to learn at the same time as having fun, so usually something like this would be right up my street.The rainforest was absolutely amazing, so many different creatures, most of which I'd never seen before. A truly great experience.However, I found navigation around the museum difficult. We got lost several times and eventually you get tired of walking around. We also went for a session in the Planetarium, which was great fun, but there was litter everywhere and the 3D wasn't great.Saying that, there were a lot of great exhibits there and it's worth a visit, especially for the price of 4 euros + planetarium. Perhaps it would be better had I taken my family and not just gone as a couple.

The Science Museum is a great stand by.. This museum is easy trip via the Metro system and a bit of a walk but well worth the trek. The museum has an incredible 5 story upsidedown Amazonian tree that you circle down to the ground floor with an exhibition around how it spreads it's seed pods to regenerate. The mediteranean sea exhibit was amazing and gave insight to one of the greatest explanations for how the mediteranean sea was created and gives insight as to what or how it would have been percieved by people of the time as the "great flood". I highly reccomend this for families with young to teenager aged children.
Great afternoon. A fantastic afternoon, loads of hand on stuff for the kids, they loved every minute. Cafe was good for lunch too
What a Way to spend a Rainy Day. If you are travelling with children, then this a must. Lots and lots of hands on stuff, beautifully laid out.
Children will love it. Really well presented and laid out museum. It is a bit out of the main tourist area, but we used the metro to get there and got a tram back.
Worth the trip. Excellent - a bit slow to start - not all of the hands on "experiments" will grab you - but don't miss the "rain forest" and the planetarium

Excellent day out. Having done a lot of the tourist attractions in Barcelona we thought we'd try the science museum with our young children......Why haven't we been before?Granted if you are only in the city for a few days it wouldn't be top of my list of this to do,if however you have time, kids and the weathers a bit rubbish. It's blooming fantastic, they could run around, touch the experiments, the science was a bit beyond a 3/4 year old, but I did my best to present it to them so they could understand. My daughter referred to the experiments as being able to play, so she thoroughly enjoyed herself.They were so impressed by the rain forest section and aquarium, that made the trip for them and when you consider what you could pay at an aquarium this is value for money. Plenty to see and re-visit.We didn't have to pay to enter because we are members of Caixa bank but it was free the day we went for everyone, with only extra payment required for other activities such as the star viewing (sorry name escapes me). That wasn't too pricey and well worth it, as it was in 3D. Translations of commentary are available. Info in Spanish, Catalan and English.

Incredible day out; For an incredible price . ?4 for adults and free for kids is amazing. Kids and adults both pay the amazing price of ?4 for the planitarium. There are amazing experiments and facts, fossils and real life animals for the whole family of all ages to enjoy. There is also a cafe that you can go to. It is very interactive and is very impressive to children that are still learning. The staff are friendly the atmosphere is safe and fascinating. So to conclude even if you have little time left or even an adult wanting a good time the CosmoCiax is a must go.

Awesome for kids!. We've been to loads of science museums, and have heard mixed reviews about this one. But Wow! All three of the children (3,6,9 years) loved it. So did the adults. We went on a Sunday afternoon and it was free to enter. Not sure if this is a regular thing or if it was because there was a festival on. Still at 4 Euros per person regular price it is still worthwhile! There are loads and loads of hands-on activities, and all have English information as well as Catalan. There is even an aquarium (so you can forget the overpriced one on the water front) and a rainforest. We spent several hours in here, and only really explored the ground floor. The kids want to go back to Barcelona, just to go to the science museum again (and have hot chocolate and churros). Very different from the likes of the London Science Museum. I highly recommend this place to families visiting Barcelona!
Science Museum. Well worth a visit when you go to Barcelona. Use the city tour buses to get there and allow several hours to tour.

Amazing science museum. CosmoCaixa is a renowned science museum, ranked the best in Europe, with good reason. The museum has 5 floors which are all below ground level. There are many ways through the museum, but I'd recommend heading on the escalators first to the patio to check out the few things out there, as well as the nice view of the city. From there, move quickly through the ramps of dinosaur-age things down to the -5 level, where 95% of the museum's stuff is. The rainforest is awesome, and so many of the "exhibits" are interactive, it's impossible not to enjoy yourself. I think it'd be good for kids 6 through 60. The museum has everything from preserved artifacts (or recreations) from ages past, as well as timeless physics and biology exhibits. If you've got an afternoon free and aren't sure what to do, this won't disappoint. I'm not generally one for museums, but I'd block out 3 hours for this one.

absolutely great to go with kids. we went there with some friends kid´s aged 6 and 8. it was amazing to see them so interested. normally they lose interest within 5 minutes and we spent there a full day. Sincé we were watching the kids i didnt get so much time to enjoy but definitly worthwhile going. If you stay in the Center of Barcelona you can always combine it with other atrctions close by like Tibidabo.
Nice but not much to do. The museum was very nicely laid out, but there wasn't much to do or see really. My favorite part was the mini rainforest.

Buy your tickets in advance online!. Came here on Sunday before our afternoon flight. It was ridiculous with 40 min wait to get an entrance ticket. There is no automatic ticket machine, only 4 ticket windows for hundreds of visitors. Terrible first impression when you have two small kids in tow. Considering it is a science museum, they should have done a better job managing the entrance technology!!! But your ticket in advance if you don't want to wait in line.

Highly recommended!. Visited with my 9-year old son - and we had a great time. A fantastic Science Museum with lots of hands-on exhibits. We both loved it and my son didn't want to leave - after spending 4 hours at the place!

Fantastic. As a class one nerd, I of course had to visit CosmoCaixa whilst in Barcelona. And I was not disappointed. The museum is a little out of the way, but worth the effort to get there. The flooded forest exhibit was fantastic, and entire miniature ecosystem, complete with rainforest fish, mammals, and rain. The interactivity of many exhibits was fantastic, and the artistic quality of many of them.Due to the time we went, early afternoon, a number of areas were closed for the traditional Siesta, and as we had other things to do that day we had to leave without seeing them, but this can be avoided with a little more planning.Food was rather expensive however, best to bring a lunch as I did.

Interesting for kids, relaxing for adults . May be worth it if you want to give your kids a break in the mid of your journey. Only adults pay, very low. You can limit the visit to two hours without missing anything
fun for all ages. It was a fun day out :) and for all ages- i went wth a group of friends and i felt like a child again. the planetarium was pretty good too

Excellent but lacks a human touch. This is the second time we visited this museum. As usual it was excellent, tonnes of experiments and explanations, in short an amazing learning experience. Only disappointment though is that staff are cold and unfriendly plus no one mans the exhibition to help you experiment or provide more explanations on what you can see and do here. So while the exhibition is good, it does lack the human touch to make it a top notch experience.
Fun. You should check cosmocaixa...many many experiments that shows you how physics works..Learn something about chemistry.Big aquarium. Very nice...Go there on the way down from Tibidado hill.

Outstanding.. We went for half a day and soon realised we should have had this as a full day as the attractions are interactive, well explained and great for the whole family. It's not exactly on the beaten track but neither is it difficult to get to, just make sure you've planned tour buses or tube routes prior and your map goes that far for street names. We found it without much effort but it took a map and a wrong turn, but please don't let this put you off. As science museums go we were all entertained and genuinely dissapointed to leave early for another date.

Fun and not fusty.. We went for half a day and soon realised we should have had this as a full day as the attractions are interactive, well explained and great for the whole family. It's not exactly on the beaten track but neither is it difficult to get to, just make sure you've planned tour buses or tube routes prior and your map goes that far for street names. We found it without much effort but it took a map and a wrong turn, but please don't let this put you off. As science museums go we were all entertained and genuinely dissapointed to leave early for another date.

Best museum EVER!!!. As a science teacher and firm supporter of the London Natural History Museum (I love geology) we visited this museum to attempt to entertain the 3 year old with us... Within 5 minutes I'd forgotten he was even with us!Incredible exhibits to play with everywhere, rainforest, all of geology AS, i could bring kids here and take the year off!!Lots of school groups, quietened at about 2 though! Don't miss this place!!
Such good value for a family outing. Currently admission is only €4 per person which is really reasonable. The amazon exhibit alone is worth the price, my daughter loves it here.

Very interesting attraction. I liked a lot the visit at this museum. It's an imposing five story building with very diverse and interactive exhibit pieces. For just 4 euros you get to play with most of the exhibit's pieces, to get to understand better the principals that they are depicting for you. I was most impressed by the flooded forest ecosystem that they recreated inside the museum. It's really amazing when you enter there and the temperature instant changes, exotic birds go around you free and everything seems to be so real. it's like you are suddenly in the jungle. What I didn't enjoy was the journey to the museum. It's kind of far from the center and the touristic maps don't show you all the small streets that are in the area and it's really easy to get lost. And the people from the streets can't really help you since they don't know English and it was hard to find someone who knew where the museum was. But in the end it was definitely worth the trouble.

super place for families. Getting there for a 1st time may be a little confusing, but it is totally worth it! You won't notice how the time will pass :) Several floors, full of nature and science wonders. Be sure to see the RAIN!! We've been there with children. I guess adults would love it too.

A Gift from La Caixa. What a gift from La Caixa! My children and I loved the experience! Barcelona has so many unexpected treasures. A great detour from the crowds, and for my two children, from the walking tours and museums. Extremely well done!

Great thing to do with young children!. This was a fun day out with my youngsters, it was a rainy day so many people there, but besides that lots of hands on displays for kids to play, workout. Great price 4 euros adults And free for children!

Brilliant - something for everyone. I recommend this to anyone as a Barcelona 'must see'. It seemed to have a lot to interest kids with plenty of 'hands-on' type activities. I only went for one reason, and I wasn't disappointed - the amazing Amazon display. I have seen a few impressive aquariums in my time, including the huge display at Atlantis in Dubai, but the Amazon display is far more than a simple aquarium.There are excellent viewing areas for both above and below water level. The integration of trees and some above ground animals into the display is almost unique, plus the rain feature that simulates a downpour brings the big piracu to the surface. We were even fortunate enough to see one of the piracu slap the water fiercely during a simulated shower, and it sure gave us a start! Just brilliant and easy to get to via the metro.
was ok. Got in free due to the BCN card. It's not very well sign posted and it is quite a long walk from the metro station up a steep hill. Children will like this a lot more.
Good fun, for curios kids in many ages!. Nice place. Not too expensive. Alot to see. The 3 D movie was really nice, worth the money, a little hard to locate... Go for the submarine :)

A must see for all science freaks :). We had a lovely time at this museum! Kids go free and adults are only €4 each.Lots to see & explore.There is a nice rainforest with water and fishes at the base, nice unexpected touch.I love the spiral as it reminided me of the one in Vatican Museum in Rome.Interesting bits of architecture in and outside.Hours of fun.
The most interesting museum I have been to. The most interesting museum I have been to. If you are IT or like physics/math, you must visit this place.
Awesome!. I really enjoyed this place. It was not crowded when we visit. It was fun, entertaining for both children and adults. Definitely recommend visiting this place when in Barcelona.
not bad if you go with childrens. good expirince for child and also interesting for adults, big spaces with a lot of diferents things, we had good time
Kids fun. Travel by tour bus and tram. Enjoy all the inter-active exhibits. Especially enjoyed the rainforest which did rain. Loads for the kids to be kept amused.

Kids fun. Use the tour bus and tram to reach museum. Enjoy loads of inter-active things. Especially liked the rainforest which did actually rain. Can't think of anything negative. Great couple of hours with kids.

Fun day out!. CosmoCaixa isn't just a museum for children, it's a fun, educational museum which my friends and I (mid 20s) absolutely loved. We spent 5hours in their, taking part in all the activities! In particular we loved the indoor rainforest.
Only ok. Went with my three young kids and they actually got bored kind of fast. There were a few cool things, but the excitement didn't last. Only go if it's raining and there's nothing else to do

Worth visiting for adults, too. We visited CosmoCaixa on a rainy day, and we enjoyed at least three hours in the museum. We don't have children and we're young adults, but still we enjoyed the exhibition. The ground floor is big an filled with different things to see and touch. Some of the gadgets were obviously meant for kids but there was still a lot to see for adults, too.We enjoyed the "indoor rainforest" with exotic fish and birds. We also saw the 3D movie about space. It was clearly meant for kids but still enjoyable and the commentary was available in English via headphones. We didn't have to wait in line to get in, the museum was almost empty before a few school classes came. Definitely worth the trip from downtown and the price is only 4€ for adults.

A great place for kids. So much to see and do. Came with my two young daughters and we had a great time. Advise you bring a snack or picnic as food variety no great and expensive. Great place to have a picnic. The exhibition are so very attractive and easy to understand and use by the kids.

This museum is AMAZING!. On our last full day in Barcelona we decided to just randomly explore by bus and ended up in Cosmo Caixa - and I am so glad we got a chance to visit this AWESOME museum. I think it is 6 levels of amazing hands-on and interactive experiences ranging from underwater to space, cavemen and bugs, physics and chemistry - it's just had EVERYTHING. My kids just LOVED, LOVED, LOVED it here - my son wanted to go to summer camp here *hahahaha* and my husband and I were totally entertained as well. The fee was so minimal and it was "cute" to see Einstein at the check-in booth.

a Must visit attraction in barcelona. Either if you are with adults or kids, you will enjoy the tour. It is wonderful and big. I recommend visiting it early in the morning to understand many ideas there.

Fun place to spend a rainy day. We had a rainy day on our first day in Barcelona, and decided to check out the science museum. It's a little ways out of the city, so it will take some travel time, but it was worth the visit. It was very affordable to get in, and there was a lot to see and play with. I can certainly see how this would be a fun place for a family. There are a lot of interactive physics examples and fun things to see. The aquarium was really incredible. We enjoyed seeing all of the amazing fish and water life. In all, we spent a couple of hours, and decided to leave, but you could easily spend a half-day here.

Worth the queue to get in. Its like London's science museum and the zoo combined only in a more modern environment. You start on the lower level after walking down a never ending spiral, but the time passes as you try and work out what the rubbish art on the wall is, made from extractor hoses. From there you wander around between several floors of interesting science projects and botanical gardens. The tropical gardens are quite tropical.

Underutilized mystery. Even our tour guide was not knowing the place. It is a fantastic place with lovely attractions within. The amazon jungle created with live birds, animals and fishes was superb. The 3D planetary show was appreciated. Sadly there were no visitor besides our group of 22.

CosmoCaixa the fun museum. This is a museum for everybody - especially for the inquisitive mind. It is a science museum and you can touch everything to see how it works. There is a rain forest with trees and birds and fishes and it rains on one side and you can also go into this place. It is very popular and the queue is long but definitely worth it. You can buy two types of entry tickets. One just to visit the museum and one for the museum and a 3D show about Evolution (Darwin). For the show they have ear phones (whispers) if you can’t understand Catalan – very organised. There is a shop inside where you can buy books toys and science stuff and outside the museum is a cafeteria. Everything is nice and clean.
Ciutat de las Artes y de las Ciencias. Masterwork of arcitecture by Calatrava. Go, see and be impressed. The Science Museum is interestng especially for those who find Physics difficult.

not worth the trip out. this science museum is meant to be one of the best in europe. i suppose it is good for kids but if you're an adult it is quite boring. I was under the impression that there was loads to see here but there is only the main floor downstairs. the whole building is open to walk around giving the impression that there was more to see but the rest of the floors were empty. A lot of people were wandering around lost on the other floors and there are no staff to guide you. I guess for €4 it is good but not worth the trip out if you have no kids.The amazon forest was cool though.

Wonderful, and has a gluten free menu!!. Some months ago I wrote a review saying that my kids always left the Cosmocaixa (science museum) asking: When can we come back?Now I have to add that my son was diagnosed with coeliac disease, and our first experience in a restaurant was in Cosmocaixa, and it was wonderful. Not only did they know all about gluten free, but they even had pasta and bread for him, and made him feel really special. They have gluten free dished for adults, but a gluten kids menu as well.

It was Okay...But.... The planetarium show was really satisfying and the amazon habitat...But for the rest...Well if you don't have children with you this isn't a satisfying science museum to spend time...

great place for kids. Very interesting and intertaining museum. Explanations are short and clear, everything is so visual and accesible. The planitarioum shows has translation into English and are very good. We went their twice because our daughter was so interested and enjoyed the show which caused her to be curious about the second one.

A great place to visit. Took my two grandchildren aged 9years and 5 years to this museum in the summer. They loved it, lots of hands on exhibits to keep them entertained. The entrance fee is very reasonable and they spent hours pressing buttons, pulling levers and having a wonderful time. A great day out for all ages.

Exciting!. We weren't expecting much but we loved it....so interactive and I became a kid again trying to press al the buttons! The planetarium was excellent and so was the replica of a rain forest. A must see while in barcelona.

Great family outing. Fantastic place to go with children. There is something for all ages and plenty of space to run and explore. You can go at your own pace or sign up for one of the scheduled activities.

Amazing museum!. At €4 each, this museum is a marvel. We spent at least four hours there and still didn't manage to see everything. It's truly interactive and there are loads of fun experiments to do which would keep children (and adults like us!) well entertained. When we visited, there was a Microvida exhibition where you can use microscopes to see living microbes and take pictures which you can email to yourself. A must see is the rainforest which has birds, snakes, spiders and tropical fish.
fun meuseum. cheap and very fun !! takק the extra activities .... the planeterium was amazing .... not just for kids

Excellent!. We've spent above 5 hours there and didn't get bored, or even tired. And we could have spent more time, but we were due for other sites in Barcelona. A great place to visit as an adult, but an excelent place for children of all ages. Many scientific experiments that kids can try for themselves. And the Amazonian forest is just beautifull! There are so many things to do there. If you visit Barcelona with your kids, the CosmoCaixa is a must :)
science museum. Very interesting exhibitions, contemporary and permanent, great visual aids, very informed and educational approach of the laws of physics.

Not bad. We stopped off here to get out of the sun for a few hours, it was alright. Its a fair hike away from anything really, we had hopped off the bus tour so it wasnt too bad. If you insist on going here, get some form of transport! It was a strange place but was good for ?4 and probably would be good for families with children.

For Intrepid Young Explorers. A wonderful museum for young scientists. My son loved the interactive displays that let you view objects from the cellular level and beyond. The entry fee is very reasonable, the displays clean and well lit with exhaustive explanations in Spanish, French, English and Catalan.
Great museum. A great science museum, for children and adults alike. The best part is that it's extremely interactive.

So much fun!. I'd been here once before with a friend, and we both loved the experience. I was a bit hesitant to bring mom along, but I really wanted to visit CosmoCaixa again, so I decided that she would just have to deal with it. To my surprise, she loved it!The museum has a permanent exhibit consisting of various machines demonstrating physical laws, some aquariums, a tale of the evolution of humans, plus of course the huge indoor Amazon rainforest. In addition, there is a temporary exhibit - this time it was about life under the microscope. The rainforest is worth a visit, or if your feet are tired after walking around you can sit down and warch the giant fish tank (with equally giant fish). We didn't have time to visit the planetarium, but I'm definitely doing that the next time I'm at CosmoCaixa!Now, some practical information.People find the museum hard to find, and I agree that there could be a sign or two pointing the way. If you're arriving by tourist bus or metro to Av. Tibidabo, all you have to do is walk up the hill from the stop until you meet a freeway. Turn left, walk alongside the freeway until you see a brick building with a pool-like fountain outside. This is the museum. (Alternate method of ascending the hill is the Tramvia Blau towncar, but if you're up to walking, it's maybe a ten-minute walk. Also, walking is free!)The planetarium (and other attractions at the museum, I think) cost extra. They informed us about this when I visited with my friend in 2010, but not this time. So if you're planning on seeing it, you'll have to let them know when you're buying your ticket! The food in the cafeteria was mediocre at best, expensive, and cold. I'd try the restaurant instead.All in all, this museum should be on your itinerary if you're into science, rain forests, or if you've got nothing to do on a rainy day. It's cheap (?3 or so without entrance to the planetarium), and you most definitely get your money's worth!

Makes an interesting day out!. This was part of our Barcelona card and it was a good day! It was quite busy but it was a pretty amazing place with a lot of interactive displays.The weather was really sunny so we brought food from their cafe and sat in their tranquility area to enjoy the sun. Wasn't too impressed with the creepy bugs that I found in my fruit salad though! But didn't put me off my food!

Great for kids...and free. A great fre place for kids to visit, although adults are a nominal circa 4 euros. Lots of buttons to push, a rainforest to walk through, and a nice view of Barcelona from the terrace. Great value and a convenient underground car park underneath. A great alternative to the beach on a summers day.

Only good when you have kids I guess . There were some nice things in this museum but it was not worth the extra trip to get there. Not for all ages I guess. If your a young adult with no kids this place might bore you pretty quickly.

Really nice science museum!. This museum is really interesting and great! It has many different "stations" where you learn about different concepts in science. I wished I had came earlier and spent the whole day! (And only 4€!) def go if you are in Barcelona and love science!

Pleasant surprise. After cancelling the visit to Aquarium, we headed straight to Museum of science. It was a real pleasure for the whole family, with lots of experiments where we all could see how it really works. Both the kids and the parents were delighted, especially with optics and physics experiments. In the end, tropic forest was a real gem! Would come there again!
brilliant. the kids loved it and i did to. Its massive. Definitely worth seeing. The best museum i have ever seen!!!!!!

Not nearly advertised enough - Brilliant day out!. This is an interactive science museum just before the funicular takes you up to Tibadabo - easily accessible via the metro then the tram or 10 min walk up the hill - we spent 3 hours there and could have spent another 2 but ran out of time. There were things to do for all ages from about 3 upwards, we had 11 and 17 year old and they thought it was brilliant. At just 12 euros entry for all four of us it was a REAL bargain! Well worth a visit if you have curious children, and cheap too!

Great way to spend some quality family time. Use coupons for discount or free after 3pm. Lots of interactive activities and perfect for spending time out of the midday sun. Lovely little cafe with reasonable prices and so much to do that afternoon wasn't long enough. The exhibitions are all in English so no language barriers. We will definitely revisit on our next visit.

Excellent visit for only 4 euros. The visit is totally worth the money you pay to get in. Amazing aquarium and interesting biology exposition. The physics part could be improved. Also the modernist building is interesting.

Family Day. Brilliant, lots of interactive things for the kids, we missed out on the rainforest as we didn't buy a ticket on our way in and it was sold out by time we realised. So make sure you buy a ticket on the way in. We got a taxi for about £5 then walked back to the Metro. Well worth a visit :)

"Touch me" says every exhibited piece. Without doubts the most interesting museum I've been to. Plenty of interactive physics explanations,aquarium,etc. It's pretty large, so make sure you have at least 2-3 hours to enjoy it.Totally worth 4€ entry (there is no student discount from May 2013).

AMAZING science museum, well worth the trek for sure!. This is without a doubt the coolest science museum I have ever visited. The Amazon Flooded Forest and the hands-on exhibits were amazing. 3D IMAX has audio in many languages so caters to tourists and locals alike. We spent 4 hours inside the museum and could have spent many more. Definitely a "can't miss" destination in Barcelona, especially if you have kids.

Impossible to get bored. This museum has many physical phenomena put into practice using custom made devices and gadgets, just to prove the point. We, as adults, played and experimented almost like children. BTW, this is a great place to go with the entire family, especially with children.It also has an indoors simulated tropical environment/forrest; be careful not to miss the entrance, because they let in only visitors in groups, at a regular timely interval.The tickets were only 4 euros, money extremely well spent!

Hours of fun. It took us a while to find this museum, as its not very well marked, but when we did, it's a lovely building and there is so much to do inside. Make sure you go along to at least one of the Planeterium shows, they are fantastic. There are lots of things to watch and many hands-on exhibits, great for all the family, we all wanted to play! Not too expensive either, always a bonus!

Great for the whole family. Good value at 4 euros each (free for under 16s) plus 4 euros each if you want to experience a 3DPlanetarium show or a film about Charles Darwin. We went to the planetarium show and listened to the commentary in English on headphones. Well worth it. There are only a few shows a day, so be sure to check out the timings as soon as you arrive or on the internet.The museum itself is on several floors and is accessed by gently sloping ramps (as opposed to stairs) and there is also a walkway at the top of the building which winds its way down.There is so much to see and experience, and all the scientific activities/experiments had English explanations. There are also fish, plants, habitats, etc to see, and the best of these is the living rainforest, complete with birds and a capybara (like a giant guinea pig! ).
