The indoor pond contains carnivorous fish so make sure your hands don't go in the water! (The warning sign is very small). There is a café, and also a restaurant with a "buffet libre" (all you can eat) which is much better value overall for around 12-14 euros each than bits and pieces from the café which soon add up. Our meal was very good with plenty of selection and lovely desserts.Nice clean toilets on the ground floor before the help desk.Gift shop ok but quite pricey- lots of scientific books and loosely-based science souvenirs for children.Quite a few things to look at outside as well - refer to your plan.Very relaxing trip where children can run about and try "stuff" without being told not to touch! Allow several hours.It's easy to catch the bus forTipidabo from outside the museum - I think it's number 196 - and then the cable car.

'Hands on' type of museum, great for (big) kids!. We went here as two adults with no children and loved it. To our surprise it was much less busy than other touristic attractions such as the aquarium (don't bother!) and was so reasonably priced. There are tonnes of experiments to watch and interact with, an indoor rainforest with glass tank of huge fish underneath, a planetarium and a really great gift shop. The 3d showing in the planetarium was great too, this place is such value for money! On site there is also a cafe and picnic area. Kids and big kids will love it!

Innocent Fun for Everyone. We went to CosmoCaixa on the last Sunday of the month, hoping to score the free admission. When we arrived, the guards warned us that that deal had expired due to budget cuts. However, admission was still only 2 or 4 euro, so we decided to see what the buzz was about. And Cosmo did not disappoint! My sister had to drag us through to make it to other attractions. The museum is very interactive! Definitely for the young-at-heart. Make sure to see the indoor, simulated rainforest. Such an immersive experience at a great value.

scientific trip. this plan is a very good place for a school group , and sceintific people nice place to visit toka toka section , but no english translation , , alot of experiment , and nice cafe there

Best value in Barcelona. We stopped at CosmoCaixa on the Barcelona Bus Turistic (Tibidabo stop, then walk up a hill on your left) and were really impressed overall.The exterior is quite imposing and allows glimpses into the main museum areas including the must-see Flooded Forest, where every so often it actually 'rains'. Once inside you can queue to buy your tickets (Only EUR 4 per adult, under 16's free) and extras. I would highly recommend the planetarium shows as they are incredible and at the same time informative and educational. If you have children, CosmoCaixa is a must-see if you are in Barcelona.

Fun for all ages. I visited this museum several times now as it always has something new. Every experiment has explanations in English, Spanish and Catalan. The first 3D movie (Darvin) was amazing, the one about stars and planets is not as interesting, but still great. You need several hours to fully experience everything the museum has, however the price is very low and you can bring your own food, as there is a picknick area. It mostly attracts children, so there will be plenty of them running around and pushing every button. Also the area is beautiful.One more thing, if you are la caixa bank client or a child under 16, the entry to the museum for you is for free.

Away from the madding crowds!!!. Brilliant for all ages. If you plan carefully you can get here easy. Get the number 196 bus from the last stop line 7. You can stay on the bus until it comes back down as it stops right outside! Loved the views, the rain forest and the 3d cinema, worth the entrance fee! Brilliant restaurant too!

Nice view and a lot of fun. There are lot of attractions (experiments) to try. There is a huge artificial forest which is so nice to see. There are interesting fish under the tree. We spent 5 hours to walk around. I think that everyone can enjoy this place!

Off the beaten track, but well worth the trip. Fantastic science museum, with lots of hands-on displays and good English explanations. An enjoyable break for the children from the art and architecture elsewhere in Barcelona.

Guest services bad, museum great for kids.. We love to visit science museums with our kids and read the good reviews of this place before this visit to Barcelona.The museum is quite a bit out of the way and we had a little hard time finding it from the Tibidabo trainstation. I reccomend downloading a map of the route before leaving your wi-fi.We had read that the 3D show was a must. We purchased the Barcelona Card that included entrance for the museum.When we arrived 3 staff members were in the lobby. We placed our bags in the lockers and went to talk to them, showing our Barcelona Card and asking about the time when the 3D show would starf. We were obviously disturbing their private discussion (only guest in lobby at the time) and they told us to go to ticket sales further on. There wer handed in two tickets from the BCN card.This is a big place and you can wander in different directions. We found the place for the 3D show and showed up there first, we saw a sigh that seats were limited so we waited there for 20 min for it to start and us to get seats. Two attendants were there but did not adress us in any way.When the previous show ended and the theater was opened for us we found out that we should have purchased tickets for this show!Staff tried to send us away (it takes 5 min to get to lobby from there) but we refused. Afterwards we were escorted back to the service desk to pay for the 3D movie but received no apology for the lack of info and limited aknowledge of the point that you need to tell your customers when there is an extra fee! For example indicate this info on the sign outside the theatre.The kids loved this place, the 3D was fantastic (Darwin). In some areas info was only in Spanish, that is a down side. We had a really nice lunch buffet in the restaurant, there is also a cafeteria.They need to improve their info, both oral and written. This does not come close to Tom Tits in Sweden in my opinion and we enjoyed the Science museum in Halifax, NS more even as it is not as fancy as this one.More fun for children than adults here.If we had received better service from the girls in the guest services this would be a rating of 4, not 2.

Loved it - go here instead of the Aquarium!. This was by far our best day out with the kids in Barcelona. Forget the Aquarium- this place is far far superior, not to mention ,nicer & much cheaper too. AND the cafe and restaurants are good too. (We ate lunch at the restaurant which was a very good buffet-type of arrangement). Alternatively there are numerous shady places to eat a picnic too.We arrived about 1.30 and there was a massive queue to get the tickets (under 16's are free but will still need a ticket and after 3pm it's free to all) - the staff were pretty unhelpful at the ticket counter though and we had to ask about the additional activities going on such as the Planetarium 3D, otherwise they wouldn't have mentioned it. The museum tickets allow you entry in/out all day. If you decide to go for the Planetarium too (I'd highly recommend it, only 4 euro each and it was awesome) do check which show you'll be seeing - we didn't even know we had a choice.We saw the spectacular Natural Selection show about Charles Darwin; we all loved it. You can get headphones for translation (free) inside the planetarium. The 3D effects were tremendous, even to my kids who watch 3D films on a frighteningly regular basis. It was great - my 10 & 7 year old kids loved it.The living rainforest is spectacular; full of fish, birds and leave-cutter ants, as well as a Capybura and amazing foliage and trees. There are also snakes, spiders and other tropical beasties to be seen - a sure-fire winner with kids & adults alike.As well as this there were loads of other exhibitions & hands-on stuff. We were there for 4 hours but could have easily stayed longer and seen even more. I can't recommend this place enough. The shop is good with lots of pocket-money priced bits for kids to buy. One word of advice though - if you are driving, the signs for the car park are pretty well-hidden but there is a car park around the back of the museum. The first two hours are free but after that the charges mount up - we paid almost 12 euros for our stay even with the 2 hours free! But oh, SO well worth it.
Lots of fun. Excellent even with little kids, 5 and 3 y. Even the restaurant was great with very helpfull staff for the kids, food was good.

Do not miss it!. It is cheap, interesting, funny and brilliant! For all family: children can play and try and touch all in the exposition, while adults can discover thing they ignored about science and nature! There is also the restaurant and the bar and the aquarium! A really nice experience, I sincerely suggest it if you are in Barcelona.

Best kids museum ever. My oldest daughter read about this place and as we had a few hours spare and at a great price we decided to visit. What an amazing place for kids ( and adults). Our two (4 and 9) had plenty to excite them. From the spiral ramp that winds around the tree to the mass of exhibits that were all hands on the kids loved it. If you lived here you could come every week and learn something new. It was also in a really nice part of town with beautiful buildings surrounding it which is worth a walk/drive around.

Well presented science exhibits. This is a very interesting location and works on two levels - the "button pressing" for younger children but also for those who are older (older teens + ?) who are interested in science with many exhibits presented in an engaging way. Exhibits on optical illusions, material science, geology were informative (wording in ES, Cat and EN). The Rainforest exhibit with live animals was also good but smaller than expected (it's not the Eden Project). We didn't try the cinema/planetarium as all shows seemed to be narrated in ES/Catalan. Small cafe on top of the museum was nice for coffee and cake. Tip for getting there by public transport - take the bus196 almost all the full circle from the metro station (so up to the funicular and then back down to the second but last stop) - takes 10 minutes and you get a view from the top and avoid the 15 minute uphill walk. Very reasonable entry price at 4 euros per person ( under 16s free) and open until 8pm.

Impressive museum. Value for money!Great visit to CosmoCaixa! Exciting for both parents and kids (6 and 9). Drop the aquarium of Barcelona, this is WAY better. Plan your visit, there are not many other attractions or restaurants in the area.
Cool. Its a little bit difficult to find, but it's worth the trip especially if the weather is not so good. I wish I was a little younger though. I'm sure I'd enjoy it more :D

a cross between The Eden Project & Science Museum. My family visited Cosmo Caixa at the end of July. We did the obligatory trip the Camp Nou in the morning and then headed up to Cosmo Caixa (10 mins drive away and easy to find). It was the perfect anecdote to the football stadium. Firstly there was ample parking on site, unlike Camp Nou and secondly it was incredibly good value, unlike Camp Nou. Once inside there are lots of activities for your kids to do and view. My children are aged between 2-8yrs but I spotted other families with teenagers equally enjoying themselves. The restaurant was clean and the bathrooms equally so. I'd recommend the rain forest path and try to time your stroll for one of the frequent simulated rainwater downpours. The were interactive science activities in addition to the fish/turtles to view. I've never been to a place like this before. The best way I can think of describing it is a blend between the Eden Project in Cornwall and the Science Museum in London. You'd probably struggle to spend a whole day here but can certainly happily pass 4-5hrs. We took an early breakfast at our hotel, got to the Camp Nou early before it got too hot/crowded. 200 euros/3 hrs later headed up to Cosmo Caixa and then spent 50 euros/5 hrs. My four children loved the day. I would certainly recommend Cosmo Caixa.

Science at its best. Attended a four day conference here. Such an interesting location! Lots to see and learn about. Spent my lunches walking through the exhibits. Nothing seemed specific to Spain, but still very cool.

Brilliant!. If you're with kids who are interested in the sciences, take them to CosmoCaixa! My kids (14 and 11 year old) loved this museum. It has a number of hands-on exhibits and some excellent specimens which are well explained in English. I particularly liked the eclectic nature of the museum, which combines a wide range of disciplines on the same floor to create a very engaging experience for youngsters (as well as the adults accompanying them!). Would highly recommend.

Fantastic!. If you're with kids who are interested in the sciences, take them to CosmoCaixa! My kids (14 and 11 year old) loved this museum. It has a number of hands-on exhibits and some excellent specimens which are well explained in English. I particularly liked the eclectic nature of the museum, which combines a wide range of disciplines on the same floor to create a very engaging experience for youngsters (as well as the adults accompanying them!). Would highly recommend.

Wow. Excellent value for your money. So many things to see and all very interesting for all members of the family. Take in a 3D show as well as they're put together very well and worth the money. We spent 4 hours here and didn't see everything. It's in the middle of nowhere so make sure you know how to get there.

Excellent and great value for money. After the let-down that was the Poble Espanol the day before, we trundled up to the science museum and were really pleased we did. It is off the beaten track up where you get the Tibidabo tram but really worth a visit if you have kids (we have a 6 year old boy). Only had to pay for us adults and even that was only a few euros. Yes, it's not as big as London's but it's really well thought out, lots of space, lots of interactive things to do and an aquarium with rain forest thrown in, plus a great view. The cafe was good value too, so all in all it's a highly recommended activity!

Surprisingly one of the best attractions in Barcelona. The entrance fee for this attraction is 4 Euros and it is free if you're an Euro<26 card holder. It is not crowded at all and you could easily spend half a day here. It has a lot of hands-on experiences but the highlight of the exposition is the flooded forest.

Awesome place to go with kids. I just love this museum, it's science for kids and adults. It has a tropical rain Forrest where you can see a capybara, fish and other south American species. Great value for money. To get there you have to go by FGC to Tibidabo and take a 10 minute walk. Don't take the blue tram, it's expensive and it won't get you near the museum.

Educational and entertaining. I don’t normally comment on tourist attractions, but the CosmoCaixa is worth a visit whether you are travelling with children or not. Most tourist to Barcelona focus on the Gaudi venues, old town, beaches etc, but add CosmoCaixa to the must visit list. I had a chance to spend an hour or two looking at the exhibits during a recent conference as the venue. The miniature living rainforest is worth the entry alone. The other exhibits are well laid out and engaging. They brought out the kid in me. Explanations are in English, as well as Catalan and Spanish.
Interesting. Very interesting for a whole family visit. They have many activities always available and some temporary. The kids enjoy it because they feel free to touch everything and to explore it!

Great visit. Well worth a visit, especially if you have kids. We thought we'd seen it and done it, having been to the London science museum, but this is a very different experience. There is all the usual interactive fun for the kids but the timeline for the history of this planet is very well done, as is the rain forest!

Incredible Value ... Would pay more!. Been to a few science museums and this one was the best. Planetarium was amazing in 3D with headphones for English. My kids are 11 and 9 and really loved the interaction with the exhibits. Kids especially enjoyed the Amazonian area. I know they had a great time because we had to drag them away!

See Gaudi in a natural setting!. This was the highlight of our trip to Barcelona for my teen-age daughter! She was blown away by the creative genius of Gaudi - loved the Hansel and Gretelesque entrance buildings, the incredible mosaics tiling on the seats, the way all the tiling glinted in the sun. She was really struck by the simplicity of Gaudi's house, compared with the grandeur and fabulous ostentatiousness of the park itself. We loved it too!Terrific!

CosmaCaixa for kids. We went on a boiling day and this was a really brilliant day out - or maybe half day. The entrance fee was €4 each with €2 for "activities". The only extra we paid for was the 3D planetarium. This show was breathtaking and shouldn't be missed - truly stunning. The rest of the kid friendly stuff was on the lowest floor - including the awesome flooded rainforest. It's hard to convey how enormous this exhibit is. The rest of this floor is the most amazing exploratory with dozens and dozens of interactive exhibits - the sheer number meant there weren't really any waiting times to have a go. The lighting levels are quite low and this made some of the signs explaining the exhibits quite hard to read but that was hardly a big minus. The exploratory was also all in one huge room and it was brilliant to be able to let my daughter (age 8) explore at will while I watched the fish in the flooded rainforest. Compared to the prices for the Zoo and SeaQuarium, we thought the entry fee was a real steal. It also was free to enter after 3pm. It's not on a direct metro route but we did see the Blue Tram within a few hundred yards and we caught a taxi from Placa Catalunya and it was about €8
Great for kids and adults. This is an excellent few hours for very small money - kids are free adults 4 euro. lots of things to see and interactive science exhibits. Really enjoyed it

Fantastic.. Wish we had spent longer here. Both me and my partner are in our early 20s and we absolutely loved this place. So many interactive pieces and demonstrations and the indoor rainforest was fantastic. The best thing about our visit included a trip to the planetarium which was one of the best experiences, and everything was in Catalan, Spanish or English. It is quite a trek from the city centre (and up a hill) so I would recommend either the metro or the bus touristique (which I cringe at the thought of, but having been on it, my mind has changed completely). Well worth the visit. Perhaps spend the morning in Parc Guell and proceed on to CosmoCaixa!

Great for Families!. If you have little or even BIG kids at heart, CosmoCaixa can be a fun day. There is a bus from Plaza Catalunya that takes you directly there OR you can take the Turistic Bus (Blue Route) which will take you to Tibiado and the tram up to the park.

Absolutely Fantastic. Bit difficult to understand how the hell you get inside/purchase tickets if you walked from a metro station and did not drive into their carpark-this is a very minor fault though. Fantastic place, so much to see and do-all written in English, Spanish & Catalan so everyone can read and understand! A lot of interactive stuff for kids (or big kids like us :P) to get involved in and absolutely loved the indoor jungle/swamp with massive amazing fish :') +only 4euros to get in!

Totally amazing. Visited her whist in Barcelona with my partner and seven month old, although he was a bit young for it me and my partner thought it was great. Almost everything has an interactive element and it's all very well explained. They also have a large fish section and a rainforest section thats will blow your mind. Well Well worth a visit and it's only €4 each entry.
Super cool. Made me feel like a kid again. I think I enjoyed it more than my kids and I had to drag them out. Real cheap too...

Very interesting.... once you find your way in. We've been to many science museums aimed at kids and students (Singapore, Melbourne, Houston, Boston, etc). This one is worth the trip if you have kids. Had one of the best rainforest habitats I've seen outside of a zoo.

Take the kids!. We took the metro and walked up the hill to Comocaixa. Although there is lots of empty space and a bit confusing to figure out where the exhibits are, once we found them, we all enjoyed the hands on science displays. Very interesting and informative. The rainforest habitat is very cool, could sit and watch the fish for a long time! There is also a science theatre with different movies on space, environment, etc but it was only in Catelonian? So we had to skip it. Our kids 9&12 rated it quite highly.

Turned us into children again. The museum is very good with a wide range of interactive activities, all in English. The flooded forest is also excellent with a wide range of fish birds and animals. The museum was so exciting we felt like children again (particularly my boyfriend) and for only 4 euros it was great value for money!

Great with kids. If you're looking for something to do with the kids while in Barcelona, CosmoCaixa, or the Science Museum is a great choice. It's near the Tibidabo mountain and very easy to arrive by metro. There are dinosaurs, a planetary and a underwater jungle with real rain. Perfect for a rainy day - or not.

Science is Fun!. I really enjoyed my trip to the Science Museum, we got there just in time for the 3D Planetarium display which is an absolute must if your in the area. The Rain Forrest was very cool as well. The museum is also great because you don't need to be able to speak Spanish or Catalonian to enjoy it.

Kids loved it, not too much for adults though.. I went with my two kids and they thoroughly enjoyed this museum. They liked the fossils and rainforest exhibits the best, but were lost when I tried to explain some of the physics exhibits to them. We spent about 3 hours at the museum. We watched a 3D movie about Darwin and natural selection in the planetarium. I enjoyed this movie but would have liked it even more had there not been school children screaming every time a 3D creature appeared to come close..If its possible, try to go when school children aren't there. For 3/4 of the time we were there, there were also large groups of school children running around and screaming. They seemed unsupervised and swarmed all the most interesting exhibits. When they left the silence was almost deafening and the experience became far more enjoyable. Regardless, some level of chaos is to be expected in a location that primarily caters to children and we still had a good time.If you've only got a few days in Barcelona I would give this place a pass. But if you've got children and time its definitely worth checking out.
CosmoCaixa. The museum was huge and a great place to take children. Almost everything is built for children to interact with and have fun.

Well worth a visit on a rainy day.. Visit this excellent attraction on a very rainy day in Barcelona. We had been many times to the city but this was the first time that we experienced rain. The major problem we had was in locating the museum and getting to it, as it was raining we had to walk the last 15/20 minutes because the tram wasn't operating in the rain. The exhibition is housed in a vast modern building over 5 floors and is very hands on for the visitor. We had an hour queue to get tickets but again it was worth the wait - go early if you can to ensure that the extra shows are not sold out.

CosmoCaixa. Nice museum. But not a patch on the other science museums in New York and London. If you've done those, then expect just 20% of those. However, if you're a science buff and going to science museums is really your thing then go right ahead. Also, not too many exhibits for kids younger then 5-6 years old. A child of atleast 8 and upwards would benefit most out of this visit.
Great museum. Great interactive exhibitions, lots of things to see and there's also a mini-rainforest. One can easily spend a day there!
Funny museum. A good place to go at a rainy day. You can make a lot of experiments in the exhibition hall. Great indoor rainforest.

Lots to do and see. I attended a conference here for which the facilities were excellent. We had limited time to look round the facility, but the rainforest 'tank' was one of the best exibits I've ever seen. Lots on hands on science for kids of all ages too
Great place for kids. Went with my two kids. Great place. Good experiments and each experiment was well explained with the scientific theory behind it. ...... kids really enjoyed it. ....

When can we come back?. That is my kids question every time we go to the museum. We started going there when they were about 2 or 3, and there are things that are a bit difficult for them, so my guess is that we will continue going for some time. We have taken many friends there, and it is always a great choice.A piece of advice: go at ten when they open if you want to take part in one of the activites or workshops. They often have to hang the SOLD-OUT sign!

My kids never want to leave. My kids enjoy going to the museum so much that they consider it the best treat for their friends. They enjoy the museum itself, but also the temporary exhibitions and workshops. To them it is great fun. The bonus is that they also learn a lot.

Science for everyone!. Good mix of exibitions, many of them interactive. Visited during "international days" which gave free entrance. Planetarium was fun, but make sure to get seats way in the back to get it all. Only critisism is that some exibitions closed early (15.00)

Great value attraction especially for inclement weather. Its a little bit difficult to find, but it's worth the trip especially if the weather is not so good.We took out 2 year old son and he loved the interactive exhibits and looking at the fish and animals. The cafe didnt have a huge range but did have good baguettes and coffee and fruit salad, and its a pleasant area to sit and eat.Would highly recommend it if you're looking for something to do indoors!

A fun-filled afternoon. We visited Cosmocaixa on a public holiday, so of course it was crawling with kids and yet, it didn't feel crowded. There are so many displays that there's lots of room for everyone and at 3 Euro, the admission price can't be beat. The museum has lots of room for younger children to run around and the highlight has to be the large rainforest display. The Barcelona aquarium only has saltwater fish, so this was a great chance to see freshwater. Highly recommend going!

best thing to do with children. fantastic opportunity to play and enjoy science with children any age. Best was the opportunity to touch and discover, and the planetarium. Get tickets before hand in the web or by phone, the cue can get looooong lloooong
the best science museum so far. The entrance is very cheap and there are a lot of things to do. Free entrance on the first Sunday of each month

Best value for the money in Barcelona. At 4 EURO ticket (+30% discount if bought online) this is the best value for money / time spent in Barcelona (not including the free ones :D).You can easily spend 1/2 day here (or more if you go to the Planetarium shows or temporal exhibitions).Some great "games". The tropical habitat is awesome.

Best value for the money :). With a 4 EURO admission ticket (and a 30% discount if bought online) this will give you the best value for the money for Barcelona attractions.You can easily spent 1/2 day here (even more if you go to the Planetarium shows or specific exhibitions).Not as many "games" as in other Science Museums (like Vienna or Paris) but some very interesting ones. The tropical habitat inside is great.A huge space with a great design that can offer information and fun.

Excellent visit. Well worth a bit of a trek on the metro.Lots of things to see and do and nearly all of the interactive exhibits worked unlike so many museums these days.There really is something for everyone there whatever your age , plus a good cafe and excellent views.

An unexpectedly great way to spend a wet afternoon. Found this by chance when rain meant tibidabo was not a great idea . Instead found a great attraction that had the kids enthralled all afternoon, even then only saw a small part, well worth a visit especially on a dull / rainy day.

Surprisingly entertaining.... We visited this by chance as we happened to be in the area with a few hours to kill. Boy, were we surprised. We had a free entry ticket so didn't think much of just going in to check the place out - we ended up spending a good few hours wandering through the vast displays and interactions available!It was educational but entertaining at the same time - thoroughly enjoyable.The staff were friendly and helpful and all interactions had English instructions/descriptions.If you have children, I would definitely recommend - adults would love it too!

Surprisingly great!. This is an awesome way to spend a rainy day in Barcelona. The exhibits are outstanding, and almost all of them are currently working. Plenty to do, and not just for young kids. The physics demonstrations were well done, and the newer high-tech ones (have a robot arm draw a picture of you!) were fascinating. Also, it's cheap - only 3 Euros for adults, and kids under 6 are free.

great experience, must see. This place is amazing, we spent 4 hours inside, and if we had more time we could stay there even longer. Our 11 year old son was excited about everything inside. Great fun for adults and children! Entrance fee is 4EUR for adults.

The best museum in Barcelona. Miles better than the tired Picasso Museum. This is fun and interactive, although I admit I probably wouldnt have gone if I had only been in the city for two or three days. But for any longer and it is worth the minimal entrance fee.
Wonderful time spending for the whole family. Fantastically designed, beautifully made, inspiring and motivating for exploring the science and the world!

beeing like einstein. If you want a quick, but accurate update, of modern science achievements, go to cosmo caixa. But you will need two days to get a fair look at almost everything. Or perhaps three! Be prepared to find things you thought we knew everything about, and yet there are more to find out!

Interesting museum for the whole family. A very nice museum with a lot of activities and many interesting exhibitions. I didn't enjoy all of them the same, but most of them were really innovative and intriguing. I specially recommend it to families with small children, although it's not addressed only to them. The entrance fee is very low.

A good surprise. Its cheap and it worth it...its good for children but not only. There are a lot of phisics and scientific experiment to understand the most important phisics phenomens.You can also buy some extra events such as a Planetarium experience, TocaToca (kids have the possibility to touch animals like mice and snakes; my little bro liked it).In the end we spent something like 3-4 hours but you could stay even more.

Disappointing. This attraction is not expensive at 3 euros for adults and 2 for children but is really only of interest to younger children. Ours (14 and 11) were rather bored and we struggled to find enough to occupy an hour and a half. Admittedly we were rather spoiled by a visit a few years ago to the Ontario Science Museum in Canada which is awesome! To describe this as one of the best science museums in Europe as some guide books do, is laughable. If you're English, stick to the Sciece Museum in London (free!) and don't bother to venture up the hill to Av. Tibidabo.Also the queue to buy tickets here was disgraceful. We waited 45 minutes. Totally unnecessary when they could have installed machines. This was the only thing we didn't enjoy in Barcelona.

so much fun. I totally disagree with the reviews that say this museum is for kids.. it's totally fascinating and really well put together, the recreated Amazon section is incredible! Definitely something for everyone here, it's a little bit out of the centre but we visited after Park Guell which is relatively nearby, after a short walk out of the back entrance of Park Guell on to the main road again it only cost 4 eur to get to in a taxi. You can spend hours in it, really worth a visit

For children mostly. We went to the museum because it was for free with the BCN card. Except for some dinosaur and fish fossils - the rest is for kids. Demonstration of the laws of physics, some rocks and fishes... If I had paid 3 EUR for it - it would be a waste.If you go - there is a great self-service restaurant on the first floor : soup, salad, hot dishes, desert for a price of approximately 14 EUR per person.

Much better than Aquarium Barcelona. - costs only 3 euro (much less than Aquarium Barcelona for 18 euro)- you can touch buttons, turn levers and make other interactions with scientific stands- there are even several aquariums to which you can approach as close as you want (no ribbons or fences)- you can see a real forest with fish, turtles, birds and crocodile, and also it is possible to enter inside.It definitely costs its money.

More than a Science Museum. Wonderful science museum, but what I liked more was the natural forest with sea life and the outside area that included a park. If you can eat at the restaurant it is a very good buffet with superb service.

Great fun. The museum is very interactive. The time you can spend in it varies between 2 and 6 hours depending on your speed and interaction with the expositions. Beware that there is a real Amazon forest you can explore! We were there in May, 2012, and it was a truly great experience. There are different temporary exhibitions so I would love to go back in CosmoCaixa again.
Great museum for all ages. It's a great place to take your kids. Besides, it's got a great view of the city, spectacular building, nice restaurant with a wonderful terrace.
More than you ever expected. What a fabulous attraction, kept the kids illuminated for hours. A really lovely way to spend 3-4 hours + . Best for 10-16 year olds

Whether you are an adult or a kid don't miss this. This interactive museum is a wonderful exploration of time, science, history, geology and animals. There are many exhibits about things like gravity, waves, electricity, the evolution of the earth and man and all kinds of science. In addition, there is a tropical rain forest full of fish, birds, snakes, etc. This is a touch and feel museum so kids have a great time and so do adults. The museum is hard to find so ask the tourist information people for directions. You can take the metro and walk about 10 minutes or take a bus right there. There are family rates as well as rates for seniors and students. Albert Einstein will meet you at the information desk (really).

Amazing place!.. A visited couple of time with my kids and they never got tired of visiting. you will find there a lot of things to do but also get ready to learn to. It is a lot of Fun while there and Kids love it very much too!.

One of the best museums in the world. Cosmo Caixa has won the European Museum of the Year in 2006. And honestly there is a lot to see. The corner of rainforest and piranhas is very cool. And it is great fun to play with the laws of physics. Plus the enterance is very cheap (around 4 eur) comparing to many other museums and atractions of Barcelona.

Information overload!. An amazing building set in the most serene settings, which is also very easy to get to. A very informative attraction about the sciences of life. There were lots of young children (school trips) running around which I thought were a bit too young for such an attraction, to fully understand and appreciate the interactive exhibits. It just got annoying when you were trying to look at something, and they were screaming over who was to 'play' with it.Though great for children, it is also a great place for adults to re-fresh their memories on how amazing the world is and how it's progressed. Lots to read, see and do that it can get a bit 'brain overload' after a while. Definitely could easily spend a whole day here.A mere entry fee at €3 (ours was free with a BCN card) it is most definitely worth the money. Also, a lovely cafe at the entrance/exit of the building with decent lunch foods at very reasonable prices.

Ok for kids as very interactive but a dull day out for adults. Fantastic building and obviously a lot of money has been spent here but personally I found this museum quite dull, mostly interactive so ok for kids learning science at school but adults will find it somewhat tedious.( similar to Techniquest in Cardiff.) Half of the interactive elements didn't work and those that did where unimpressive representations of the principles and elements of basic physics. (maybe if I didn't work in the sciences I'd be more impressed - but I doubt it) We didn't stop for the planetarium show so cannot comment on that, we'd had enough by then.

Great morning at CosmoCaixa. It is great fun for both children and adults. We spend the morning visiting the -2 and -5 floors, whereby the planetarium is located at the -2 floor.The permanent exhibition teaches about biology, physics, anthropology, etc. It is very interactive and fun. Loved the experience and I wished I could get back to school and do my homework asignments in there)))

Get smart!. Want to feel yourself a scientist? CosmoCaixa is the right place to do that!There are a lot of different exhibits.All of of them amazing and very interesting whether you a child or an adult with your own kids. Everybody will have fun here.I think this also the best place to explain physics.Almost all exhibits are interactive. There you can see the principe of steam engine work, of coarse in intercative form. There is also very cute robot who can draw your portrait - this is amazing!For me most exciting were different exciting physics exhibits. This is like laboratory. And of coarse examining of brain waves and the strength of thought. This is so cool!!! We have spent here 5 hours i think :)Also you can eat here, not very expensive sandwiches.If you don`t want to take your staff with you, use cloakroom.Get smart!

Great for the kids!. Ok, so most everything is in Spanish, but even if you don't speak the language, it's ok, because CosmoCaixa is a science museum, and science is international. There's a ton of hands-on experiences, a lot of things to look at and play with. There's a mind game that had a lot of success with the kids- by the energy of your brain waves you have to push a ball on your opponent's side. There's also an amazon forest that you can walk through, an aquarium....a ton of things to discover. A great way to get out of the heat and to entertain the kids. Tickets are not at all expensive, but the museum is a bit out of the city center. Which is why there are hardly any tourists, mostly families and summer camp groups.

It's a science Museum, no more no less.. Went here one afternoon whilst in Barcelona. It was certainly very interesting and informative (multi-language descriptions were a big help), but it's not the most amazing thing to see in Barcelona and is not as good as London's Science Museum (which is free, unlike the Museu de la Ciencia). Would recommend it for families with young teenagers, the hands-on exhibits were very well-designed and interesting, and it was good value for money all things considered.

Stunning attraction with something to interest everyone young or old. We spent several hours at this museum over a rainy Sunday afternoon. And even 32-3 hours barely scratched the urface as the kids ran around and explored and " played" with all the exhibits, only did 1 -2 floors of this 4 floor museum. The kids said they would definitely go again next time.
Awesome Amazon Rainforest Display. I love this museum. The architecture of the building, as well as the displays are interesting and fun. A worth while trip for the whole family.
Very good!. If you buy a Barcelona Guide from the airport etc you can get in for free. It's a very interesting science museum, I had to go twice to get to see everything there!

Occasionally confusing but great. Very easy to find within 10 minutes of Penitents metro station, so long as you stay walking along the main road and don't follow the traffic signs as we did! Try and collect information at the desk immediately on the left after your entrance before buying tickets. The official plan of the museum is a little confusing but it is certainly better than going without one at all because the layout is unique! At €3 per adult, this museum represents magnificent value and even the restaurant/café is inexpensive. But the Planetarium is certainly worth the extra €4 - a 45 minute show that helps to bring the rest of the museum to life. The exhibits on -5 level are by far, the highlight. Worth making the trip.

Science in Spain. This is SUCH a cool place! I never would have found it if not for a (cheap) friend who got reduced price entry for having an account and the La Caixa bank. I am 33 years old and felt like a kid (so would definitely recommend this for any families visiting the city. There is a whole rainforest!! with HUGE fish that you can see through the huge terrarium walls, crocodiles, other weird live animals running about. There is a huge "Science museum" area full of top quality interactive stuff, an recycling area and loads more that I didn't have time for. I recommend packing food, bringing comfy shoes and lots of energy - this is easily a whole morning's work.

Brilliant family day out. Great day out for a young family on a limited budget.It was a hit with my 4 year old daughter and me (Dad) found it fascinating. Mum thought the fish were really quite something too.We managed to fill a full afternoon and promised to go back.Before you visit, check the times of the petting zoo access online if you are with young children, it saves the waiting.

The place for kids of all ages who like science (and those you'd like to like science). Take the bus or metro to Plaza Kennedy then get the local bus up to a former blind school now converted into a hands-on science education centre. if that sounds worthy and boring- it's not! A huge room stuffed with hands-on displays and experiments, a submerged slice of rain-forest, a lovely garden with views over the city. For only 3 euros you can easily spend a whole, day here

Where to go with the kids if it rains in Barcelona?. Fabulous place for parents and kids, as well as those inbetween! The museum is at the top of the city on the way to Tibidabo Fun Fair and you could take the "Blue Tram" up there. There are a variety of permanent and temporary exhibitions as well as a planetarium and exhibitions that provide interaction such as touch and play for small children. It also has a bookstore, gift shop, library, teaching center and cafeThe building was built between 1904-1909 by Josep Domènech i Estapà originally for use as an asylum for the blind and which closed in 1979. An amazing feature of CosmoCaixa is the large spiral walkway that takes visitors from the basement to the 5th floor. The centerpiece of the walkway is an Amazonian tree.Flooded Forest - experience first hand an Amazon forestGeological wall - showing erosion, volcanism, faults and sedimentation taken from around Catalunya and the Balearic IslesThe Hall of Matter - starting with The Big Bang Theory... Are you ready?Click and Flash - great for the kids, uses games to encourage children to learn about scienceTouch! Touch! - This exhibition houses living creatures from around the world and the Mediterranean. Museum staff and scientists present animals and plants from three environments.Bubble Planetarium - An astronomy based exhibition for children ages 3–8And all that for around 3€!!! Great day out, go for it!!!

Fascinating for all ages. This brilliant science museum was a really fascinating place to visit. With everything from dinosaurs to mineralogy, geology to genealogy, physics to psychology and everything in between, the drawcard for me was the fascinating temporary exhibit about recycling (and no, I'm not being sarcastic!), and the recreation of Amazonian rainforest was a lovely exploration-worthy exhibit (the fish, especially, are amazing!). Definitely worth visiting for any age (and very cheap, if not free!). Less a museum and more a place for exploration, definitely a modern approach to a centre for learning!

An excellent science museum. Calling it a museum is not exactly correct, it is a place where wonder, play and imagination are behind every corner! As an adult, I was amused and attracted like a kid. Definitely a great attraction in Barcelona!
Great Museum. Loved the interesting displays -- so much to see. Did not like that many parents let their kids run around with no supervision. Try to go on a day when kids are in school.

Some good things to see. This was quite far out of the city centre and we wanted to combine it with a trip on the cable car but unfortunately it was closed. There was supposed to be a dinosaur exhibition but it really wasn't that amazing but there were some nice little touches and fun stuff fo kids. If you have quite a few days in Barcelona then squeeze it in but don't miss out on something else for this.

Wonderful. Wonderful place for kids, even parents could brush-up their science fundamentals. It is worth it, very affordable (about Euro 3 per adult). Ran forest creation was great, also plenty of hands on activities for everyone to learn through fun. Nice cafeteria for lunch and easy access from Barcelona. Sign posts were not adequate while walking down from Tibidobo.
good. just good as we were not impressed. But it was a nice experience in Barcelona. We would recommend it for someone visiting the city

Very good value for money!. A very nice and interesting museum, to visit with children!
Going to the museum, you will also visit Tibidabo area, one of the most beautiful of the town!
A museum really thought for children, they can touch, play, etc.
And the price is ridiculously low

Great place to visit with kids from 4 to 99 years old. Great exploring experiance on the bottom floor.
It also has a giant tropical forest with tropical trees, fish and animals.

CosmoCaixa in Barcelona. During my stay in Spain I visited CosmoCaixa Musem which is one of the best places to visit in Barcelona.It is amazing and well worth checking out if you’ve a spare few hours on holiday. It has more hands-on exhibits than you can shake a stick at and comes complete with an indoor rainforest. Beat that, London Science Museum.

the best place in Barcelona. We want to spend there only 2 hours and then turn to the other museums, but once we get there we spend 8 hours and we want to stay there more. It is really great and interesting place, it's cheaper than L'Aquàrium de Barcelona and much better. Highly recommend it.

Great Science Museum. You'll have to take a cab to CosmoCaixa but it's worth it and not only if you have kids with you. It's a marvelous combination of old and new architecture with so much to do and see inside about science, life, health, history and even a rain forest where it actually rains. It's one of the 2 or 3 best science museums in Europe based on personal experience. And it's in Barcelona! So you can have a great dinner in the evening in the Gothic Quarter and check out great architecture and art as a bonus. What more do you want for a vacation?

Best value attraction in Barcelona.. If you are looking for good value, this is the place.Mainly geared towards children but interesting for all, you can't go wrong with a €3 entry price!The location is a little out of town but you won't be disappointed.

A great science museum for kids and adults. Good for English-speakers.. We went to this science museum with our kids (aged 10 and 12) and had a blast. There were plenty of hands-on exhibits with signs in Spanish and English. The movie in the planetarium and most of the audio was also available in English.Plan to spend the whole day here if you want to see the whole thing.Food is available in the cafeteria. It was not very good.

Fun museum. A fun museum that changes exhibitions. You can definitely find something for every age group, nerds or non-nerds. Entrance cost is not so much, I think it was less than 3 euros for a student so if you have a student card you should show it when you're buying your ticket so you'll receive discount.
For kids. Mainly geared towards children, although the "amazon forest" was interesting! Worth it if you are really into science.

A museum where you can touch everything!. This is a great place to take the kids. It's a fully interactive science museum. There are many exhibits that explain basic physics, chemistry, and biology, most of which are interactive. The kids (and adults alike!) can play with the exhibits and watch science happen. A great place to go. Very cheap for kids and students. The gift shop is also really neat. Tons of fun for all.

Coolest museum ever!. Allow 5-6 hours to enjoy everything it offers. Breathtaking experience both for adults and for children. Free entry every first Sunday or check out the discounts at http://bcnshop.barcelonaturisme.cat.

Fantastic day at Cosmo Caixa. Went with my husband and 2 sons (aged nearly 8 and 6) and this was one of our favourite days in Barcelona. We arrived at one o'clock and left at seven. Got the train from Plaza de Catalunya to Av. de Tibidabo (the end of the line) and then the bus from there (2 stops). It was very cheap to get in - 4 euros per adult and 3 per child and the 6 year old was free. Any activities cost extra - e.g. the film on Charles Darwin in the Planetarium cost us 14 euro extra. There is so much to see in Cosmo Caixa. We loved the rain forest and the tropical fish and reptiles. The interactive science exhibits were just wonderful. So many simple physics experiments to do. Also the section on the evolution of man. Plus the section on the development of the written word. There is a great temporary exhibition on at the moment on various diseases and how they spread. And a whole section on the development of computers and the technological revolution. I would definitely recommend a visit to Cosmo Caixa to anyone going to Barcelona. We loved it!!!

Fantastic option for a kids activity. It's a wonderful Museum for a fanatics of the science, nature and animals. It's a very recomendable activity for going with kids. You may enjoy a complete day or either a half day visit.Restaurant Menu is fantastic and it have a huge range of options.

Great way to kill a rainy day. We brought our daughter and spend more than 3 hours there. The 3D was a good experience but remember to get one of the rows in the back.There is a lot to do and almost anything worked. This is not normally for this kind of place. When we were there it wasn't overcrowded so it was easy to try out things.
A must for all ages. Get a cab, its worth the trip - but what a great place, great value for money. Children from 5+ will enjoy.

One of the best science museums I've visited. While it is a little out-of-the-way, it's not hard to get to with the L7 train to the last stop and a nice walk up a hillside. But when you get there, the sunken forest and exhibit halls are well worth it, particularly since admission is almost nominal. You can easily spend the whole day here.

Something for kids. A strange attraction with a pretty wild variety of stuff to see, read and touch. The two parents were really ready after more than an hour, but the kids (7 to 13) insisted to stay for more than 3 hours (there is a terrace to wait for them).

Great science museum with rainforest and planetarium in Barcelona. We had a special night time tour of CaixaForum and enjoyed it very much. The exhibits are organized in levels around a huge tree and includes a rain forest, aquarium at the lowest level, geological and biological exhibits as well as a planetarium. The building is beautiful as well. It's a great place for family with kids -- there are lots of interactive exhibits through which they can lean about science.

I enjoyed it!. I didn't have so much time to see everything i wanted but i definitely enjoyed my time being there! Is not very big but there are a lot to see in the screens! By the way i liked the idea of those screens that you can move even though sometimes the info that they were giving were really basic!

Cheap but lots of things didn't work. This could be amazing, but lots of the best looking exhibits didn't work which meant that there were crowds round the ones that did. A lit of the exhibits had very little explanation or context.

Amazing.. This place is a hidden attraction. There was so much to see just go to floor -2 since when you get there it doesnt seem much until you reach that floor. There is lots of displays with lots of information on. Definately visit the planetarium its amazing. I would'nt really suggest it to people who dont really find science interesting.

Wonderful half-day excursion for adults and kids. The museum is a short, steep walk, bus ride or old tram ride up from the Tibidabo terminus of the L7 metro, past rows of modernist mansions to a large plain building. However, once you are inside, it is beautifully laid out with quirky architecture and fantastic displays. The highlights for us were the flooded forest and a series of interactive exhibits on the power of the mind and perception. - with enough English signage and instructions to get by. The staff were very friendly and helpful when we did need help. Our two museum veterans (and sceptics) emerged contented after 2 and a half hours - exceptional value at 3 Euros for adults and 2 for children.
Fun for children of all ages. All the experiments are explained and touchable. An amazonian ants colony is presented. A little far from the town center.
A treat for my grandson. Cosmocaixa science museum is a brilliant attraction for kids of all ages. Loads of interactive exhibits and a super cafe.

Great interactive science museum. Slightly off the beaten track, and very quiet when we visited (and also very cheap -3 euros each). The best part is the rainforest display, with lots of fish swimming in the pool, but there were many other exhibits (signed in English, as well as Catalan and Spanish). We arrived late afternoon, but both wished we had gone earlier in the day, to spend longer there.

Amazing museum for kids and adults. It's cheap (just 3€) and full of things we didn't care about before.... We had a great stay with our kids. The main problem is that we had to take a cab to reach it and was not as close to the center of barcelona as we've liked to...
Great place!. Really recommend, but please note it is a bit far from the center so getting there and back is a bit harder

Wonderful experience!. Great science museum, and only 2 EUR entry fee! They have an indoor habitat which copies a real rainforest, complete with fish and animals. Plus, the main floor is full of fun gadgets & experiments that you can operate yourself. A very good place to take your kids to.

Great way to spend the morning. Went here before heading to Tibado funicular. The science museum was very impressive lots of interactive stuff to try and even myself and 15 year old daughter had a great time trying everything out. There is also a miniature rain forest within the building which you can walk through complete with trees, fish and other small animals. Well worth a visit.

Have kids? Visit it!. Worth a visit with kids! Great place! I guess my favorite museum of science is in Hong Kong but can’t name better place in Europe than this. It is not very huge and I guess you will need not more than two hours. You can even visit the museum without guide – everything has own description.

Very educational!. Loved the science museum.
Everything is explained in Spanish, Catalonian and English.
And only paying 2 euros or so to get in, I think it's totally worth it!

At first sight not too awesome but stick with it. The science museum got neater as we progressed through with many displays and videos. It was also very nice to have English descriptions which does not happen alot in other countries.

Absolutely brilliant!. CosmoCaixa is one of the best museums we've visited. Our five-year-old absolutely adored it! If, like us, you're into natural history - and especially if you're traveling with kids - this is probably the best 3 Euros you'll spend in Barcelona.
One of the best (small) science museum !. A nice and well organized science museum. There was at that time (august 2012) a very good temporary exhibition about technology with "mind games".

A fun day to spend with the kids. While it is not the largest science museum we have been to, its still fun for our youngest 2 to the oldest 10 years. I advise anyone to arrive early to book the activities as without them you will need only 2 hours to go around. Even though the activities like clik and toca toca are in catalan your kids will enjoy them.

An unexpected highlight of our trip to Barcelona. It wasn't my idea to visit a science museum on a visit to Spain... but I'm so pleased we went. As many other reviews have said, we went expecting to spend a couple of hours there, and spent twice as long. Great hands-on exhibits, beautifully presented in a stunning building (languages inc English), and the rainforest is simply amazing. Plus it costs v little to get in; the surprise hit of our five days in Barcelona.

Susiedoop. This is a brilliant natural history museum. It takes you on a journey of the history of the earth. It is very interactive and has multi-lingual labels on touch-screens. It also has really cool screens that glide over some exhibits and gives you more detailed information.

Its a great museum but tries a bit too hard. I love this building, i love the sense of adventure that you have getting here by tube, train and finally tram! The upside down layout is exciting as is the first view of the main 'hall of matter' Also the rainforest exhibit is as good as most zoo aquariums.The main part of the museum is called the 'hall of matter' thats a pretty broad term and its a good clue for how the exhibits are put together - there are themed areas but on one floor pretty much every scientific concept is covered; adaptive evolution, the physical laws, you name it.All of these concepts are interpreted using 'hands on' displays. great what could be wrong with that? my concern though was that with so many very young children flying around whacking every button they could find it was almost over stimulating and almost impossible to explain to them what they were actually seeing. for instance one exhibit was attempting to explain the laws of entropy by using a large glass cube with sand in the bottom, compressed air would shoot up and disturb the sand. Kids loved it for the effect but trying to make the link between this effect and the laws of thermodynamics would be beyond the reach of most parents!Another really fascinating display showed how different mouth, throat, tongue shapes and positions created different vowel sounds using reeds and cross section diagrams. kids just kept holding down the buttons because they made a loud noise making it hard to explain what was going on.Another small gripe to get out of the way is the fact that the planetarium and touch events are separate and you have to get tickets at the desk. This is not obvious when you come in and the people on the desk don't tell you. This is a really bad system and needs looking at.Despite all this though is a great space, a very cheap day out compared to the aquarium or the zoo and you can easily spend the whole day there.
The best cience museum. My chidren loved it. We spend the day there, learning things. It is really cheap. The best acuarium. It is really interactive.

Great fun for 5yr old and adults alike. Excellent... from the initial walk down the spiral path to floor -5, and then to all the exhibits on that floor - lots of buttons and experiments to do. Some impressive huge geological exhibits and an exciting jungle/acquarium/zoo area, to boot.
2 adults, 5yr old and 1yr old had a great time.

Excellent, but.... Read the other reviews for the pros. Mostly amazing. The physics exhibitions are wonderful. They should use the same to teach in college. Everything is visually stimulating and colourful and fun.But!Many interactive displays are either not-working, slow-responding, or you just have no idea what it is supposed to do. And we're both science majors.The venue is horribly organised. The main floor is huge and it's hard to know where you've been. They should've made it more linear. The other floors are hard to understand. You can wander away to places not knowing if you're supposed to be there at all.The most disappointing part for us was to discover that you can actually enter the rainforest only after leaving the museum. What a bummer.But hey, for 3â¬, it's all right.

Interesting, engaging and fun museum of science.. You can't compare this to science museums in New York or London, for example, but Museu de la Ciencia has interesting exhibitions and engages visitors with interactive learning experiences. It's not very centrally located and it's an effort to get there, but worth a visit as a tourist if you have a lot of time in Barcelona and especially if you have children.

Beautiful science museum. I would recommend this for visitors who speak Spanish because the shows are not in English. However, the exhibition is in English and is absolutely gorgeous! It's a huge complex, completely modern in design with a great selection of exhibitions from natural science to physics to geology. Most things are hands on so it's great for kids. The staff don't really help explain things in English, so again, Spanish is a must.  I took a small group of 12 year olds and they loved running around the participating with all the experiments and exhibitions. I loved sitting on the roof terrace, overlooking the city and having a cold drink. While it's an educational experience, it is also a delightful architectural attraction. I would love to get married here!

Fun science museum. I've visited it several times since I was a kid and I love it! I mean I guess I'd love any science museum but I must say that here you can touch things and kind of see the science. Okay if you are a scientist you may find it trivial but the last time I was there and I had already studied all those things I found it even more interesting because it was so easy to "put a face" to some of that theory I had learned. And by the way after the visit you can walk down the streets trough that pretty neighborhood.

Nice afternoon with children. This place is a bit out of the touristic route and difficult to reach (we went by car, but I guess there is a bus service), but it is worth a visit if you are travelling with kids. My children loved it all: Einstein and Darwin sitting at the counter, the gigantic tree from the Amazon around which you can walk from top to roots, the science hall with many games and experiments to make and learn about phisics rules, the tropical forest with many huge fish and other animals - where you can even experience a tropical rain! There is also a planetarium with a 45 mins. film and a "touch touch" game: enough to fill up a whole pleasant afternoon. Entry is cheap: 3€ adults, 2€ kids.

Have kids must GO!!!!!. First of all it is free for kids under 7 (maybe 8) second everything is in English. This may be the best science center in the world in my opinion for kids or ADULTS. Spent 3 hours there and only saw about 25% of the exhibits but played on everyone of them!!! I will be coming back here again next time maybe without the kids!!!

Was expecting a lot, was mind blown!. Unlike my other reviews, I was happy to finally go to a place where I honestly felt deserved 5 stars. I read the reviews prior to going, so I was expecting a lot...and did I get a lot. I paid 2 euros, it was 1 euro cheaper than expected, and I spent a solid 5 hours in the museum. My only complaint would be the screaming kids everywhere, but it can't be helped. If you go, make sure you take your time and read everything. You will learn so much, everything from evolution, nanotechnology, physics, the natural world, anthropology, astronomy, and so much more. It blows my mind how the entry was only two euros. If you like science even just a little bit and want to spend sometime out of the sun, the science museum is a must see for you!!

mesmerizing. amazing museum! extremely well done, well organized, based on the concept of interaction, and totally against the saying "please don't touch the exhibits". you get a completely hands-on experience, which makes it fascinating especially for children, but also for people of all ages (for example, I am 18 and I still loved it, so I went there during the both of my two visits of Barcelona). my advice would be to try to go during the week, because it's not so full of people, children especially, since they can be quite annoying. however, if you happen to be in barcelona at the beggining of the month, go there on sunday morning - they have a free entrance on the first sunday of each month. if not, don't worry, the entrance is a bargain at 3€ normal adult ticket and 2€ for students (children can go in for free anyways).

Huge technical museum. Bit away from main turistic routes of Barcelona, the best way to get there would be a bus which stops above the museum. Alternatively, take the blue tram up to Tibidabo, but you will have to communicate your wish to get out for the museum to driver, or go to the top and get back down (10 minutes walk, but under the hot sun this may be unpleasant). Museum however would certainly be more of interest to children aged 7-12, I guess. Huge building with lot of interactive exhibits, however for a number of them you will not be able to figure out immediately what on earth they are telling you. Entrance fee is, unlike other attractions in barcelona, more than affordable.

Cheap but far away. It's a bit of a trip out of town but is worth it especially if you have children. It's only around â¬3 for an adult ticket so is very affordable. The area of rainforest they have there is a marvel. You can be within inches of a piranha or anaconda should you so wish. Worth a couple of hours of anyone's time.

Good Sciences Museum. I have been to several Sciences Museum in the world, and I would be apply to have that one in my city !!!It has a good size, and kids won't be bored. There's many interactive activities, and most of them are presented in Spanish, Catalan and English. They have an underground parking and they are offering 2 hours free parking with the ticket.But you'll spent far more time !!! :-)

Cool place for kids. This museum is not well known by tourists. I recommend it for family with children. You can stay for a whole day and find things to do. Experimenting the phisics laws or visiting the amazon forest with tropical rains and acquarium with enormous fishes. The Museum of Science has very affordable prices.

A Must Visit (especially with children). Simply the best science museum I have visited - and I've been to a few.Extremelly reasonable entry prices.All the button pressing / knob turning excitement that I remember from the London Science Museum many decades ago (but much more up market) - before science museums all got dumbed down. Nothing dumbed down about this museum. Genuinely good science, well explained, engaging, great staff, excellent cafe / restaurant.If you are visiting Barcelona with children this should be at or close to the top of your list of things to do. Don't miss it.

Best science centre I've been to. This is a fantastic science centre. I've been to science centers and science museums in Canada, the US, and the UK and this is the best one I've been to. While it doesn't have an area for pre-school aged kids, the exhibits are interactive enough that even young kids will be happy to push, pull, and whack things even if they don't understand the science. Many of the explanations are clear, yet advanced. I would say that kids who like science and are between the ages of 10 and 15 will get the most out of this centre, but younger kids and adults will find enough stuff to keep them interested. The main theme of the place is evolution. Meaning evolution of the planet as well as the species on the planet.The planetarium show was great and the rainforest is definitely a must see. It's probably about 5,000 square feet and 5 stories tall with walk ways under and through the forest and the water filled area. The fish in the water filled area are fascinating. Huge predatory fish from the amazon swim slowly past, surrounded by other fish and the shore of the rainforest. And it actually rains periodically.The design of the building is amazing. It goes down a hill, so you start at the top and move down towards the activities, shows, and exhibits. There's a massive 5 story spiral walkway that gives amazing views of the place (as well as escalators and elevators, if you wish).The entry was eur3.00 for people aged 8 and older. There are other activities that cost extra, like the planetarium. Each activity is eur2.00.We spent about 4 hours there, but could have spent many more.
interesting. I love science but more my husband. It is a great exposition of scientific discoveries and you may know a lot of new things. There are a lot of things to see and observe

A hugely under-rated landmark.. This place is a must - even if you're not a science fanatic. It's a place for everyone - kids, young, the elders..... Entrance fee is peanuts (EUR 3) compared to what you pay to visit similar venues. Much to see, learn, touch and experiment how things in everyday life operate and behave. Everything explained in easy layman terms.The 3D planetarium astronomy show was fantastic (there's also another show as well). There's english translation on everything and shows have multilingual translations. The rainforest was another terrific experience. We had planned to stay 2 hours, but you will easily need half a day.

A must. It's difficult to reach, but it's worth it! There's a real Amazon Forest, you can walk in there and feel like Indiana Jones. There are some exibitions and a scientific area (really funny).Don't miss the Planetarium!

Must see and touch and enjoy :-). Amazing collection of experiments in physics and chemistry and biology and all those applied branches :-) How things work and why are they what they are... Great fun both for kids and the adults...

Outstanding experience. We took our 3 children to CosmoCaixa and had a great journey through history at this amazing museum. Perfect for kids, with genuine dino skeltons, informative films, lots of fun and exciting experience for us all.

Hidden Gem. If you visit Barcelona you MUST go to the Science Museum.What an absolutely breathtaking collection of artifacts; for the absurdly low price of 3 euro.You could easily spread your visit over two days as there is just too much to see.Will be giving this a second visit on my return to Barcelona. Words cannot describe how great it really is.

the same as science museum, a different name. ... but absolutely lovely! I also reviewed the Science Museum so will not write again but it is highly recommended, especially for kids ages 5 plus. My kids (5 and 10) keep talking about their visit and especially loved the rain forest which they had both done in different versions at school. The experience was eye opening for them and any place that is so cheap (less than 10 euros for the 4 of us)and convinces a little girl to become a scientist is a MUST visit in my book!

i am so glad we went to this!. I "accidentally" read about the science museum in a guide for families in Barcelona and I am so glad we decided to visit! It is underrated I think, not very much advertised, but it is a wonderful place to spend a morning or afternoon with kids. My kids are 5 and 10 and I think they grew so much by just visiting this place for a few hours. They were amazed by all the interactive features, were fascinated by how a pully works, saw robots, walked into a rain forest, experienced what brain waves "look like" and learned about bacteria... My daughter is convinced she wants to become a scientist! And all this for under ten euros for the whole family. This must be the best kept secret in Barcelona for families. Especially if you have a rainy day on your visit (and even if you dont and your kids are into fun, scientific discoveries)-- do not miss!

The Ideal Science Museum for Kids. It was hard to take the kids (10 and 8 years old) out of the Museum. We spent here three times more than I expected. The visit at Cosmo Caixa ruined my plans of the day but made the children happy. Two huge arapaimas (about 1.5 - 2 metres long) swimming slowly between the roots of the flooded trees, together with piranhas, turtles and snakes is something that the kids will not easy forget. There are hundreds of things to see, to do and experience here: tropical birds wandering free between the visitors of the flooded forest, skeletons of dinosaurs, wax replicas of Neanderthal Humans and other humans ancestors, real mummies and so many others, exposed in a very attractive way. There is a small restaurant near the entrance and a picnic aria.
Not exited about this museum. If you have children they will enjoy it. For me it was a little boring. But if you like physical phenomena and why they do occur should visit the museum

Excellent for Kids, Fascinating for Adults. My wife and I took our three kids to the museum for a break from the sun and hustle of the city. It turned out to be one of our favorite afternoons in Barcelona. Lots of interactive devices, interesting displays, and an Imax theater. The whole thing was impressive. It's not all that easy to get to (a bus or a taxi), but it's worth the trip.

A must if you have young kids. specially in a rainy day. My two grand-sons aged 5 & 6 years old didn't want to go but once on site they didn't want to leave. So much things to look at, to try and experiment for the kids but for adults too.

Tired of the summer heat- cool off here!. Great to visit all year! Just step from Av. Tibidabo, be sure not miss this museum with small kids and big kids alike. This is some serious fun for the whole family. There is a real rainforest filled with adventure and mystery, and it even rains- but you won't get wet. CosmoCaixa offers a fascinating ground floor filled with exhibitions from biology, physics to viruses and pandemics. For 3 euros a ticket- you can't go wrong. If you pay with a La Caixa card- you get an automatic 50% discount.

Good for young and old enquiring minds.. We came here as part of the Barcelona card series of free entry museums. The museum is wonderfully interactive with enough exhibits for everyone to have a go. The labels at each exhibit are also translated into English.

Experience of childhood when adult. One of the most interesting museum ever seen. It could be tedious for serious people, but if you have open mind it is place where not to listen, or read or see, it is place where you can touch, play and really feel.At the beginning (especially if you go there with expectation that it will be serious museum) you could have "cultural shock" but as time goes you find this place more and more interesting.Just you have keep in mind that museum will take lot of time and as I saw - problem is transportation - place is far from center and metro, so you have to take taxi or wait for a bus and then take long time in bus.But - you will enjoy if have a risk and "plunge" in childhood.

I'm no scientist....but wow.. It's won many awards for its unique design elements but it's interactivity will keep even the least sciencey among us (and I include myself in that) entertained for hours. The indoor rainforest alone is reason enough for a visit.

Great place for learning. Spent several hours exploring the natural sciences in this building.
Observatory was unfortunately closed when we visited.
Great fun for all ages!
Best science museum I've seen.. A very interesting science museum, lots of cool things to see, games to play.

Same museum as Cosmo Caixa. Great. This seems to have 2 names, either way it is a great place. We went there on the basis of reviews and we weren't disappointed. I learnt heaps and found the displays fascinating. I can highly recommend this to families...

Wow!. This is the coolest science museum I've ever visited, AND it's situated up on Mount Tibidabo, which means you are also treated to incredible views over the entirety of Barcelona. If you're planning on visiting the museum though, allow yourself plenty of time - I was there for at least four hours, and could have stayed longer. The museum is highly interactive, and includes a planetarium and a replica Amazonian rainforest complete with rainforest animals and fish. The museum pretty much puts on show the history of the world, from its formation up until now - but it also includes lots of cool interactive science experiments, and photo opportunities galore.

For adults AND kids. I've been to science museums in cities around the world and this one definitely rates. The economy has made the upkeep a challenge, but it's still chock full of interesting and fun exhibitions/exhibits/activities. And a long strol

Great - but go at weekends?. Took our young kids - 3 and 5 - Loved the amazon rainforest and the techno hands on exhibition. Kids had a great time with lots of interactive stuff.. Some areas - notably Click which is for preschool, primary age children closed when we visited on a Tuesday, and wished we had gone on a Sunday (free after 3, but cheap at other times), or Saturday - when they have Toca - a show for kids on as well. I think we were worried it would be rammed like the Science Museum in London, but actually virtually empty...Definitely worth a visit - kids or no kids!
Very interactive and interesting museum. Great museum, especially for kids as many things allow to try things yourself.

Fantastic interactive museum. I took our family here after reading reviews. It was great. I learnt heaps and the kids aged 9-17 all enjoyed it. I can highly recommend it. We took the tourist hop on hop off bus and walked the last 300 or so meters to get there. Wouldn't have known about it if weren't for reviews, so happy to add more!
Educational and fun.. A long way out of town, and wrongly depicted on many tourist maps, but worth the search.

Amazing value, great day out. Similar to the science museum in London, this was amazing value at €3 each,or €2 with the voucher we got on the bus tour. It is up on Mount Tibidabo, with lovely views over the city. It features many hands on exhibits, a planetarium and a flooded rainforest that you can walk through, with lots of birds, fish and capybara! A really good trip. It's worth mentioning, the website and the details we were given on the bus tour both said that it wasn't open on Mondays, but it was for us, so I don't know if it was a one off or a misprint.
