Perfect educational way. It is a high-quality entertaining museum. All the physics laws are in action. I played alot to know the results of each action. It was full of students having fun in playing. It also has a small area that has trees and some birds that you can pass through along with other areas.

fabulous museum for very little Euros. We loved this museum ( my children ar 6 and 9) however it is quite far north in the city and not close to the nearest metro stop- we stayed by the beach and it took us 2 hours to travel to it and get our tickets, the ticket line was really slow on a Sunday and it took 30 minutes just for entry. Once in, the exhibits are very good, as is the cafe if you are there at lunchtime!

Children only. Disappointed as we were three adults and had visions of the British Science Museum standard. Children under 14 though would probably get most benefit.clean, airy and good views from the terrace.

Lovely place but not much for small kids. The museum itself is located within Cosmo Caixa, a fact which wasnt well advertised and the taxi drivers did not know. Hence we had quite a bit of difficulty getting there.Once there we enjoyed many of the exhibits and experiments. However, many of the activities were closed.Nice place to go if you have time, but you wont miss too much if you skip it.
Good experience. Very comprehensive museum, great to visit with kids.

One of the best things in Barcelona!. One of the most wonderful museums in Barcelona!Adult ticket costs 3€, but we paid 1,7€, because we are students. The price is incredibly low, and you get to see tons of interesting things. But be prepared to take around 4 hours to see the whole thing (or more, if you take time to really study everything you see), because the museum is really very big. Even in the 4 hours, you'll feel you rushed through everything.We loved the rain forest, especially the giant fish, and the area with a bunch of interactive science experiments. We felt like kids again, running around trying to touch everything and see everything.The museum is truly amazing, and definitely worth a visit!

Amazing indoor Amazon in Barcelona. The Science Museum is good in itself, with some good interactive displays but the best thing about this place is the Amazon Rainforest display which has a huge area set up just like a mini Amazon, including huge trees which run down into the water. You can view the underwater level behind glass like a mini aquarium, complete with giant Amazon fish, piranhas, stingrays, turtles & even an aligator! You can also walk around inside the area with the trees that is full of birds flying around, a copybara and a tarantula (in a tank). This display was amazing, worth the 3euro entry fee alone and better than the Barcelona Aquarium, great for kids and adults.

One of the best things in Barcelona!. One of the most wonderful museums in Barcelona!Adult ticket costs 3€, but we paid 1,7€, because we are students. The price is incredibly low, and you get to see tons of interesting things. But be prepared to take around 4 hours to see the whole thing (or more, if you take time to really study everything you see), because the museum is really very big. Even in the 4 hours, you'll feel you rushed through everything. We loved the rain forest, especially the giant fish, and the area with a bunch of interactive science experiments. We felt like kids again, running around trying to touch everything and see everything.The museum is truly amazing, and definitely worth a visit!
visit the new planetarium. it's impressive and my daughters enjoyed them. She also want to "toca - toca" and she caress snakes, frogs...

Amazing!! . A must for anybody with a bit more than a passing interest in exact sciences and biology - this will be a great day out.
Interactive demonstrations of common scientific theories and also a simulated rainforest.
Absolutely beautiful.
Children will also enjoy it.

Family visits a must. Accessible by bus no. 22 from bus stops just north of the Placa Catalunya, the CosmoCaixa is otherwise one hell of a walk away from the city centre as I know, I walked back from there to Poblenou in just over an hour and a half ! But it's very well worth the visit to learn more about our planet, to experience great hands on exhibits and an amazing experience for the hands on brigade, the teenagers and students, where you can get involved in science. Exhibits work well, are varied and interesting. The rain forest is staggering, viewed from above, below there is a real well planned sophistication about the way all the fish, reptiles, birds & animals are displayed, amongst the well simulated rain forest. It's a shame the Planetarium is only open at weekends but I've recently seen the one in New York. The cafe is pleasant, staff are not over friendly but are helpful enough and the price is really inexpensive, so no complaints. A must see place for visitors with children or youngsters for certain, plenty to see and to do, I really enjoyed the afternoon there.
Perfect. Well worth a visit. Very interactive. I have studied science but still learnt plenty here. Kids and adults alike will love this. Give yourself plenty of time to get round.

Educational Family Museum. Very interesting for kids and adults, however during weekends there are too many families with kids there and it's'a panic! Dont go there at the end of the day because you need to be well rested to go through the entire place.

Amazing value for money. Went to this museum with our three teenage sons. It was the only time of the holiday that they were not bored. We all enjoyed it as there was so many exhibits to try out. The aquarium and rain forest also proved to be a hit. A family of 5 cost €12..where do you get that sort of value these days?

Best Science Museum I know. Cosmocaixa is "just" a Science Museum sponsored by a local (but huge) bank. Nevertheless, you find advertisements nowhere except in the name of the place, and entrance fees are very low. On the other hand, the parking garage is very convenient but expensive. Another problem is how crowded the place (around the box offices) can get every month's first Sunday (it is free) or every rainy Sunday (not very common in Barcelona). The building is a curious and harmonious mixture of antique and new structures, placed uptown and surrounded by pines. The museum engulfs a very decent restaurant, cafeteria, snack machines and ample gardens, making it an ideal place to spend a whole day, especially with children.But just in a day you will not have time to see every regular exhibit, the temporary displays you coincide with and the separate activities. For the latter you have to register and pay additional (low) fares, but better try to do it either very early (at 10 am) or try to book the late ones.Within the regular exhibit you will find a reconstruction of a section of an Amazonic forest, with many of its exotic animals and even with its regular evening storms. It is spectacular, very instructive and gives you a very close feeling of walking in the warm and humid tropical jungles. Additionally, you will find hands-on displays from the very simple (springs, gears, chains, waves) to the very complex (for instance a mist chamber to see the traces of subatomic particles).And do not forget to vist its very good library.

Much more than a show. Cosmocaixa is a wonderful place to spend a day having fun while learning about science or technology. I go twice or three times a year because my children, my wife and I love this science museum.One of the strengths of this museum is that it offers not only objects or images of really cool stuff, but a definite view about how our universe, our planet, life, and us are. In my opinion, the main idea behind Cosmocaixa's exhibitions is the multifarious richness of the forms that matter can take. It could easiliy be thought of as the adventure of matter (and energy): inanimate, living, and intelligent matter. The stable part of the exhibition includes a wall that shows different geological strata. A particularly enticing part of the exhibition is a super cool reconstruction of a piece of the Amazonian forest with some typical Amazonian beasts (e.g., capibaras and caimans), birds (e.g., jacanas and sun birds), snakes (e.g., anacondas) and, yes, fish (including piranhas and one of the largest fresh water fish in the world, the arapaima). Besides, there is a space devoted to human evolution (intelligent matter), with reconstructions of Austrolopithecus afarensis, among others. Moreover, there are interactive portions of the exhibition that kids will love, like those showing the Coriolis and the giroscope effects. There are workshops for children too, but you usually have to register beforehand in order to find a place. In sum, an excelent place to visit while in Barcelona.

Outstanding Science museum. I'd say this museum is a must to every visitor to Barcelona with one spare day. I'd like to mention the recreation of an Amazonic jungle. Also, every first Sunday of every month, the entrance is free.100% recommended!

Have kids? Don't miss this!. If you are looking to entertain your children (and yourself) this is a great place to keep them busy for hours. This is a hands on friendly place for kids of about every age. The science is advanced enough for older kids and adults whereas the fun of just playing with the experiments and displays will keep the younger ones busy. On good weather days you can eat outdoors from the attached cafe or run the kids around the vast open areas. The gift shop has a good selection of interesting items. If you are driving I'd suggest using the parking garage since it's near impossible to find available street parking. There were problems with the payment machine that day so it's a good idea to have exact change, but the personnel were very helpful and friendly.
Good museum -not friendly staff!. Planetarium and terrarium have separate tickets and you need own them before you spend hour in queue.Staff don't talk english.
Excellent museum. If you have kids, great place to take them. Spacious, lots to see and to touch and do and is cheap.
Great for families with kids. Very nice museum for children. Lots of nice activities and things to touch and expirience
Amazonian forest is well worth a visit!. Great place to visit for kids and adults alike. Indoor rainforest is truly remarkable! Cheapest entry fee for any museum I've ever been too ( 5 euros)
do not miss. This was one of the best in the city. You will not want to miss this one for sure.

CosmoCaixa. Take the metro and then walk up the hill at Avenida Tibidabo. I'ts a little bit of a trek but worth it if only to see the 1000 sq m of amazonian rainforest that they have in the tank there. You can walk all the way around it in some places viewing the life on the river bed (they have two of the largest and ugliest fish I've ever seen swimming around) and in others the areas above the surface. The building is large with most of the exhibits being on the lower level but it will take you a good 4 hours to see it all. One good thing all the exhibit descriptions are also given in English (Learn a lesson you French)

beautiful museum. Excellent place to with kids. Beautifully designed with the right mix of play and seriousness. Good for children from 3 years up to 99. If you can, buy your tickets in advance from La Caixa via web or their cash machines. This will save you lots of waiting time during busy days.

Hours of entertainment!. My husband and I love visiting here when go to Barcelona as it has much to offer in way of entertainment, education and unique displays. I think, double check, it is free entry on public holidays!
athmosphere. wander in these narrow streets to feel the real atmosphere of the old town !!!
Worth visiting. Very interesting place - especially for children. The Amazon forest is a must

Super value for money. The line to get in was ridiculous, as was the journey to get there by public transport, but once inside (for the low fee of 2 Euros) my 3.5 yr old loved it. There are so many buttons to push and places to run around. Definitely worth it in the end.
Amazing science museum. Despite being owned by a bank, this science museum is sincere and very well done. The rainforest is particularly good, better then the aquarium in Barcelona.

Children would love it. Adults would say 'ok, cute'. Yes, the artificial rainforest is impressive but I expected a thrill and didn't find any. The 3D 360 degrees movie was interesting and overall there are indeed cute hands on displays at the exhibition, but I would categorize this attraction as mostly for childern or all family.To save you waiting in line you are advised to purchase you ticket online (possible up to 1 day prior to arrival).

Fantastic attraction (with great restaurant). One of the best attractions we have been to. A wonderful building, with a basement packed full of interactive and educational exhibits to keep children and adults amused for hours, not to mention a truly impressive recreation of a slice of rainforest. Interpretation panels are in English, Catalan and Spanish. An unexpected bonus was the restaurant, tucked away behind the cafe, where we had an excellent and good value all-you-can eat buffet, and where they also do a generous three-course meal for kids.

Best science museam ever!. I haven't been to many science museums, but this one really is incredible. Interesting for adults and kids alike, there is also plenty of interactive hands on exhibits that makes things fun. A bit out of town, but definitely recommend the treck, as the views of the city from up there are nice as well. Cheap too!

Fantastic option for the kids. This is one of the most facinating science museums we have visited as a family, there is a plethora of hands-on fun, and the indoor amazon rainforest is very special. Recommend at least three hours to take it all in.
Best value for money attraction for young kids in Barcelona. Brilliant last day for the family trip. 6 euros for 5 hours of entertainment. Best science museum we have been to

A Normal Science Museum. We expected to be wowed by CosmaCaixa and were a bit disappointed. We spent around an hour walking around and got bored and left. Perhaps if you go to see a specific exhibit then you'll have a better time, but we just wandered in, saw the permanent exhibit and left.
one of the best science museums in the world. great expo, great talks here too, lovely stuff to see, like the pendulum

AN UNFORGETTABLE EXPERIENCE!. I visited CosmoCaixa with my husband and my ten years old daughter. We liked so much it, specially, THE PART OF A REAL RAIN FOREST that you´ll can explore!!! The children (and the adults) love it!!! The Cosmocaixa building is fantastic too! You´ll love the experience!
Ideal to go with the family. Is it too cold or too hot to walk around? Then, this is a good place to visit. You can touch nearly everything and its Amazonic forest reproduction is a must.

Awesome. Went there without kids and thought will spend there a couple of hours. How wrong! Half a day was gone and we still havent even seen a planetarium! Great place to see, where you can touch and experiment, observe and play. Defo going there with kids, and reserving plenty of time for this one!

Nice way to spend your Sunday.. It is a very nice building with a lot of exhibitions. When I was there, they did not have anything which interested me in particular but overall, if anything comes up, I'd go there again.

Excellent place for kids to learn & experience. This is one of the best places which my kids loved in Barcelona. And it is also one of the cheapest entrance ( Adult Euro 3, Kids Euro 2).
Great learning and captivating destination for children & adults too.
take advantage. use this before visiting attractions for tickets - it really cuts down on wait time.

A place full of knowledge. CosmoCaixa it's a great place to visit with your children. It's full of history, physics, biology and chemistry.
The entrance it's 3 Euro but if you want to visit the Planetarium you need to buy a special ticket.

fun for all. went there with my family(inc 5yrs old).
lots of fun, we stayed there for 6hrs or so.
3D planetarium was so popular we didnt have choice but to see story of darwin - we prefer something about cosmo. but still very good.
keep the kids happy. took my son here because he was fed up sightseeing. excellent amazon rainforest exhibition, he loved it
Science Museum. I found the rainforest very cool and the exhibits were also really interactive. Great for both kids and adults.
Average science museum. Rainforest was interesting, other parts of the museum weren't particularly appealing.

So cheap and so fascinating. A huge Amazonas rain forest,
Dinosaurs, physics, illusions.. Great place to research, even as adults. And so cheap!!

Great rainforest and temporary dinosaur exhibits!. The gigantic rainforest exhibit is very cool, with all sorts of fish and plant life, with underwater and underground views. The Gobi dinosaur exhibit was also very interesting. Beware it is temporary. Our three generations all enjoyed the other permanent exhibits that explore and explain physics, meteorology, a lot of the sciences. The cafe could use an expansion of food options, since there is so much to see you will likely be at the cafe for lunch. Pack a picnic, perhaps. The gift shop is super fun, so try to at least walk through before you leave. You will be intrigued.

Freebie. My partner wanted to visit this museum as it had a rain forest inside. I was dubious as similar museums in the past were disappointing. I was convinced to go as we had free entry using our Barcelona Card. Entrance was only €5 anyway which I would have willingly paid this was an outstanding experience. A must see in my view!
A great place to go. A great place to go if you're a kid or an adult. The rain forest was a great place with all it's animals and plants and the humidity. Nice surroundings as well.

Outstanding. Many modern Science museums go overboard with use of multimedia and IT. CosmosCaixa presents Science to a world class standard without this excess. In particular the Rainforest exhibit is amazing. I watched the Capybara (giant rodent) for 10 minutes but could not decide if it was a life specimen like the other smaller animals or animatronics.
Very interesten museum. The explanations and the diversity of the subjects. The rainforest was amazing, but also the stones on the wall. A first class museum

woow!. the kids might love this but any normal adult will have a great time. The "submerged woods" are among the best display i have ever seen in any museum wolrdwide - they built a tropical rainforest within the CosmoCaixa building, not only you feel the dampness and heat of an actual rainforest, you also see the wildlife, mainly the biggest fish we had ever seen...

a different place to spend sunday's. one really intresting place to go whit the all family. fan and educative for any age. great court yard to relax. you will learn much and explain a lot.superb amazoian forest.

Interesting Exhibits, Great Price. After being gouged with tourist prices, it was refreshing to only pay a few euros to get in. If you have some extra time, it is worth coming here. It isn't the best science museum I have been to, but it is quite nice nonetheless.

Indoor rainforest is excellent!. We visited the science museum during science week which to our pleasant surprise meant that entry was free. You can easily spend a few hours walking around and trying different things but for me the highlight was the indoor rainforest which had various fish and birds in it. Well worth a visit!
Awesome exhibitions... for free!. We went there to see the impressionalists exhibition (till feb 2012). Masterpieces of Rembrand, Monet and much more painters are shown. Excellent!

Not just for kids. I am very happy we went this incredibly fun and interesting place. The experiments, the animals, the building, all were fantastic. The rainforest was the masterpiece. We spent only two hours and had to leave there wish to come and visit again.

best science museum ive been to. After going to mt. tibidado this is near the bottom and an easy side trip if your not too tired. I would def recommend with kids. We went with friends and had an awesome time too.
Awe inspiring. Off the beaten track, a little hard to get to (No. 60 bus), but well worth the effort. What a beautiful building, use of space, fantastic displays and the rain forest!

Wonderful museum and very cheap entrance fee.. The museum seems very new and well planned. The interactive pieces all work (which is unusual) and the main spiral access ramp is a work of art with strange acoustics were you can here someone speaking half way down as if they atre standing next to you!The massive rainforest exhibit is quire remrkable with arrowana fish, a capybara and an anaconda. Kids will ove it and it's a great way to spend a few hours if it's raining.
You can stay here all day. Great for kids from 6 and older. Do not count on eating here though.

A must for families with younger children. This museum is fantastic value for money with hours of fun for the kids for very few Euros. There is a large area with interactive displays explaining various scientific principles (more fun than it sounds) and a recreation of Amazonian rain forest which is worth the entry fee alone. Currently there is a display of dinosaur skeletons which will excite any child. The cafe/restaurant and shop are also first rate.The museum is out of the way on the ring road but is easily reached by public transport.Highly recommended
Very interesting to visit. is a place not to miss in barcelona... this science museum is relaxing and has so much interesting things... for me it was very inspirational place.
Best museum in the world !. The experience was great. It is little far from the centre but little effort to get there pays off for sure... we were inside for 4 hours and we did not get bored.
A little gem. well worth a visit to this museum. There is plenty of hand on stuff which is great for kids. The huge fish tank was unexpected! Visit the cafe and sit outside if you can.

Maybe the most beautiful science museum!. We visited CosmoCaixa with our children and a couple of ex-colleagues. We just did not have enough time to see it all, I could spend at least half a day in it. There are the usual things about waves, vibrations, motions etc., but set up in a neat way and some things are just original and beautiful. The kids loved it that they could interact with a lot of things.And there is the huge Amazon forest aquarium/terrarium. You can see the (big) fish, turtles, etc. underwater, walk through a part of the forest (feel the damp atmosphere) and see some underground things (like an ant nest).When we were there, there was an exhibition about Gobi desert dinosaurs, which was very interesting.The entrance fee is neglectable.

Great Find. Our family enjoyed this museum very much. We have traveled all over the world and go to lots of museums and this is a top quality museum. It is incredibly cheap, especially for Barcelona. It is a great hands on museum for all ages.

surprising. Wasnt really sure what to think of this museum before we went in, it had received good reviews but also wasn't sure it was somewhere I needed to go on a holiday specially as we are a young couple with no kids. We were however really surprised by it, it was amazingly clean and fairly interesting but really empty which considering how amazing it would be especially for kids on holiday or a school trip etc was surprising. I think this is maybe more suited to a family but we found enough to keep us amused for about 2 hours, the jungle area was amazing with a tropical rain storm and little birds running around etc.

Brilliant interactive exhibition.. Scientists and children will love this. So much to do and so many interactive exhibits. The space covered is vast, so take comfy shoes and expect to be here for at least four hours.
Fascinating!. This is a really interesting museum, and I'll definitely go back again. You could spend DAYS in here!

quietly brilliant. Four of us adults went here and were very confused initially - it was like a scene from 28 days later...there was no big entrance sign and it was dead, like no other people around, we thought it was maybe something to do with the university. We gingerly walked in and had to be pointed towards ticket desks - still no-one around. At a price of 3 euros we were very skeptical but bought tickets and went in, starting at the top. There were a few strange exhibits in Spanish and then we walked down long ramps where everything seemed closed, just a few interesting fossils on the way - they we found the ground floor and it was AMAZING. All the experiments kept us busy for hours and the amazon forest was cool too. Overall it was a mixture of natural history and modern science, with loads of interactive things. Great for kids and big kids alike. The on site cafe and restaurant is also pretty good.

Hidden Gem. We read the brief paragraph in the Loney Planet, had no real map to find it, but thought we'd have a go on our way back from Tabidabo. Glad we did! (look for the big submarine!)We spent many hours running around like the science-geeks we are, playing with all the experiments and exploring the amazon.Very different to the usual science/natural history museum! And so cheap!As two geologists, we loved the time line. What a great way to represent the true meaning of geological time!

Love, love, loved it. WE had a great time at the Barcelona Science Museum. The kids were engrossed in all the displays. We spent 90% of our time on the bottom floor...do not rush this area. We took the metro and then a bus right to the museum. Thanks to those who previously posted how to get there.

confusing.... it is a very big place with lots to check out. it's a shame that they don't suggest the visitors on how to go about the "museum". there were no signs on where to go first or next..well. it's best to start from the -5flr and walk your way up to the exit (which is also the entrance).there were some "games" to play with.

The best science museum for children!. We had great time in CosmoCaixa!Inspite of 4 hours we spent there children didnt want to leave it! We have been in similar museums in Berlin, Copenhagen( actually also very good one!), Rome, Vienna etc but this one we loved very much!!Take time and just visit it!
Nice. Very nice and interactiv place for a perfect price of some euros...There is much to see, and when you are lucky you can listen to a Prof. or someone else.

Great for a visit with children, but not only!. The museum showcases various items and devices which enact various phisics laws in an amusing manner, we had a lot of fun and learned a litlle bit. There was no one around to say "don't touch that' like it usually happens in a museum - since it is a very interactive place. The dinosaurus exhibition was nice too.Inside the museum there is small aquarium which can be seen from the sides but also! from underneath! :)Definetely worth the time and money spent!

Must go, especially with children. Although on city edge, easy to reach once you understand metro and bus system. Buy T-dia tickets at least (whole day). Very great natural science museum with dinosaur antouch anfd big tropical tree aquarium. Good for whole day tour. Lot better then famous Aquarium in Marina port. Very cheap to enter. Only few euros. OK little cantine to have a snack. Be early enough to get show/movies We missed out on that. None.Don't aslk other touists/locals how to get there. Seemsthey all don't know (exactly) But it is a must do. If bring kids do this and Illa de Fantasia waterpark
Great and cheap Experience. Worth visiting! For any age! You can learn many things! Ticket just 3 euros!

Most amazing science museum - Didn't want to leave... We visited CosmoCaxia with 2 young children (8 & 5 years). The admission was 2 euro! - a fantastic price for such an amazing museum. Most notable points:1) The museum was a visual delight, with exhibits that were artfully displayed and engaging for all ages. It was almost like visiting an art museum. We loved the tree! There was so much to do and we couldn't finish everything! We spent more than 5 hours at the museum and probably saw only half. We were too late to sign up for some of the special activites/labs -- when we got there they were already all filled up. The only complaint I would have was that these specific kid activities/lab were conducted only in Spanish but I can understand they couldn't accomodate all languages.2) The science exhibits were great. They tried to demonstrate scientific therory and principles in a a very basic manner. Our kids loved to try out all the exhibits - even though they may not have understood the scientific principles, they took delight seeing what each of the interactive displays did. There is something here for everyone.3) Amazon displayThis was a visually stunning display of habitat (with fish, brds and other animals). The aquarium with the fish alone will leave you in awe of what they've done. This was my daughter's favourite part -- one of the birds kept on gently pecking on her pinky toe -- which she found utterly delightful). You can watch the movie on how they built the aquarium and the labour,details etc., what went into putting the display together. The birds roamed freely and our kids loved that they were walking around them with no fear. 4) Cafeteria and cafeWe only went to the cafe for quick sandwiches and salds. The food was pretty reasonably priced and wholesome. (We were at the aquarium and the food wasn't as good.We would definitely go to the CosmoCaixa again!!! and again....
amazing..wonderfull... you have to go and seei cant say nothing about this perfect placeits amazing
go there...... superb site to take adult and child. for 3 euros a cheap good option.

Fantastic Science Museum, Incredible building. Great for kids, they really have fun... if you like architecture you will also like the building... full of interactive activities and temporary exhiubitions are usually very good..

CosmoCaixa -- an amazing science museum!. My friends and I ended up sending six hours there without getting bored, and we didn't even see the whole thing. A great value, especially for its low admission price. I'm definitely returning to CosmoCaixa in my next visit to Barcelona.
One of the best science museums in the world. Fantastic modern interactive science museum. A must visit in Barcelona. Excellent architecture and exhibits. Only €2 entry fee.

Stunning. What a place, not a lot I can add to whats previously been said -cheap,well laid out,great displays in Spanish,Catalan and English.The rain forest display was the best bit for me.The only downside for us was that our kids were not as excited by the science as the adults but having said that there were loads of interactive things for them to do which kept them well occupied for hours.The facilities are all first class even down to the cafe which has a great value buffet lunch if you feel like it.Its a bit out of the way so it was a taxi job for us,there is no taxi rank outside for the return trip but the staff at the information desk were really helpful and sorted it out.If we go back to Barcelona we will be heading here although hopefully with older more science focused kids!!!!!

Incredible. Probably the best science museum in Spain: huge, cheap, really interactive and full of interesting exhibitions. I was amazed! Do not miss the stone wall.
Although the shop was a bit pricey, the cafeteria was not.

Such a fun, cool and educational place!. This is hidden gem! The coolest science museum! We all enjoyed it very much from age 2 to age 70. Well and cleverly designed. Very interactive. Very well organized. Highly recommended for all ages. If you have children, it is a must to visit place.

For the inner child. Went there by mistake, not knowing what exactly we'll find... and we were AMAZED!Set in a cosmopolitan neighbourhood (close to the Tibidabo hill), CosmoCaixa has a very special architecture - it's actually built downhill, with the base level on the highest point, and the other floors downwards.Do not - i repeat - DO NOT! miss seeing this excellent museum. From the physics room (where every physics law has its own space and practical example), to the huge tree, sectioned so you can see how it grows over time (in the middle of the stairway), dinosaur skeletons, planetarium, (insert 1000 more things to see), right to the full-scale piece of tropical forest.The tropical forest is the most interesting place I've ever visited, everything is recreated like in the real one, with around 90% humidity in the air and walkable ledges, fishes and birds.Admission is very cheap, arount 2 or 3 EUR, with an extra 1 EUR fee if you want to see a planetarium show.Thumbs up for whoever had the idea of building such an amazing place. We'll be back here soon!

Do Not Miss This If You Have Time. You will need plenty of time to go through everything, it actually reminded me of a fun park. I had the most fun just going through all the experimental attractions, the atmosphere was exciting, I felt like a kid in high school!! By the way, entrance fee only 3€/person

The most fantastic science museum! Great for all ages, a very fun experience. We arrived here by accident when we tried to get to Tibidabo but found out that it was too late. So we jumped into the CosmoCaixa and boy was it worth it! Unfortunately we arrived too late for the planetarium, and had only two hours to spend there, but we could've easily stayed there the whole day. Lots and lots of scientific demonstrations in wave physics, optics, gravity, water, air flow; as well as biological and archeological exhibits. Everything is user-controlled and very interactive, with detailed yet understandable explanations. Very fairly priced (I think 2-3EUR) and well worth the time. Consider combining this activity with your trip to Tibidabo, you can reach it by the same bus.

Amazing - could've spent all day here. We only went because we got in free with the Barcelona Card (well worth investing for free travel on Metro, Bus, Train & Trams), but I'm so glad we did.We could have spent all day here looking at the exhibits, but our highlights were the optical perceptions/illusions area and the Amazonian Rainforest. For a family with kids, this would be a fantastic day out, but even for adults it was fascinating! I would strongly recommend a visit just for the Rainforest!

excellent value for money. superb and great value.without doubt the museum i've visited the most in barcelona. its a lot of fun and still buzz offf the walk through the jungle bit. even just gettting drink on the terrace is great.if possible avoid weekends and the first sunday of the month to avoid crowds and not being able to play with all the stuff.small picnic area if you're organised sort. which you probably are if you're reading this.

Amazing science museum, great for children. This is one of the best science museums I've been to. In addition the to the usual (and unusual) stuff to touch and experiment with, there is an indoor mangrove forest with birds and fish.My kids, who were 5 and 2, didn't want to leave after we spend whole day there.
